descriptionPlain:
One in two people experience debilitating back, neck, shoulder, or joint pain — but traditional treatments have failed to meet their needs. Physical therapy can be expensive and hard to access; appointments often involve long commutes and missed work. Making matters worse, unresolved pain can trigger the overuse of opioids and surgeries.

Join us in reimagining healthcare from the ground up. We’re making high-quality care accessible by pairing wearable sensors and computer vision with a world-class clinical team. Hinge Health puts a digital clinic in every member's pocket. Now millions of people can access personalized digital care from a physical therapist, guidance on behavior change from a health coach, and expert consultations with an orthopedic surgeon. With a single app and wearable technology like our Enso device, we’re helping to reduce pain, surgeries, and opioid use.

Work From Anywhere
Hinge Health Employees have the flexibility to work anywhere, within the country they are hired. 

About the Role
We are looking for a dynamic Accounting Manager with both operational and technical accounting skills. This role requires the ability to work well cross functionally to administer our commissions plans as well as be able to understand and help with complex financial reporting requirements.  This role requires exceptional business acumen, problem solving  and communication skills.  It is a high visibility role on our Accounting team that is integral to getting Hinge Health public-company ready.

The Accounting Manager will gain a comprehensive view of the sales compensation processes at Hinge Health. Additionally, the new hire will have the opportunity to play a key role in helping to establish public company reporting processes, collaborating closely with key partners.  The Accounting Manager will work directly with and present to various leaders including our VP, Commercial Operations, various Sales leaders and others. Exposure and the ability to influence others provides development opportunities and visibility critical to career progression and driving a positive impact at Hinge Health.

The ideal candidate will be someone who has successfully administered commissions programs, partnering closely with both sales operations and accounting. This person can bring an understanding of best practices and is capable of incorporating these solutions to build out a first class process.  Additionally, the candidate should possess a strong background in accounting, including the ability to understand financial statements and related footnotes, work closely with auditors, and strong project management skills, both with external and internal teams. 

#LI-KC1

lists.content:
• Responsible for administering the sales commissions programs, including sales commission calculations and payments. Generate and distribute commission statements to eligible employees and field related questions.
  • Execute incentive plans using commissions tool(s) to automate commission calculations and payments. Generate and maintain detailed documentation of policies and processes.
  • Partner with members of accounting, human resources, FP&A, legal and third-party vendors to compile financial statements and related footnote support
  • Assist with preparation of the Company’s periodic public company filings, including reporting calendar and detailed financials support.

• Meticulously organized and detail-oriented individual who has the ability to multitask; an independent and flexible problem solver who can cope positively with ambiguity while maintaining strong attention to detail and speed.
  • Exceptional interpersonal, written and verbal communication skills. A good listener with outstanding influencing qualities and a natural, effective consultative style.
  • Strong sense of prioritization - someone who is able to execute on projects within prescribed timelines in an environment with competing demands.
  • Highly analytical, able to problem solve and strong at building up systems and tools for scalability.
  • Extensive knowledge of Excel and G-Suite.

• Experience with Salesforce, Netsuite and with business analytics solutions such as Mode Analytics or Tableau
  • Prior experience with Sales Commission tools

• Inclusive healthcare and benefits: On top of comprehensive medical, dental, and vision coverage, we offer employees and their family members help with gender-affirming care, tools for family and fertility planning, and travel reimbursements if healthcare isn’t available where you live.
  • Planning for the future: Start saving for the future with our traditional or roth 401k retirement plan options which include a 2% company match.
  • Modern life stipends: Manage your own learning and development budget, use the mental health to support therapy costs, and lifestyle stipends to cover your favorite wellness services, and work-from-home equipment.
  • Flexible vacation and paid time off: Employees have flexibility to choose when, how, and why they take time off to rest and recharge. Exempt employees can take advantage of our flexible pto program. Nonexempt employees can utilize up to two weeks of sick time and up to 17 days of vacation per year, including mental health days.
  • Other compensation: At Hinge Health, we want every employee to be invested and rewarded in the future success of the company. All full-time positions are eligible for equity.

lists.content:
• You have extensive, hands-on experience with querying and analyzing large medical claims databases to inform payment and pricing recommendations.
  • You easily explain models and assumptions to colleagues with and without actuarial or analytic backgrounds. You work quickly and efficiently to meet deadlines and manage multiple, ongoing projects.
  • You are a subject matter expert who draws on empirical analyses, literature, and other sources to answer questions about cost and performance.

• Conduct analyses and recommend payment model conditions that maximize financial and clinical success. 
  • Monitors program performance to inform future contract design and pricing.
  • Develop business case analyses and budget impact analyses that forecast changes to medical care utilization and cost based on program implementation
  • Analyze utilization and cost trends using commercial and Medicare claims data
  • Explain forecasts, assumptions, sensitivity analysis and risks to internal and external clients
  • Build and maintain expertise in new and existing value-based and alternative payment models 
  • Compare actual ROIs with forecasts
  • Lead and participate in cross-functional workgroups with representatives from commercial, R&D, and clinical teams.
  • Manage personal and team projects; develop workplans; ensure documentation is developed and maintained.

• Bachelor's degree in mathematics, statistics, economics, actuarial science, business, computer science, or related degree.
  • Five or more years of healthcare actuarial experience, with an ASA or FSA
  • Analytics: Experience leading and managing analytics projects
  • Hands on experience with querying and analyzing commercial or Medicare medical claims data
  • Microsoft Suite (e.g., Access, Excel), SQL, and R expertise
  • Experience in insurance pricing, cost analyses, and provider analytics
  • Health system knowledge: Strong understanding of the US healthcare system
  • Experience with developing, negotiating, and implementing commercial and Medicare Advantage value-based care models and contracts
  • Communication: Strong written communication skills with the ability to create clear and concise memos and documentation
  • Skills in presenting technical concepts to a non-technical audience in an understandable way
  • Ability to represent team and company as a leader with customers, clients, and other employees in cross-functional meetings
  • Ability to work independently and in teams for projects with significant risk and financial impacts.

• Inclusive healthcare and benefits: On top of comprehensive medical, dental, and vision coverage, we offer employees and their family members help with gender-affirming care, tools for family and fertility planning, and travel reimbursements if healthcare isn’t available where you live.
  • Planning for the future: Start saving for the future with our traditional or roth 401k retirement plan options which include a 2% company match.
  • Modern life stipends: Manage your own learning and development budget, use the mental health to support therapy costs, and lifestyle stipends to cover your favorite wellness services, and work-from-home equipment.
  • Flexible vacation and paid time off: Employees have flexibility to choose when, how, and why they take time off to rest and recharge. Exempt employees can take advantage of our flexible pto program. Nonexempt employees can utilize up to two weeks of sick time and up to 17 days of vacation per year, including mental health days.
  • Other compensation: At Hinge Health, we want every employee to be invested and rewarded in the future success of the company. All full-time positions are eligible for equity.

descriptionPlain:
One in two people experience debilitating back, neck, shoulder, or joint pain — but traditional treatments have failed to meet their needs. Physical therapy can be expensive and hard to access; appointments often involve long commutes and missed work. Making matters worse, unresolved pain can trigger the overuse of opioids and surgeries.

Join us in reimagining healthcare from the ground up. We’re making high-quality care accessible by pairing wearable sensors and computer vision with a world-class clinical team. Hinge Health puts a digital clinic in every member's pocket. Now millions of people can access personalized digital care from a physical therapist, guidance on behavior change from a health coach, and expert consultations with an orthopedic surgeon. With a single app and wearable technology like our Enso device, we’re helping to reduce pain, surgeries, and opioid use.

Work From Anywhere
Hinge Health employees have the flexibility to work remotely in hubs across the United States.

About the Role
We’re looking for an individual with strong people management skills, to join us in continuing to build out our Technical Support organization, and enable a capable and dedicated team of remote technical professionals to ensure a world class experience for our program Members. This is a ground floor opportunity where you can make a big impact. This person will be a leader within the Support Operations organization, and will work closely with Senior Operations Leadership and regularly collaborate with other leaders within the organization, and across the company.

The Associate Manager of Technical Support, will ensure that Hinge Health's Technical Support team empowers the entire company, through expertly crafted Member interactions and support protocols. This individual will not only have the opportunity to coach and mentor a team of direct reports, but they will also be looked for to provide valuable feedback, new ideas and inspire forward progression through innovative processes with a focus on efficiency and scalability. Additionally this individual will be a key factor in ensuring that department KPIs are in healthy standing and will routinely look for ways to increase bandwidth and performance. Healthy team morale and a culture based around communication and collaboration are just some of the pillars of the Hinge Health Support Operations organization, and this individual will assist in maintaining these principles.

We’re positioned to continue leading the market with unmatched investments in clinical research, care innovation, machine learning, AI, and computer vision.

We also consider qualified applicants regardless of criminal histories, consistent with legal requirements.

We provide reasonable accommodations for candidates with disabilities. If you feel you need assistance or an accommodation due to a disability, let us know by reaching out to your recruiter.

descriptionPlain:
One in two people experience debilitating back, neck, shoulder, or joint pain — but traditional treatments have failed to meet their needs. Physical therapy can be expensive and hard to access; appointments often involve long commutes and missed work. Making matters worse, unresolved pain can trigger the overuse of opioids and surgeries.

Join us in reimagining healthcare from the ground up. We’re making high-quality care accessible by pairing wearable sensors and computer vision with a world-class clinical team. Hinge Health puts a digital clinic in every member's pocket. Now millions of people can access personalized digital care from a physical therapist, guidance on behavior change from a health coach, and expert consultations with an orthopedic surgeon. With a single app and wearable technology like our Enso device, we’re helping to reduce pain, surgeries, and opioid use.

Work From Anywhere
Hinge Health employees have the flexibility to work remotely in hubs across the United States.

About the Role
As a Technical Support Rep, your focus will be to help new participants get started and current ones get quick, efficient support -- developing strong, positive relationships with Hinge Health. You must be an excellent communicator, hard-working, organized, possess a willingness to learn, and be comfortable handling multiple projects simultaneously. A participant’s needs are constantly top-of-mind for you.

The role would be ideal for an applicant seeking an entry-level role. We’re a start-up, which means things here evolve at a rapid pace, so you should be comfortable dealing with ambiguity. But this also means you’ll have the opportunity to grow in your role, as the company grows too. We’re firm believers in letting you own your role and strongly encourage continuous learning.

#LI-ES1

#LI-ES1

lists.content:
• Assess participants’ support needs & provide solutions.
  • Develop extensive knowledge of our product, including common technical challenges and troubleshooting techniques.
  • Provide best in industry support, fielding inquiries and addressing them in a timely and professional manner through various software tools.
  • Ensure prompt and clear communication for participants while conveying warmth and empathy.

• Tech support experience (minimum two years).Excellent participant facing communication and writing skills.
  • Confidence managing multiple processes and workflows simultaneously.
  • Flexibility with your schedule.  Your work hours will be based on business needs and may include nights and weekends.
  • Able to effectively work in a Remote environment and be depended on for excellent punctuality and communication.

• Inclusive healthcare and benefits: On top of comprehensive medical, dental, and vision coverage, we offer employees and their family members help with gender-affirming care, tools for family and fertility planning, and travel reimbursements if healthcare isn’t available where you live.
  • Planning for the future: Start saving for the future with our traditional or roth 401k retirement plan options which include a 2% company match.
  • Modern life stipends: Manage your own learning and development budget, use the mental health to support therapy costs, and lifestyle stipends to cover your favorite wellness services, and work-from-home equipment.
  • Flexible vacation and paid time off: Employees have flexibility to choose when, how, and why they take time off to rest and recharge. Exempt employees can take advantage of our flexible pto program. Nonexempt employees can utilize up to two weeks of sick time and up to 17 days of vacation per year, including mental health days.
  • Other compensation: At Hinge Health, we want every employee to be invested and rewarded in the future success of the company. All full-time positions are eligible for equity.

• Healthcare background, and/or previous healthcare experience, especially startup healthcare experience.
  • Experience with customer support tools (e.g. RingCentral, ZenDesk, Freshdesk) and/or Google Analytics. 
  • Bilingual (Spanish, French)

descriptionPlain:
One in two people experience debilitating back, neck, shoulder, or joint pain — but traditional treatments have failed to meet their needs. Physical therapy can be expensive and hard to access; appointments often involve long commutes and missed work. Making matters worse, unresolved pain can trigger the overuse of opioids and surgeries.

Join us in reimagining healthcare from the ground up. We’re making high-quality care accessible by pairing wearable sensors and computer vision with a world-class clinical team. Hinge Health puts a digital clinic in every member's pocket. Now millions of people can access personalized digital care from a physical therapist, guidance on behavior change from a health coach, and expert consultations with an orthopedic surgeon. With a single app and wearable technology like our Enso device, we’re helping to reduce pain, surgeries, and opioid use.

Work From Anywhere
Hinge Health employees have the flexibility to work remotely in hubs across the United States.

About the Role
Are you a skilled behavioral scientist with a passion for understanding and influencing human behavior? Do you crave working in a company where you can put academic theory into practice, empowering millions of people to live healthier lives? We are seeking an individual to join our growing team as an Applied Behavioral Scientist. You will work closely with cross-functional teams at Hinge Health to research, develop and implement strategies that support people in leading healthier pain-free lives. You will collaborate with other behavioral and data scientists to establish and grow the impact of behavioral science on our product and services.

To be successful in this role, you should have a strong foundation in behavioral science theory, including biases and heuristics, choice architecture, and social norms. Experience analyzing and designing mixed-method research and the ability to effectively communicate and translate research insights to a diverse group of stakeholders. You love working collaboratively and teaching others.

lists.content:
• Conduct literature reviews to inform decision-making for R&D and clinical design. Disseminate findings via compelling written reports and science briefings. 
  • Stay up-to-date on the latest developments in behavioral science research and apply this knowledge to your work.
  • Support creation and delivery of trainings on behavioral science to stakeholders across Hinge Health. 
  • Supports behavior change operations by consulting on behavioral interventions, interpreting data from experiments, and developing a strategic view on member retention.
  • Effectively manage multiple ad hoc requests about member engagement and outcomes.

• A PhD or master's degree in a related field such as psychology, economics, or sociology.
  • Behavioral Science: You have a strong foundation in behavioral science theory, including biases and heuristics, choice architecture, and social norms.
  • Project management: You manage multiple projects at once from the discovery phase to execution within prescribed timelines, ensuring all success criteria are met.
  • Learn-it-all (vs know-it-all): You are always taking initiative to improve and get to the next level to support a fast-growing team.
  • Effective communication (verbal and written): You are able to communicate effectively with colleagues, management, and collaborators. This includes the quality of meeting prep and note-taking.
  • Effective and inspiring teacher: You love sharing your knowledge in accessible and strategic ways

• Experience working in a corporate or business setting
  • Advanced degree in behavioral science or related field
  • Strong project management skills
  • Experience in health related field

• Inclusive healthcare and benefits: On top of comprehensive medical, dental, and vision coverage, we offer employees and their family members help with gender-affirming care, tools for family and fertility planning, and travel reimbursements if healthcare isn’t available where you live.

descriptionPlain:
One in two people experience debilitating back, neck, shoulder, or joint pain — but traditional treatments have failed to meet their needs. Physical therapy can be expensive and hard to access; appointments often involve long commutes and missed work. Making matters worse, unresolved pain can trigger the overuse of opioids and surgeries.

Join us in reimagining healthcare from the ground up. We’re making high-quality care accessible by pairing wearable sensors and computer vision with a world-class clinical team. Hinge Health puts a digital clinic in every member's pocket. Now millions of people can access personalized digital care from a physical therapist, guidance on behavior change from a health coach, and expert consultations with an orthopedic surgeon. With a single app and wearable technology like our Enso device, we’re helping to reduce pain, surgeries, and opioid use.

Work From Anywhere
Hinge Health Employees have the flexibility to work anywhere, within the country they are hired. 

About the Role
We're looking for an individual who can drive both strategic initiatives and operational excellence by leading key project deliverables. This team’s mission is to drive scaling, efficiency, retention, and revenue for the Client Success team, with the focus on developing commercial reporting strategy, operations transformation, and program management of key cross-functional strategic initiatives.

Example project areas include:  
- Commercial reporting (e.g. partnering cross-functionally with data, product, marketing, and commercial teams)
- New revenue / retention strategies (e.g., new product rollouts, client health scores)
- Business outcome management 
- Scaling and transforming Client Success team operations 

The ideal candidate has had a mix of both strategy and operations project experience, as well as SQL proficiency. Start-up experience is a plus, but not a must as we look for individuals who can thrive in ambiguity. We are looking for an individual who can see the "big picture" but is also willing to roll up their sleeves to help us continuously improve.

lists.content:
• Strategy: Provide strategic insights to leadership in order to inform goals and future direction of the Client Success team, with a focus on operating efficiently:  conduct internal research, drive analyses of commercial performance / trends, and synthesize information prior to sharing with leadership
  • Operations: Contribute to error-free and efficient day to day execution by directly taking on, documenting, and continuously improving tools and processes for the Client Success team 
  • Strategic Initiatives Management: Ensure key strategic projects (e.g. revamping commercial reporting) stay on track by leading on key deliverables: encourage cross-functional coordination, provide visibility into key metrics, and ensure required buy-in is in place, including executives

• Systems thinker: Highly analytical, able to break down a problem. Builds robust models / frameworks aimed at solving problems.
  • Project Management: Able to manage multiple projects at once from discovery phase to execution within prescribed timelines, ensuring all success criteria are met
  • Change management: Able to influence stakeholders to affect process change. Thoughtful approach from planning to monitoring.
  • Data Analysis: Able to design, conduct, interpret and present quantitative and qualitative analyses. Proficient SQL / excel skills to work efficiently with the data team, run basic reports, and ensure quality of data. 
  • Communicate effectively: Communicate in ways that conveys both clarity of thought and rigor, while being concise - be that via prose or visual aids. 
  • Think long term: Focus on long-term value vs short term results.
  • Make results happen: Measure performance by results and impact, not actions or good intentions

• Healthcare experience is a plus
  • Tableau experience 
  • Consulting / Investment banking experience 
  • IPO experience

• Inclusive healthcare and benefits: On top of comprehensive medical, dental, and vision coverage, we offer employees and their family members help with gender-affirming care, tools for family and fertility planning, and travel reimbursements if healthcare isn’t available where you live.

descriptionPlain:
One in two people experience debilitating back, neck, shoulder, or joint pain — but traditional treatments have failed to meet their needs. Physical therapy can be expensive and hard to access; appointments often involve long commutes and missed work. Making matters worse, unresolved pain can trigger the overuse of opioids and surgeries.

Join us in reimagining healthcare from the ground up. We’re making high-quality care accessible by pairing wearable sensors and computer vision with a world-class clinical team. Hinge Health puts a digital clinic in every member's pocket. Now millions of people can access personalized digital care from a physical therapist, guidance on behavior change from a health coach, and expert consultations with an orthopedic surgeon. With a single app and wearable technology like our Enso device, we’re helping to reduce pain, surgeries, and opioid use.

About the Role
Physical therapists are the backbone of the comprehensive clinical care team at Hinge Health. Hinge Health Physical Therapists utilize their clinical expertise and knowledge of pain science to evaluate and treat patients across the MSK spectrum.  We believe in providing the best human-centered care by applying the Biopsychosocial model, evidence-informed practice, and innovative technology to help patients reduce their pain and achieve meaningful outcomes. Our physical therapists are on the bleeding edge of delivering MSK care enabled by advanced technology.  We are pioneering a hybrid approach through house calls and our digital platform, creating more accessibility and health equity for those in need.  Come join us if you are excited to help us define what the future of integrating in-person and digital care looks like!

This is not the traditional home health experience.  Think of it as an outpatient clinic evaluation conducted in a patient’s home.  Hinge Health Concierge Physical Therapists get to spend 1:1 time with our members, and through our digital platform and tools, improve the lives of many at scale. You will work with a diverse set of members within an innovative team of high performing, inclusive clinicians. 

This is a 6-month limited term role, with the potential to extend into a permanent position as we scale our operations in each metro.  Within our Flex workforce model, we schedule you a minimum of 32 hours a week with the opportunity to flex up to 40 hours or more a week.  Schedules will be provided at least 2 weeks in advance.

#LI-ES1

lists.content:
• Flexibility is critical to our Concierge Physical Therapist role!
  • You thrive in situations requiring you to constantly adapt and evolve.  Change is not a scary word to you, and you want to continually improve yourself, your profession, and healthcare as a whole
  • You are comfortable traveling to the patient homes and providing care in various settings
  • You are adaptable to offering a flexible work schedule that may include evening and weekend availability
  • You love innovating on the patient experience and are excited to build out this new model with us
  • You have at least 2 years of clinical physical therapy experience, consisting of 1 year practicing in an outpatient orthopedics setting evaluating and treating a variety of MSK conditions, and 1 year experience providing home-based visits.  
  • Graduate of an accredited Physical Therapy program with a Doctorate of Physical Therapy (DPT)
  • Licensed to practice Physical Therapy in Illinois.
  • BLS/CPR Certification
  • You must be based out of the area of Chicago and able to travel within your assigned region.

• Evaluates and treats patients utilizing a variety of validated assessment tools.
  • Knowledgeable about biopsychosocial model, patient-centered MSK care, habit formation models, pain neuroscience education, and evidence-informed practice
  • Provides high caliber of service resulting in high customer satisfaction and improved clinical outcomes 
  • Proficient in assisting patients with utilizing the Hinge Health Technology 
  • Manages patients safely and efficiently in varied environments 
  • Provide ongoing product feedback to continually improve the patient experience

• Clinical Decision Making: demonstrates excellent and clear decision making to evaluate, treat, and manage patients across the MSK spectrum utilizing a biopsychosocial model when appropriate.
  • Effective Patient Management: Manages a large and varied caseload of patients safely and efficiently, utilizing a variety of validated assessment tools to manage care and communicate effectively
  • Effective Communication: Able to communicate effectively and clearly, both written and verbally, with patients, colleagues, and other professionals 
  • Change Agility: highly adaptable to taking on new workflows, processes and challenges within a fast-paced environment by employing critical thinking and creative problem-solving
  • Savvy Technical Guidance: able to guide member through troubleshooting digital technologies and successfully adopting digital health programs

• Medical fluency in other languages (to be assessed by competency test)
  • Access to a car for transportation (reimbursement provided for mileage per IRS standard rates)

• Inclusive healthcare and benefits: On top of comprehensive medical, dental, and vision coverage, we offer help with gender-affirming care, tools for family and fertility planning, and travel reimbursements if healthcare isn’t available where you live
  • Modern life stipends: Manage your own learning and development budget and use the mental health and lifestyle stipends to cover your favorite wellness services, workout classes, gym subscriptions, and work-from-home equipment
  • Flexible vacation and paid time off: Full-time employees have full flexibility to choose when, how, and why they take time off to rest and recharge

descriptionPlain:
One in two people experience debilitating back, neck, shoulder, or joint pain — but traditional treatments have failed to meet their needs. Physical therapy can be expensive and hard to access; appointments often involve long commutes and missed work. Making matters worse, unresolved pain can trigger the overuse of opioids and surgeries.

Join us in reimagining healthcare from the ground up. We’re making high-quality care accessible by pairing wearable sensors and computer vision with a world-class clinical team. Hinge Health puts a digital clinic in every member's pocket. Now millions of people can access personalized digital care from a physical therapist, guidance on behavior change from a health coach, and expert consultations with an orthopedic surgeon. With a single app and wearable technology like our Enso device, we’re helping to reduce pain, surgeries, and opioid use.

About the Role
Physical therapists are the backbone of the comprehensive clinical care team at Hinge Health. Hinge Health Physical Therapists utilize their clinical expertise and knowledge of pain science to evaluate and treat patients across the MSK spectrum.  We believe in providing the best human-centered care by applying the Biopsychosocial model, evidence-informed practice, and innovative technology to help patients reduce their pain and achieve meaningful outcomes. Our physical therapists are on the bleeding edge of delivering MSK care enabled by advanced technology.  We are pioneering a hybrid approach through house calls and our digital platform, creating more accessibility and health equity for those in need.  Come join us if you are excited to help us define what the future of integrating in-person and digital care looks like!

This is not the traditional home health experience.  Think of it as an outpatient clinic evaluation conducted in a patient’s home.  Hinge Health Concierge Physical Therapists get to spend 1:1 time with our members, and through our digital platform and tools, improve the lives of many at scale. You will work with a diverse set of members within an innovative team of high performing, inclusive clinicians. 

This is a 6-month limited term role, with the potential to extend into a permanent position as we scale our operations in each metro.  Within our Flex workforce model, we schedule you a minimum of 32 hours a week with the opportunity to flex up to 40 hours or more a week.  Schedules will be provided at least 2 weeks in advance.

#LI-ES1

lists.content:
• Flexibility is critical to our Concierge Physical Therapist role!
  • You thrive in situations requiring you to constantly adapt and evolve. 
  • Change is not a scary word to you, and you want to continually improve yourself, your profession, and healthcare as a whole
  • You are comfortable traveling to the patient homes and providing care in various settings
  • You are adaptable to offering a flexible work schedule that may include evening and weekend availability
  • You love innovating on the patient experience and are excited to build out this new model with us
  • You have at least 2 years of clinical physical therapy experience, consisting of 1 year practicing in an outpatient orthopedics setting evaluating and treating a variety of MSK conditions, and 1 year experience providing home-based visits.  
  • Graduate of an accredited Physical Therapy program with a Doctorate of Physical Therapy (DPT)
  • Licensed to practice Physical Therapy in your state.
  • BLS/CPR CertificationValid Driver License with proof of valid automobile insurance and reliable transportation
  • You must be based out of the area of Seattle, Washington and able to travel within your assigned region.

• Evaluates and treats patients utilizing a variety of validated assessment tools.
  • Knowledgeable about biopsychosocial model, patient-centered MSK care, habit formation models, pain neuroscience education, and evidence-informed practice
  • Provides high caliber of service resulting in high customer satisfaction and improved clinical outcomes 
  • Proficient in assisting patients with utilizing the Hinge Health Technology 
  • Manages patients safely and efficiently in varied environments 
  • Provide ongoing product feedback to continually improve the patient experience

• Clinical Decision Making: demonstrates excellent and clear decision making to evaluate, treat, and manage patients across the MSK spectrum utilizing a biopsychosocial model when appropriate.
  • Effective Patient Management: Manages a large and varied caseload of patients safely and efficiently, utilizing a variety of validated assessment tools to manage care and communicate effectively
  • Effective Communication: Able to communicate effectively and clearly, both written and verbally, with patients, colleagues, and other professionals 
  • Change Agility: highly adaptable to taking on new workflows, processes and challenges within a fast-paced environment by employing critical thinking and creative problem-solving
  • Savvy Technical Guidance: able to guide member through troubleshooting digital technologies and successfully adopting digital health programs

• Medical fluency in other languages (to be assessed by competency test)
  • Access to a car for transportation (reimbursement provided for mileage per IRS standard rates)

• Inclusive healthcare and benefits: On top of comprehensive medical, dental, and vision coverage, we offer employees and their family members help with gender-affirming care, tools for family and fertility planning, and travel reimbursements if healthcare isn’t available where you live.
  • Planning for the future: Start saving for the future with our traditional or roth 401k retirement plan options which include a 2% company match.
  • Modern life stipends: Manage your own learning and development budget, use the mental health to support therapy costs, and lifestyle stipends to cover your favorite wellness services, and work-from-home equipment.
  • Flexible vacation and paid time off: Employees have flexibility to choose when, how, and why they take time off to rest and recharge. Exempt employees can take advantage of our flexible pto program. Nonexempt employees can utilize up to two weeks of sick time and up to 17 days of vacation per year, including mental health days.
  • Other compensation: At Hinge Health, we want every employee to be invested and rewarded in the future success of the company. All full-time positions are eligible for equity.

descriptionPlain:
One in two people experience debilitating back, neck, shoulder, or joint pain — but traditional treatments have failed to meet their needs. Physical therapy can be expensive and hard to access; appointments often involve long commutes and missed work. Making matters worse, unresolved pain can trigger the overuse of opioids and surgeries.

Join us in reimagining healthcare from the ground up. We’re making high-quality care accessible by pairing wearable sensors and computer vision with a world-class clinical team. Hinge Health puts a digital clinic in every member's pocket. Now millions of people can access personalized digital care from a physical therapist, guidance on behavior change from a health coach, and expert consultations with an orthopedic surgeon. With a single app and wearable technology like our Enso device, we’re helping to reduce pain, surgeries, and opioid use.

About the Role
Physical therapists are the backbone of the comprehensive clinical care team at Hinge Health. Hinge Health Physical Therapists utilize their clinical expertise and knowledge of pain science to evaluate and treat patients across the MSK spectrum.  We believe in providing the best human-centered care by applying the Biopsychosocial model, evidence-informed practice, and innovative technology to help patients reduce their pain and achieve meaningful outcomes. Our physical therapists are on the bleeding edge of delivering MSK care enabled by advanced technology.  We are pioneering a hybrid approach through house calls and our digital platform, creating more accessibility and health equity for those in need.  Come join us if you are excited to help us define what the future of integrating in-person and digital care looks like!

This is not the traditional home health experience.  Think of it as an outpatient clinic evaluation conducted in a patient’s home.  Hinge Health Concierge Physical Therapists get to spend 1:1 time with our members, and through our digital platform and tools, improve the lives of many at scale. You will work with a diverse set of members within an innovative team of high performing, inclusive clinicians. 

This is a per diem (as needed) role.

lists.content:
• Flexibility is critical to our Concierge Physical Therapist role!
  • You thrive in situations requiring you to constantly adapt and evolve. Change is not a scary word to you, and you want to continually improve yourself, your profession, and healthcare as a whole
  • You are comfortable traveling to the patient homes and providing care in various settings
  • You are adaptable to offering a flexible work schedule that may include evening and weekend availability
  • You love innovating on the patient experience and are excited to build out this new model with us

Beyond specific work experience, we also look for unique capabilities and skill sets that are key indicators an applicant will thrive in our fast-paced, frequently evolving environment. Work From Anywhere
Hinge Health Employees have the flexibility to work anywhere, within the country they are hired. 

About the Role
We are looking for an experienced Consumer Senior Product Marketing Manager with a passion for bringing new products and experiences to life. You will help us drive marketing research insights, go-to-market planning and launch of new products. You will also develop and execute marketing moments working together with Product teams, Creative, Enrollment Marketing and Comms. 
If you have a proven track record of driving marketing strategy and execution, care about understanding and delivering value to consumers, and are passionate about helping people move beyond chronic pain, we’d love to meet you.

About the Role
We are looking for an experienced Consumer Senior Product Marketing Manager with a passion for bringing new products and experiences to life. You will help us drive marketing research insights, go-to-market planning and launch of new products. You will also develop and execute marketing moments working together with Product teams, Creative, Enrollment Marketing and Comms. 
If you have a proven track record of driving marketing strategy and execution, care about understanding and delivering value to consumers, and are passionate about helping people move beyond chronic pain, we’d love to meet you.

lists.content:
• Develop marketing strategies with product leaders that align and provide value to company objectives
  • Leverage and conduct market research to inform of marketing strategies and develop knowledge of audience needs and wants
  • Develop messaging and positioning that clearly communicates our value prop and differentiators to target audiences
  • Collaborate with stakeholders to translate business and investment decisions into actionable marketing plans; inclusive of seeking budget approval and anticipating marketing results. 
  • Lead complex GTM campaigns across multiple channels
  • Write briefs for the performance, brand and creative marketing teams which define tactical and communication channel measures of success
  • Analyze marketing performance metrics, ensuring continued success to marketing goals
  • Partner with stakeholders to conduct trade-off analyses and inform priority of marketing efforts
  • Leverage expertise of the brand and performance marketing teams to identify testing opportunities, optimize marketing communications, and to incorporate findings into future communications
  • Build from scratch the consumer PMM function

• 10+ years of consumer product marketing or relevant experience
  • Bachelor's Degree in Marketing or Business, MBA preferred
  • Demonstrated ability of managing and prioritizing a diverse set of projects independently
  • Excellent communication skills, written and verbal; able to communicate at all levels of an organization and build trust with internal stakeholders
  • Strong project management and execution skills, leading complex projects
  • Proven track record of building and executing against powerful GTM strategies
  • Confident self-starter with a willingness to work both autonomously and with cross-functional partners, in a dynamic and fast-paced environment

• Inclusive healthcare and benefits: On top of comprehensive medical, dental, and vision coverage, we offer employees and their family members help with gender-affirming care, tools for family and fertility planning, and travel reimbursements if healthcare isn’t available where you live.
  • Planning for the future: Start saving for the future with our traditional or roth 401k retirement plan options which include a 2% company match.
  • Modern life stipends: Manage your own learning and development budget, use the mental health to support therapy costs, and lifestyle stipends to cover your favorite wellness services, and work-from-home equipment.
  • Flexible vacation and paid time off: Employees have flexibility to choose when, how, and why they take time off to rest and recharge. Exempt employees can take advantage of our flexible pto program. Nonexempt employees can utilize up to two weeks of sick time and up to 17 days of vacation per year, including mental health days.
  • Other compensation: At Hinge Health, we want every employee to be invested and rewarded in the future success of the company. All full-time positions are eligible for equity.

descriptionPlain:
One in two people experience debilitating back, neck, shoulder, or joint pain — but traditional treatments have failed to meet their needs. Physical therapy can be expensive and hard to access; appointments often involve long commutes and missed work. Making matters worse, unresolved pain can trigger the overuse of opioids and surgeries.

Join us in reimagining healthcare from the ground up. We’re making high-quality care accessible by pairing wearable sensors and computer vision with a world-class clinical team. Hinge Health puts a digital clinic in every member's pocket. Now millions of people can access personalized digital care from a physical therapist, guidance on behavior change from a health coach, and expert consultations with an orthopedic surgeon. With a single app and wearable technology like our Enso device, we’re helping to reduce pain, surgeries, and opioid use.

Here at Hinge Health, we welcome all applicants and know a diverse team makes us better and stronger. We look for individuals who embody our leadership principles and we value varied experiences and skill sets. Beyond specific work experience, we also look for unique capabilities and skill sets that are key indicators an applicant will thrive in our fast-paced, frequently evolving environment. If this sounds like the kind of place you’d like to be part of, please apply - we would love to hear from you!

Work From Anywhere
Hinge Health Employees have the flexibility to work anywhere, within the country they are hired. 

About the Role
The Design & UX Team is highly multidisciplinary made up of designers from all backgrounds (product, industrial, visual, motion, etc), researchers, content strategists, and program managers.
 
Come join us. https://www.hingehealth.design/

We are looking for a strategic Design Ops Lead to take our growth trajectory and execution to the next level. This is an exciting opportunity to drive a broad portfolio of company-wide initiatives and to be a force multiplier in order to help scale the growing Design and UX team here at Hinge Health! You will also collaborate with our cross-functional partners (product, engineering, operations, etc.) at all levels of the organization to identify and drive efficiencies and improve our ways of working. 

#LI-ME1

About the Role
The Design & UX Group is highly multidisciplinary made up of designers from all backgrounds (product, industrial, visual, motion, etc), researchers, content strategists, program managers, and more.

Come join us. https://www.hingehealth.design/

The Director of Product Design for Member Journey is a senior leadership role within the growing Hinge Health Design & UX org. This role will lead the teams responsible for our product funnel. This includes new product offerings which expand our ability to serve members, through Growth, Enrollment, Onboarding, and into Retention. 

This role is responsible for working with teams to iterate quickly on product experiments and pilots and should be well versed in using data to help their teams identify opportunities for UX improvements. The Director of Product Design, should be passionate about coaching designers and growing individual contributors. Additionally, this leader will build out a growing team.

lists.content:
• Lead our design team responsible for our growth, enrollment, onboarding, and retention metrics while using data to help the team uncover new opportunities and focus their work
  • You will partner closely with senior leaders of product, engineering, visual design, ux research, and clinical teams to cultivate new UX and technological innovation.
  • Innovate and build inclusive product experiences that caters to all communities to improve user engagement, outcomes, and retention by developing and shipping compelling consumer product experiences.
  • Hire and develop a diverse array of designers at scale to drive the best practices and methodology in an inclusive and psychologically safe environment. 
  • You will thoughtfully scale and foster a growing community of HH Product Designers and implement meaningful mechanisms & systems to help the team thrive.

• 8-12+ years of UX experience 
  • 7-10+ years of managing UX/product design teams
  • Proven experience managing other product design managers
  • Bachelor's degree in Interaction Design, Product Design, Industrial Design, Human-computer Interaction (HCI), or equivalent 
  • A strong portfolio of innovative, customer-centric design work that demonstrates proficiency in interaction and visual design.
  • Proven ability to both deliver a bold vision and iterate quickly on concepts to arrive at an amazing customer experience that raises the bar.
  • Solid history in leading UX, UI, HCI, product design and/or service design for consumer and/or enterprise native mobile and/or web-served apps
  • Experience in app redesign and rebranding; planning and developing design systems, and extending them to scale products in new and bold directions.
  • Ability to provide strong influence and impact on product direction by being a thoughtful, proactive partner with Product and Engineering colleagues
  • Excellent communication, presentation, and interpersonal skills including the ability to communicate design concepts clearly and persuasively across different audiences and at all levels of the organization.
  • Fluent understanding user empathy and how to creatively solve for ambiguous challenges
  • Masterful time management, organizational skills and executional ability.
  • Forge relationships with cross-functional partners by building trust among internal partners and driving influence in decision-making across the teams
  • Stong, committed, nurturing leader with proven experience scaling teams with high quality results, low attrition, and thriving team members
  • Demonstrates an awareness and sensitivity to the needs and concerns of individuals and stakeholders from diverse cultures, backgrounds and orientations

• Design innovator — you are excited to redefine a space by bringing novel, delightful ideas to the table. You are able to pull from unexpected sources of inspiration.
  • Master of many mediums — you design seamlessly across mobile, desktop, wearables and other interfaces

• Inclusive healthcare and benefits: On top of comprehensive medical, dental, and vision coverage, we offer employees and their family members help with gender-affirming care, tools for family and fertility planning, and travel reimbursements if healthcare isn’t available where you live.

This includes new product offerings which expand our ability to serve members, through Growth, Enrollment, Onboarding, and into Retention. 

This role is responsible for working with teams to iterate quickly on product experiments and pilots and should be well versed in using data to help their teams identify opportunities for UX improvements. The Director of Product Design, should be passionate about coaching designers and growing individual contributors. Additionally, this leader will build out a growing team.

#LI-ME1

lists.content:
• Lead our design team responsible for our growth, enrollment, onboarding, and retention metrics while using data to help the team uncover new opportunities and focus their work
  • You will partner closely with senior leaders of product, engineering, visual design, ux research, and clinical teams to cultivate new UX and technological innovation.
  • Innovate and build inclusive product experiences that caters to all communities to improve user engagement, outcomes, and retention by developing and shipping compelling consumer product experiences.
  • Hire and develop a diverse array of designers at scale to drive the best practices and methodology in an inclusive and psychologically safe environment. 
  • You will thoughtfully scale and foster a growing community of HH Product Designers and implement meaningful mechanisms & systems to help the team thrive.

• 8-12+ years of UX experience 
  • 7-10+ years of managing UX/product design teams
  • Proven experience managing other product design managers
  • Bachelor's degree in Interaction Design, Product Design, Industrial Design, Human-computer Interaction (HCI), or equivalent 
  • A strong portfolio of innovative, customer-centric design work that demonstrates proficiency in interaction and visual design.
  • Proven ability to both deliver a bold vision and iterate quickly on concepts to arrive at an amazing customer experience that raises the bar.
  • Solid history in leading UX, UI, HCI, product design and/or service design for consumer and/or enterprise native mobile and/or web-served apps
  • Experience in app redesign and rebranding; planning and developing design systems, and extending them to scale products in new and bold directions.
  • Ability to provide strong influence and impact on product direction by being a thoughtful, proactive partner with Product and Engineering colleagues
  • Excellent communication, presentation, and interpersonal skills including the ability to communicate design concepts clearly and persuasively across different audiences and at all levels of the organization.
  • Fluent understanding user empathy and how to creatively solve for ambiguous challenges
  • Masterful time management, organizational skills and executional ability.
  • Forge relationships with cross-functional partners by building trust among internal partners and driving influence in decision-making across the teams
  • Stong, committed, nurturing leader with proven experience scaling teams with high quality results, low attrition, and thriving team members
  • Demonstrates an awareness and sensitivity to the needs and concerns of individuals and stakeholders from diverse cultures, backgrounds and orientations

• Design innovator — you are excited to redefine a space by bringing novel, delightful ideas to the table. You are able to pull from unexpected sources of inspiration.
  • Master of many mediums — you design seamlessly across mobile, desktop, wearables and other interfaces

• Inclusive healthcare and benefits: On top of comprehensive medical, dental, and vision coverage, we offer help with gender-affirming care, tools for family and fertility planning, and travel reimbursements if healthcare isn’t available where you live
  • Modern life stipends: Manage your own learning and development budget and use the mental health and lifestyle stipends to cover your favorite wellness services, workout classes, gym subscriptions, and work-from-home equipment
  • Flexible vacation and paid time off: Full-time employees have full flexibility to choose when, how, and why they take time off to rest and recharge

descriptionPlain:
One in two people experience debilitating back, neck, shoulder, or joint pain — but traditional treatments have failed to meet their needs. Physical therapy can be expensive and hard to access; appointments often involve long commutes and missed work. Making matters worse, unresolved pain can trigger the overuse of opioids and surgeries.

Join us in reimagining healthcare from the ground up. We’re making high-quality care accessible by pairing wearable sensors and computer vision with a world-class clinical team. Hinge Health puts a digital clinic in every member's pocket. Now millions of people can access personalized digital care from a physical therapist, guidance on behavior change from a health coach, and expert consultations with an orthopedic surgeon. With a single app and wearable technology like our Enso device, we’re helping to reduce pain, surgeries, and opioid use.

Work From Anywhere
Hinge Health Employees have the flexibility to work anywhere, within the country they are hired. 

About the Role
We are looking for an experienced leader to join the Client Success team and lead our Emerging Accounts segment. You will have a unique opportunity to shape Hinge Health’s growth by leading a high performing team focused on growing and scaling our Emerging Accounts client base. This team is essential to drive overall success with our client base and achieve long-term company goals. 

The ideal candidate will have 6+ years experience leading high performing Emerging Accounts or SMB teams and managing 3+ individuals. Startup experience is a plus, but not a must. They are able to successfully manage and develop their team, and are also willing to roll up their sleeves to help navigate the complexities of day-to-day account management.  

#LI-KL1

#LI-KL1

lists.content:
• Team Leadership: Leadership and oversight for the Emerging Accounts team. Develop and implement strategic plans to meet OKRs including: implementation, retention, revenue, and scalability. Empower your team to spend the majority of their time on high-leverage, proactive work while holding team members accountable to our ambitious commercial goals. Provide strategic insights to leadership in order to inform goals and future direction of the team.
  • Team Management: Demonstrated success managing a team of 3+ including hiring, onboarding, training, and talent development. Empower your team to spend the majority of their time on high-leverage, proactive work while holding team members accountable to our ambitious goals. Hold team members accountable to our ambitious goals and actively performance manage under performers. Foster a strong team culture and ensure team members are doing the best work of their careers.
  • Emerging Accounts Operations: Own all initiatives aimed at increasing efficiency across the Emerging Accounts segment. Able to build strong internal relationships and effectively manage dependencies across the team and our cross-functional partners to achieve our goals and OKRs.

• Leadership: Provide direction through results-oriented team goals and OKRs. Build out the team and support the development of team members. Excel at high level strategy and value the intuition that comes from spending time in the details. Effectively allocate time between the two and recognize when something needs closer attention, especially when metrics and anecdotes don’t align. 
  • Change management: Able to influence internal and external stakeholders to effect process change. Can balance and lead through change in a fast growing and dynamic environment.
  • Relationship-building: Authentically builds relationships with others at all levels, including clients, partners, and internal colleagues Builds relationships as a trusted & respected thought-partner, not just as a vendor. Challenges the customer’s thinking through insight.
  • Product knowledge: Demonstrates subject matter expertise on our product and processes, with an ability to quickly learn new ones. Able to confidently address escalations and provide timely resolutions to both external and internal stakeholders.
  • Communicate effectively: Able to communicate with internal and external stakeholders in ways that conveys both clarity of thought and rigor, while being concise - be that via prose or visual aids
  • Think long-term: Does not sacrifice long-term value for short term results. Invest in the activities that set us up for success beyond the next month or quarter.
  • Create trust: Always acting in the best interest of our members, clients and the company.  Able to get buy-in from internal/external stakeholders to balance resource allocation with maintaining high client satisfaction.
  • Make results happen: Measure performance by results and impact, not actions or good intentions. Put maximum resources behind the highest leverage initiatives that will really move the needle.

• Experience at a high-growth company and understand the associated challenges
  • Have an understanding of employee benefits, digital health, and the startup work environment
  • Experience working with health plans and PBMs

• Inclusive healthcare and benefits: On top of comprehensive medical, dental, and vision coverage, we offer employees and their family members help with gender-affirming care, tools for family and fertility planning, and travel reimbursements if healthcare isn’t available where you live.
  • Planning for the future: Start saving for the future with our traditional or roth 401k retirement plan options which include a 2% company match.
  • Modern life stipends: Manage your own learning and development budget, use the mental health to support therapy costs, and lifestyle stipends to cover your favorite wellness services, and work-from-home equipment.
  • Flexible vacation and paid time off: Employees have flexibility to choose when, how, and why they take time off to rest and recharge. Exempt employees can take advantage of our flexible pto program. Nonexempt employees can utilize up to two weeks of sick time and up to 17 days of vacation per year, including mental health days.
  • Other compensation: At Hinge Health, we want every employee to be invested and rewarded in the future success of the company. All full-time positions are eligible for equity.

descriptionPlain:
One in two people experience debilitating back, neck, shoulder, or joint pain — but traditional treatments have failed to meet their needs. Physical therapy can be expensive and hard to access; appointments often involve long commutes and missed work. Making matters worse, unresolved pain can trigger the overuse of opioids and surgeries.

Join us in reimagining healthcare from the ground up. We’re making high-quality care accessible by pairing wearable sensors and computer vision with a world-class clinical team. Hinge Health puts a digital clinic in every member's pocket. Now millions of people can access personalized digital care from a physical therapist, guidance on behavior change from a health coach, and expert consultations with an orthopedic surgeon. With a single app and wearable technology like our Enso device, we’re helping to reduce pain, surgeries, and opioid use.

Work From Anywhere
Hinge Health Employees have the flexibility to work anywhere, within the country they are hired. 

About the Role
Hinge Health is looking for a Director of Enterprise Marketing to create and lead our employer marketing strategy, increase opportunity creation and accelerate deals to close. This includes increasing target account penetration and conversion with creative, cross-functional execution of ABM marketing campaigns; developing high-impact, highly used sales enablement toolkits based on customer insights, analytics, sales team feedback, and the buyer’s journey; and developing competitive messaging and assets to increase head to head win rates. You will report to our Sr. Director of Enterprise Marketing and will collaborate with a growing team of marketing and sales professionals to do the best work of their careers. 

The ideal candidate will bring a track record of building best-in-class persuasive and memorable campaigns for health and benefit leaders, preferably in digital health. You should have demonstrated success creatively and effectively delivering a company’s value proposition to target audiences to drive action. You should specialize in B2B marketing tactics, be highly organized, detail-oriented, collaborative, and resourceful. You are a great candidate for this role if you enjoy making an impact across the organization as much as delivering bespoke sales and marketing assets for individual prospects.

descriptionPlain:
One in two people experience debilitating back, neck, shoulder, or joint pain — but traditional treatments have failed to meet their needs. Physical therapy can be expensive and hard to access; appointments often involve long commutes and missed work. Making matters worse, unresolved pain can trigger the overuse of opioids and surgeries.

Join us in reimagining healthcare from the ground up. We’re making high-quality care accessible by pairing wearable sensors and computer vision with a world-class clinical team. Hinge Health puts a digital clinic in every member's pocket. Now millions of people can access personalized digital care from a physical therapist, guidance on behavior change from a health coach, and expert consultations with an orthopedic surgeon. With a single app and wearable technology like our Enso device, we’re helping to reduce pain, surgeries, and opioid use.

Here at Hinge Health, we welcome all applicants and know a diverse team makes us better and stronger. We look for individuals who embody our leadership principles and we value varied experiences and skill sets. Beyond specific work experience, we also look for unique capabilities and skill sets that are key indicators an applicant will thrive in our fast-paced, frequently evolving environment. If this sounds like the kind of place you’d like to be part of, please apply - we would love to hear from you!

Work From Anywhere
Hinge Health employees have the flexibility to work remotely in hubs across the United States.

About the Role
As an Engineering Manager, you'll support a team of 5 to 7 engineers to design, build, ship, and iterate on features that literally address end user pain points. You’ll partner with brilliant design and product leads to steer your cross-functional, full-stack product team toward meaningful outcomes that you define. Along the way, you’ll coach and accelerate individual growth, and guide your team toward the right metrics and feedback loops to empower its continuous improvement. Your strong technical background will inform your intuitions and Socratic questions throughout the Agile workflow, but you will rarely (if ever) contribute code directly to your team’s projects.

Your reports will be primarily working with React/React Native, Typescript, Redux, GraphQL, Node, and Rails.

Join us in reimagining healthcare from the ground up. We’re making high-quality care accessible by pairing wearable sensors and computer vision with a world-class clinical team. Hinge Health puts a digital clinic in every member's pocket. Now millions of people can access personalized digital care from a physical therapist, guidance on behavior change from a health coach, and expert consultations with an orthopedic surgeon. With a single app and wearable technology like our Enso device, we’re helping to reduce pain, surgeries, and opioid use.

Here at Hinge Health, we welcome all applicants and know a diverse team makes us better and stronger. We look for individuals who embody our leadership principles and we value varied experiences and skill sets. Beyond specific work experience, we also look for unique capabilities and skill sets that are key indicators an applicant will thrive in our fast-paced, frequently evolving environment. If this sounds like the kind of place you’d like to be part of, please apply - we would love to hear from you!

Work From Anywhere
Hinge Health employees have the flexibility to work remotely in hubs across the United States.

About the Role
As an Engineering Manager, you'll support a team of 5 to 7 engineers to design, build, ship, and iterate on features that literally address end user pain points. You’ll partner with brilliant design and product leads to steer your cross-functional, full-stack product team toward meaningful outcomes that you define. Along the way, you’ll coach and accelerate individual growth, and guide your team toward the right metrics and feedback loops to empower its continuous improvement. Your strong technical background will inform your intuitions and Socratic questions throughout the Agile workflow, but you will rarely (if ever) contribute code directly to your team’s projects.

Your reports will be primarily working with React/React Native, Typescript, Redux, GraphQL, Node, and Rails.

#LI-KH1

lists.content:
• Coach and mentor engineers through day-to-day challenges and guide them towards long term professional and technical growth 
  • Lead your team in consistently delivering on a roadmap they collaboratively define
  • Motivate engineers and ensure high performance through constant feedback and identifying areas of improvementDevelop robust, effective plans addressing various technical and resource challenges within the organization
  • Lead organizational initiatives on improving workflow processes and resolving them with practical, lightweight, measurable process 
  • Scale the team with a strong focus on experience, technical proficiency, and diversity

• Leadership: Track record of ownership for team-scale execution and technical excellence. Experience managing 5+ direct reports at a given time. 
  • Delivery: Strong project management skills to ensure the whole team is on track throughout the sprint and can sustainably deliver high quality work. 
  • Domain Expertise: In depth experience building software applications and the ability to propose several routes to accomplish business goals. Bonus for strong frontend and mobile experience
  • Problem Solving: Ability to resolve interpersonal conflicts, and find creative resourcing solutions where others would see zero-sum tradeoffs
  • Communication: Clear, inclusive communication with both teammates and non-technical partners
  • BS degree in Computer Science, Engineering or relevant field

• Inclusive healthcare and benefits: On top of comprehensive medical, dental, and vision coverage, we offer help with gender-affirming care, tools for family and fertility planning, and travel reimbursements if healthcare isn’t available where you live
  • Modern life stipends: Manage your own learning and development budget and use the mental health and lifestyle stipends to cover your favorite wellness services, workout classes, gym subscriptions, and work-from-home equipment
  • Flexible vacation and paid time off: Full-time employees have full flexibility to choose when, how, and why they take time off to rest and recharge

Work From Anywhere
Hinge Health Employees have the flexibility to work anywhere, within the country they are hired. 

About the Role
Hinge Health is seeking an energetic and self-motivated individual to provide executive administrative support to our Executive team. In this role, you will be supporting executives, handling a wide range of complex and highly confidential duties. This role requires excellent calendaring and prioritization skills, attention to detail, organizational skills, and the ability to manage multiple critical requests at the same time. While administrative duties will be part of your role, you will also be the main point of delegation for a variety of tasks to help build one of the fastest-growing digital health startups in San Francisco.

Candidates should have a minimum of 5+ years of experience supporting senior level executives.

#LI-NS1

This role requires excellent calendaring and prioritization skills, attention to detail, organizational skills, and the ability to manage multiple critical requests at the same time. While administrative duties will be part of your role, you will also be the main point of delegation for a variety of tasks to help build one of the fastest-growing digital health startups in San Francisco.

#LI-NS1

lists.content:
• Drive important meetings forward by scheduling and organizing external (client) and internal meetings and events in a timely manner.
  • Enable our executives to focus on high priority tasks via strategic calendar management and make recommendations to executives with regards to their time management, prioritization, delegation, and organization.
  • Reduce administrative burden on executives by performing an extensive array of core administrative tasks (e.g., expense reporting, booking travel, purchasing gifts, help managing low level initiatives and/or projects).
  • Enable meetings success by assisting with the production of materials and pre-reads, taking notes, and tracking actionables.
  • Increasing team effectiveness by planning and executing team events and on-sites, taking on ad-hoc team projects,  keeping a pulse on executives and team workloads, and helping the executive communicate across the team.

• Attention to detail: You are able to accomplish/complete a task while demonstrating a thorough concern for all the areas involved, no matter how small. 
  • Project Management: You have the discipline to organize and prioritize projects.
  • Problem-solver: You are able to apply critical thinking skills and exercise sound judgment in making decisions for your role.
  • Self-starter: You can work independently with minimal oversight/guidance, able to execute tasks and projects in an environment with competing demands.
  • Proficiency:  You are well-versed and comfortable working in Google Workspace (formerly G Suite).

• Inclusive healthcare and benefits: On top of comprehensive medical, dental, and vision coverage, we offer help with gender-affirming care, tools for family and fertility planning, and travel reimbursements if healthcare isn’t available where you live
  • Modern life stipends: Manage your own learning and development budget and use the mental health and lifestyle stipends to cover your favorite wellness services, workout classes, gym subscriptions, and work-from-home equipment
  • Flexible vacation and paid time off: Full-time employees have full flexibility to choose when, how, and why they take time off to rest and recharge

descriptionPlain:
Hinge Health is building the world’s most patient-centered Digital Musculoskeletal (MSK) Clinic™. It is now the leading Digital MSK Clinic, used by four in five employers and 90% of health plans with a digital MSK solution. Hinge Health reduces MSK pain, surgeries, and opioid use by pairing advanced wearable sensors and computer vision technology with a comprehensive clinical care team of physical therapists, physicians, and board-certified health coaches. 

Hinge Health’s HingeConnect integrates with 750,000+ in-person providers and enables real-time interventions for elective MSK surgeries, driving proven medical claims reduction. Available to millions of members, Hinge Health is widely trusted by leading organizations, including Land O’Lakes, L.L. Bean, Salesforce, Self-Insured Schools of California, Southern Company, State of New Jersey, US Foods, and Verizon. Learn more at: http://www.hingehealth.com.

ABOUT THE ROLE
The IT Specialist will partner and support internal clients to bring solutions to complex issues and provide timely, accurate, and professional assistance. This is an exciting opportunity to provide valuable expertise and collaborate with cross functional technology teams within the organization. A successful IT Specialist excels in a fast-paced, team environment and possesses excellent communication skills. We’re looking for an individual with a high degree of technical aptitude over a large scope of IT software, hardware, and networking disciplines.

ABOUT THE ROLE
The IT Specialist will partner and support internal clients to bring solutions to complex issues and provide timely, accurate, and professional assistance. This is an exciting opportunity to provide valuable expertise and collaborate with cross functional technology teams within the organization. A successful IT Specialist excels in a fast-paced, team environment and possesses excellent communication skills. We’re looking for an individual with a high degree of technical aptitude over a large scope of IT software, hardware, and networking disciplines.

lists.content:
• Resolve IT support requests quickly, adhering to security policies, while using empathy to build trust and cohesiveness with the team. 
  • Handle technical support cases through various support channels
  • Assists with hardware and software testing and reports on configurations and behavior, recommending improvements and break-fix solutions.
  • Recommends, configures, and installs computer hardware and software requests.
  • Demonstrate the ability to troubleshoot and resolve complex issues
  • Manage IT projects to meet pre-defined objectives
  • Provide in-person and remote support to colleagues to help them resolve technical issues
  • Test, evaluate, and make decisions about new technology for the business
  • Responsible for our hardware/software assets including license management.

• 3+ years of experience of IT Support/administration in a multiple operating system environment, with focus on Mac OS. 
  • Team-oriented attitude to help other colleagues and departments with technical problems. 
  • Administrative knowledge of MacOS and Chrome OS, Jamf and Google Workspace
  • A strong desire and focus on continued improvements and personal development
  • Comfortable with supporting hardware and networking requirements of a medium-sized office 
  • Strong communicator with strong time management and self-motivation skills
  • Experience with cloud-based software and asset management platforms. 
  • Analytical skills to study problems and records and identify solutions.
  • Troubleshooting of networking, hardware and software issues.

• Administrative Linux knowledge in an enterprise setting.
  • Knowledge of Google Workspace and Okta heavy, 0 trust, primarily SaaS-based environment
