Since our founding in 2014, we've raised more than $800 million from leading investors, including Coatue and Tiger Global. We work with 1000 customers across every industry and the public sector — including Salesforce, Verizon, and the State of New Jersey — to give more than 23 million people access to the care they need. We’re positioned to continue leading the market with unmatched investments in clinical research, care innovation, machine learning, AI, and computer vision.

Diversity and inclusion:
We’re committed to building diverse teams that reflect the communities we serve. Visit hingehealth.com/diversity-equity-and-inclusion to learn more about what moves us. 



Hinge Health is an equal opportunity employer and prohibits discrimination and harassment of any kind. We make employment decisions without regards to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, age, veteran status, disability status, pregnancy, or any other basis protected by federal, state or local law. We also consider qualified applicants regardless of criminal histories, consistent with legal requirements.

We provide reasonable accommodations for candidates with disabilities. If you feel you need assistance or an accommodation due to a disability, let us know by reaching out to your recruiter.


Disclaimer:
There continues to be a significant increase in phishing attempts across all industries where fraudsters are impersonating real employees and sending fictitious job offers to applicants in a scheme to obtain sensitive information. Please note that we will never ask for your financial information at any part of the interview process including the post-offer stage, and will only correspond through @hingehealth.com domain email addresses.

If you encounter any suspicious activity, we recommend you cease all communication with the individual and consider reporting them to the US FBI Internet Crime Complaint Center. If you would like to verify the legitimacy of an email you received from our recruiting team, please forward it to security@hingehealth.com.

*Please do not send resumes via email*

If you're interested - we'd love to hear from you.
descriptionPlain:
One in two people experience debilitating back, neck, shoulder, or joint pain — but traditional treatments have failed to meet their needs. Physical therapy can be expensive and hard to access; appointments often involve long commutes and missed work. Making matters worse, unresolved pain can trigger the overuse of opioids and surgeries.

Join us in reimagining healthcare from the ground up. We’re making high-quality care accessible by pairing wearable sensors and computer vision with a world-class clinical team. Hinge Health puts a digital clinic in every member's pocket. Now millions of people can access personalized digital care from a physical therapist, guidance on behavior change from a health coach, and expert consultations with an orthopedic surgeon. With a single app and wearable technology like our Enso device, we’re helping to reduce pain, surgeries, and opioid use.

Here at Hinge Health, we welcome all applicants and know a diverse team makes us better and stronger. We look for individuals who embody our leadership principles and we value varied experiences and skill sets. Beyond specific work experience, we also look for unique capabilities and skill sets that are key indicators an applicant will thrive in our fast-paced, frequently evolving environment. If this sounds like the kind of place you’d like to be part of, please apply - we would love to hear from you!

Work From Anywhere
Hinge Health Employees have the flexibility to work anywhere, within the country they are hired. 

About the Role
The Design & UX Group is highly multidisciplinary made up of designers from all backgrounds (product, industrial, visual, motion, etc), researchers, content strategists, program managers, and more.
 
Come join us. https://www.hingehealth.design/
 
The Scriptwriter/Writer creates blueprints and details of the script based on concepts or ideas. They develop story elements to translate the creative vision into stories for production, with a deep understanding of the storyline and target audience. As part of the production team, they work closely with cross-functional partners to review and revise the script to fit audience appeal. They review the work to ensure it meets required editorial standards. They also have an understanding of how to translate scripts to various visual media. They should possess strong grammar and writing capability, be creative, patient and motivated to work.
 
#LI-ME1

#LI-ME1

lists.content:
• As a Scriptwriter you will write scripts for product video, documentary shorts, and marketing projects or podcast programs. You might specialize in a particular type of writing and you might work on an original piece or an adaptation of an existing story.
  • Craft instructional, educational scripts for exercise therapy products and physical therapy guidance videos.
  • Create overall narrative arcs.
  • Break down narrative into blocks of stories (per episode).
  • Collaborate and develop storyboards within the Video Production unit.
  • Create scripts and voiceovers.
  • Participate in weekly brainstorming sessions with the video team.
  • Review interview transcripts.

• Portfolio that showcases your strong skills in scriptwriting, storyboard, and product design.
  • Demonstrate a track record in video storytelling, as well as strong research and writing skills.
  • Experience working at production and broadcasting companies.
  • Exceptional written fluency in English and be able to turn ad hoc stories around in a matter of days.
  • Excellent communicator with internal and external partners and need very little hand-holding to produce great scripts. 
  • Attentive to respond to daily inquiries.

• A 0 to 1 mindset — you’re comfortable navigating ambiguity, partnering closely with product and engineering teammates to make decisions quickly, learn from them, and iterate. You aren’t afraid to put something out there to get rapid feedback.
  • Design innovator — you are excited to redefine a space by bringing novel, delightful ideas to the table. You are able to pull from unexpected sources of inspiration.
  • Master of many mediums — you design seamlessly across mobile, desktop, wearables and other interfaces

• Inclusive healthcare and benefits: On top of comprehensive medical, dental, and vision coverage, we offer help with gender-affirming care, tools for family and fertility planning, and travel reimbursements if healthcare isn’t available where you live
  • Modern life stipends: Manage your own learning and development budget and use the mental health and lifestyle stipends to cover your favorite wellness services, workout classes, gym subscriptions, and work-from-home equipment
  • Flexible vacation and paid time off: Full-time employees have full flexibility to choose when, how, and why they take time off to rest and recharge

Work From Anywhere
Hinge Health employees have the flexibility to work remotely in hubs across the US, Canada, and Latin America or work from our offices in San Francisco, Portland, and Montreal.

About the Role
The Design & UX Group is highly multidisciplinary made up of designers from all backgrounds (product, industrial, visual, motion, etc), researchers, content strategists, program managers, and more.
 
Come join us: https://www.hingehealth.design/

We are looking for an Lead Visual Designer to bring to life our B2B marketing strategies across demand generation channels and experiential opportunities.

You will help lead the creative process, development, and execution for our 360 (multi-channel) demand-gen campaigns, and in-person and virtual experiential (trade shows, webinars, conferences). You will also help elevate our marketing content, driving a deeper understanding of the creative teams role and partnership across experiential opportunities and marketing channels.

#LI-JJ1

lists.content:
• Concept and present work to design and marketing leadership while generating enthusiasm and buy-in for ideas.
  • Deliver strategic and conceptual work that weaves brand story, messaging and value propositions across touchpoints and the customer journey.
  • Create holistic design solutions for a range of demand generation channels, including large scale conferences, industry tentpoles, interactive content, social, and guide video projects.
  • Demonstrated strong agency oversight to algin with company OKRs.
  • Educate partners and infuse storytelling through experiential interactions.
  • Work cross-functionally, balancing the needs of stakeholders and breaking down complex narratives into simple, compelling ideas across marketing and product initiatives.
  • Mentor and develop members of the design team's skills and process around a holistic approach to event marketing.

• 7+ years of experience in design agency or in-house
  • Experience with storytelling through brand narratives.
  • Expertise in building out hyper-localized regional events alongside national broad messaging industry wide events.
  • Experience with industry standard product design tools such as Adobe and Figma
  • Knowledge of current industry trends, formats, and event processes
  • Experience telling stories across multiple platforms
  • Experience with working alongside audio/video production and post-production
  • Collaborate with creatives, program managers, marketing leadership, stakeholders and production agencies to serve our range of audiences.
  • Build and maintain relationships with key vendors and agencies.
  • Strengthen the creative culture at the team, R&D and Commercial marketing level.

• B2B or commercial experience
  • Knowledge of Cinema 4D
  • Comfortable working with motion designers
  • Vendor management experience

• Inclusive healthcare and benefits: On top of comprehensive medical, dental, and vision coverage, we offer help with gender-affirming care, tools for family and fertility planning, and travel reimbursements if healthcare isn’t available where you live
  • Modern life stipends: Manage your own learning and development budget and use the mental health and lifestyle stipends to cover your favorite wellness services, workout classes, gym subscriptions, and work-from-home equipment
  • Flexible vacation and paid time off: Full-time employees have full flexibility to choose when, how, and why they take time off to rest and recharge

descriptionPlain:

Physical therapy can be expensive and hard to access; appointments often involve long commutes and missed work. Making matters worse, unresolved pain can trigger the overuse of opioids and surgeries.

Join us in reimagining healthcare from the ground up. We’re making high-quality care accessible by pairing wearable sensors and computer vision with a world-class clinical team. Hinge Health puts a digital clinic in every member's pocket. Now millions of people can access personalized digital care from a physical therapist, guidance on behavior change from a health coach, and expert consultations with an orthopedic surgeon. With a single app and wearable technology like our Enso device, we’re helping to reduce pain, surgeries, and opioid use.

Here at Hinge Health, we welcome all applicants and know a diverse team makes us better and stronger. We look for individuals who embody our leadership principles and we value varied experiences and skill sets. Beyond specific work experience, we also look for unique capabilities and skill sets that are key indicators an applicant will thrive in our fast-paced, frequently evolving environment. If this sounds like the kind of place you’d like to be part of, please apply - we would love to hear from you!

Work From Anywhere
Hinge Health employees have the flexibility to work remotely in hubs across the US, Canada, and Latin America or work from our offices in San Francisco, Portland, and Montreal.

About the Role
The Design & UX Group is highly multidisciplinary made up of designers from all backgrounds (product, industrial, visual, motion, etc), researchers, content strategists, program managers, and more.
 
Come join us: https://www.hingehealth.design/

We are looking for an Lead Visual Designer to bring to life our B2B marketing strategies across demand generation channels and experiential opportunities.

You will help lead the creative process, development, and execution for our 360 (multi-channel) demand-gen campaigns, and in-person and virtual experiential (trade shows, webinars, conferences). You will also help elevate our marketing content, driving a deeper understanding of the creative teams role and partnership across experiential opportunities and marketing channels.

#LI-JJ1

lists.content:
• Concept and present work to design and marketing leadership while generating enthusiasm and buy-in for ideas.
  • Deliver strategic and conceptual work that weaves brand story, messaging and value propositions across touchpoints and the customer journey.
  • Create holistic design solutions for a range of demand generation channels, including large scale conferences, industry tentpoles, interactive content, social, and guide video projects.
  • Demonstrated strong agency oversight to algin with company OKRs.
  • Educate partners and infuse storytelling through experiential interactions.
  • Work cross-functionally, balancing the needs of stakeholders and breaking down complex narratives into simple, compelling ideas across marketing and product initiatives.
  • Mentor and develop members of the design team's skills and process around a holistic approach to event marketing.

• 7+ years of experience in design agency or in-house
  • Experience with storytelling through brand narratives.
  • Expertise in building out hyper-localized regional events alongside national broad messaging industry wide events.
  • Experience with industry standard product design tools such as Adobe and Figma
  • Knowledge of current industry trends, formats, and event processes
  • Experience telling stories across multiple platforms
  • Experience with working alongside audio/video production and post-production
  • Collaborate with creatives, program managers, marketing leadership, stakeholders and production agencies to serve our range of audiences.
  • Build and maintain relationships with key vendors and agencies.
  • Strengthen the creative culture at the team, R&D and Commercial marketing level.

• B2B or commercial experience
  • Knowledge of Cinema 4D
  • Comfortable working with motion designers
  • Vendor management experience

• Inclusive healthcare and benefits: On top of comprehensive medical, dental, and vision coverage, we offer employees and their family members help with gender-affirming care, tools for family and fertility planning, and travel reimbursements if healthcare isn’t available where you live.
  • Planning for the future: Start saving for the future with our traditional or roth 401k retirement plan options which include a 2% company match.
  • Modern life stipends: Manage your own learning and development budget, use the mental health to support therapy costs, and lifestyle stipends to cover your favorite wellness services, and work-from-home equipment.
  • Flexible vacation and paid time off: Employees have flexibility to choose when, how, and why they take time off to rest and recharge. Exempt employees can take advantage of our flexible pto program. Nonexempt employees can utilize up to two weeks of sick time and up to 17 days of vacation per year, including mental health days.
  • Other compensation: At Hinge Health, we want every employee to be invested and rewarded in the future success of the company. All full-time positions are eligible for equity.

additionalPlain:
The range of base salary for the position is between  $102,100 - $185,500, plus equity, and benefits.  Please note that the base salary range is a guideline, and individual total compensation will vary based on factors such as qualifications, skill level, competencies and work location.

If this sounds like the kind of place you’d like to be part of, please apply - we would love to hear from you!

Work From Anywhere
Hinge Health employees have the flexibility to work remotely in hubs across the US, Canada, and Latin America or work from our offices in San Francisco, Portland, and Montreal.

About the Role
The Design & UX Group is highly multidisciplinary made up of designers from all backgrounds (product, industrial, visual, motion, etc), researchers, content strategists, program managers, and more. 

Come join us: https://www.hingehealth.design/

We're looking for a talented designer to craft compelling creative that drives people to enroll and engage with Hinge Health. Your work will help people dealing with pain to find the care they need to start healing and get back to the things they love. 
The Lead Visual Designer for Growth Marketing will help concept and develop creative across an expanding list of B2C channels including multi-touch campaigns, videos, paid media, landing pages, email, direct mail, OOH and more. Ideally, you geek out on data as well as design, and you're eager to optimize toward higher performance. As part of our growing Growth Creative Team, we’re looking for someone who can toggle between lead designer, out of the box thinker, creative problem solver, and user advocate.

You are going to thrive on the team if you have a fine-tuned aesthetic, love to iterate and make adjustments in real-time, and are energized with a curiosity to simultaneously take on the task at hand and explore how it can be amplified. 

We are looking for a creative, resourceful, collaborative, and highly effective A-player who will help us expand creative's role in helping people be pain free.

lists.content:
• Work with content strategists and creative leadership to concept, develop, iterate, and share out creative work with stakeholders and partners.
  • Build, contribute, and advance the growth team’s charter while supporting key marketing initiatives.
  • Be an active participant in creative kick-off meetings and reviews.
  • Implement feedback that pushes the work forward while also making recommendations on strong design directions and decisions.
  • Understand and have a learn-it-all mentality towards conversion, accessibility, digital best practices, and emerging technologies to help streamline creative work.
  • Build digital assets for growth channels like emails, videos, paid social and media content, direct mail, OOH and much more. 
  • Organize and maintain brand design systems and libraries to be shared by multiple creative teams.

• 7+ years of design experience; preferable in-house, agency or startup environment focused on B2C.
  • Ability to present your ideas and work with clarity and passion while demonstrating how the creative strategically answers the brief.
  • Advanced understanding and comfort with common creative tools like Adobe creative suite, Sketch or Figma, Google Docs and Slides.
  • Understanding of web, email and digital capabilities, limitations, and design best practices.
  • Healthy time management skills for a robust self driven creative process without cutting corners or compressing reviews and revision cycles.
  • Able to build trust and relationships among creative team and marketing partners by educating them on the process, advantages to design recommendations, and platform or tool constraints.
  • Able to deliver clear and timely design solutions based on feedback, deadlines, and project constraints

• Inclusive healthcare and benefits: On top of comprehensive medical, dental, and vision coverage, we offer help with gender-affirming care, tools for family and fertility planning, and travel reimbursements if healthcare isn’t available where you live
  • Modern life stipends: Manage your own learning and development budget and use the mental health and lifestyle stipends to cover your favorite wellness services, workout classes, gym subscriptions, and work-from-home equipment
  • Flexible vacation and paid time off: Full-time employees have full flexibility to choose when, how, and why they take time off to rest and recharge
• Motion design and or video production experience.

LinkedIn recently named Hinge Health one of the Top 50 Startups. Forbes, Fast Company, and Inc. have also recognized our technology, innovation, and culture.

Since our founding in 2014, we've raised more than $800 million from leading investors, including Coatue and Tiger Global. We work with 1000 customers across every industry and the public sector — including Salesforce, Verizon, and the State of New Jersey — to give more than 23 million people access to the care they need. We’re positioned to continue leading the market with unmatched investments in clinical research, care innovation, machine learning, AI, and computer vision.

Diversity and inclusion:
We’re committed to building diverse teams that reflect the communities we serve. Visit hingehealth.com/diversity-equity-and-inclusion to learn more about what moves us. 



Hinge Health is an equal opportunity employer and prohibits discrimination and harassment of any kind. We make employment decisions without regards to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, age, veteran status, disability status, pregnancy, or any other basis protected by federal, state or local law. We also consider qualified applicants regardless of criminal histories, consistent with legal requirements.

We provide reasonable accommodations for candidates with disabilities. If you feel you need assistance or an accommodation due to a disability, let us know by reaching out to your recruiter.


Disclaimer:
There continues to be a significant increase in phishing attempts across all industries where fraudsters are impersonating real employees and sending fictitious job offers to applicants in a scheme to obtain sensitive information. Please note that we will never ask for your financial information at any part of the interview process including the post-offer stage, and will only correspond through @hingehealth.com domain email addresses.

If you encounter any suspicious activity, we recommend you cease all communication with the individual and consider reporting them to the US FBI Internet Crime Complaint Center. If you would like to verify the legitimacy of an email you received from our recruiting team, please forward it to security@hingehealth.com. 

*Please do not send resumes via email*

If you're interested - we'd love to hear from you.

descriptionPlain:
One in two people experience debilitating back, neck, shoulder, or joint pain — but traditional treatments have failed to meet their needs. Physical therapy can be expensive and hard to access; appointments often involve long commutes and missed work. Making matters worse, unresolved pain can trigger the overuse of opioids and surgeries.

Join us in reimagining healthcare from the ground up. We’re making high-quality care accessible by pairing wearable sensors and computer vision with a world-class clinical team. Hinge Health puts a digital clinic in every member's pocket. Now millions of people can access personalized digital care from a physical therapist, guidance on behavior change from a health coach, and expert consultations with an orthopedic surgeon. With a single app and wearable technology like our Enso device, we’re helping to reduce pain, surgeries, and opioid use.

Here at Hinge Health, we welcome all applicants and know a diverse team makes us better and stronger. We look for individuals who embody our leadership principles and we value varied experiences and skill sets. Beyond specific work experience, we also look for unique capabilities and skill sets that are key indicators an applicant will thrive in our fast-paced, frequently evolving environment. If this sounds like the kind of place you’d like to be part of, please apply - we would love to hear from you!

Work From Anywhere
Hinge Health employees have the flexibility to work remotely in hubs across the US, Canada, and Latin America or work from our offices in San Francisco, Portland, and Montreal.

About the Role
The Design & UX Group is highly multidisciplinary made up of designers from all backgrounds (product, industrial, visual, motion, etc), researchers, content strategists, program managers, and more. 

Come join us: https://www.hingehealth.design/

We're looking for a talented designer to craft compelling creative that drives people to enroll and engage with Hinge Health. Your work will help people dealing with pain to find the care they need to start healing and get back to the things they love. 
The Lead Visual Designer for Growth Marketing will help concept and develop creative across an expanding list of B2C channels including multi-touch campaigns, videos, paid media, landing pages, email, direct mail, OOH and more. Ideally, you geek out on data as well as design, and you're eager to optimize toward higher performance. As part of our growing Growth Creative Team, we’re looking for someone who can toggle between lead designer, out of the box thinker, creative problem solver, and user advocate.

You are going to thrive on the team if you have a fine-tuned aesthetic, love to iterate and make adjustments in real-time, and are energized with a curiosity to simultaneously take on the task at hand and explore how it can be amplified. 

We are looking for a creative, resourceful, collaborative, and highly effective A-player who will help us expand creative's role in helping people be pain free. 

*All applicants must have a professional level of mastery in English
*Please submit resumes & Applications in English.

lists.content:
• Work with content strategists and creative leadership to concept, develop, iterate, and share out creative work with stakeholders and partners.
  • Build, contribute, and advance the growth team’s charter while supporting key marketing initiatives.
  • Be an active participant in creative kick-off meetings and reviews.
  • Implement feedback that pushes the work forward while also making recommendations on strong design directions and decisions.
  • Understand and have a learn-it-all mentality towards conversion, accessibility, digital best practices, and emerging technologies to help streamline creative work.
  • Build digital assets for growth channels like emails, videos, paid social and media content, direct mail, OOH and much more. 
  • Organize and maintain brand design systems and libraries to be shared by multiple creative teams.

• 7+ years of design experience; preferable in-house, agency or startup environment focused on B2C.
  • Ability to present your ideas and work with clarity and passion while demonstrating how the creative strategically answers the brief.
  • Advanced understanding and comfort with common creative tools like Adobe creative suite, Sketch or Figma, Google Docs and Slides.
  • Understanding of web, email and digital capabilities, limitations, and design best practices.
  • Healthy time management skills for a robust self driven creative process without cutting corners or compressing reviews and revision cycles.
  • Able to build trust and relationships among creative team and marketing partners by educating them on the process, advantages to design recommendations, and platform or tool constraints.
  • Able to deliver clear and timely design solutions based on feedback, deadlines, and project constraints

• Inclusive healthcare and benefits: On top of comprehensive medical, dental, and vision coverage, we offer help with gender-affirming care, tools for family and fertility planning, and travel reimbursements if healthcare isn’t available where you live
  • Modern life stipends: Manage your own learning and development budget and use the mental health and lifestyle stipends to cover your favorite wellness services, workout classes, gym subscriptions, and work-from-home equipment
  • Flexible vacation and paid time off: Full-time employees have full flexibility to choose when, how, and why they take time off to rest and recharge
• Motion design and or video production experience.

Beyond specific work experience, we also look for unique capabilities and skill sets that are key indicators an applicant will thrive in our fast-paced, frequently evolving environment. If this sounds like the kind of place you’d like to be part of, please apply - we would love to hear from you!

Work From Anywhere
Hinge Health employees have the flexibility to work remotely in hubs across the US, Canada, and Latin America or work from our offices in San Francisco, Portland, and Montreal.

About the Role
The Design & UX Group is highly multidisciplinary made up of designers from all backgrounds (product, industrial, visual, motion, etc), researchers, content strategists, program managers, and more.
 
Come join us. https://www.hingehealth.design/

Summary of the role: 
Mission Driven: We’re looking for a mission-driven individual to join us in creating engaging and effective experiences to empower successful behavioral health change. 

Thought Leader: This person will be a thought leader and key contributor within the Design and R+D teams, and will work closely with Engineering, Product, and Clinical teams at Hinge Health.

Craft: You will be responsible for owning and building the foundations of our UI Design language and be a key contributor to our design systems efforts. 

Ownership: With ownership for Hinge Health’s look and feel, you will also work cross functionally across other products and shepherd teams through this time of innovation. 

Mentorship: You will bring practice improvement, thought leadership, creative thinking, and mentorship for less experienced designers.


Description of an ideal candidate 
Craft: Ideal experiences would be in UX, UI, HCI, product design and/or service design for consumer, native mobile and/or web-served apps. 

Scale: Proven experience creating and designing UI systems at scale and build UI design language for scale

User Empathy: We’re looking for an individual who always begins with and returns to the end user; is comfortable sketching, prototyping, and iterating quickly to share and validate; can see the "big picture" with a strong desire to continuously improve every detail of our user experience. 

Principles: You have a solid command over UX and UI best practices. You bring strength in layout, details, and visual hierarchy to support usability and brand presence. 

Leadership: You subtly and effectively use those skills to critique and mentor other designers so we can all grow our skills and design a better product and journey for our users.

 #LI-ME1

lists.content:
• Create and lead service experience vision; identify and visualize opportunities to offer new services that benefit our members 
  • Work with operations to create pilots and experience prototypes to test new offerings, scaling the best solutions to make big impacts on our members health outcomes.
  • Be a steward of great service design by ensuring solutions set high human-centered quality standards
  • Collaborate with Product to identify and codify service requirements, based on user needs and business needs
  • Identify most important needs and opportunities for user research efforts 
  • Communicate design vision and interaction with experience prototypes, presentations, and channel or touchpoint blueprints
  • Partner with leadership in pioneering a healthcare experience known for its user-friendly experience and ease of use. Collaborate with Engineering, Operations, Marketing and Clinical teams on process improvements
  • You will lead as a strong systems thinker, set high service design quality standards for the Design and UX team to promote a unified experience across Hinge Health’s offerings
  • You will help bring service design practices, thought leadership, creative thinking, and mentorship for less experienced designers

• 7+ years of experience
  • Portfolio that showcases your experience creating compelling new UI design and visual product experiences
  • Bachelor's degree in Interaction Design, Product Design, Human-computer Interaction (HCI), or equivalent 
  • Proven experience creating and shipping net new user interface design at scale
  • Expert understanding of visual systems and best practices, including layout, typography and have a curiosity and eye for pushing visual design in interfaces forward
  • Experience building and working with design systems, and ability to extend them to scale products in new and bold directions
  • Proven ability to communicate deep design thinking at all levels of the organization
  • Proficiency in Sketch, Figma, Adobe Creative Suite, Invision; iOS/Android native app patterns, responsive/HTML/CSS design
  • Experience collaborating with motion designers and illustrators
  • Experience designing for mobile apps or other interactive digital platforms.

• Inclusive healthcare and benefits: On top of comprehensive medical, dental, and vision coverage, we offer employees and their family members help with gender-affirming care, tools for family and fertility planning, and travel reimbursements if healthcare isn’t available where you live.
  • Planning for the future: Start saving for the future with our traditional or roth 401k retirement plan options which include a 2% company match.
  • Modern life stipends: Manage your own learning and development budget, use the mental health to support therapy costs, and lifestyle stipends to cover your favorite wellness services, and work-from-home equipment.
  • Flexible vacation and paid time off: Employees have flexibility to choose when, how, and why they take time off to rest and recharge. Exempt employees can take advantage of our flexible pto program. Nonexempt employees can utilize up to two weeks of sick time and up to 17 days of vacation per year, including mental health days.
  • Other compensation: At Hinge Health, we want every employee to be invested and rewarded in the future success of the company. All full-time positions are eligible for equity.

• A 0 to 1 mindset — you’re comfortable navigating ambiguity, partnering closely with product and engineering teammates to make decisions quickly, learn from them, and iterate. You aren’t afraid to put something out there to get rapid feedback.
  • Design innovator — you are excited to redefine a space by bringing novel, delightful ideas to the table. You are able to pull from unexpected sources of inspiration.
  • Master of many mediums — you design seamlessly across mobile, desktop, wearables and other interfaces

Craft: Ideal experiences would be in UX, UI, HCI, product design and/or service design for consumer, native mobile and/or web-served apps. 

Scale: Proven experience creating and designing UI systems at scale and build UI design language for scale

User Empathy: We’re looking for an individual who always begins with and returns to the end user; is comfortable sketching, prototyping, and iterating quickly to share and validate; can see the "big picture" with a strong desire to continuously improve every detail of our user experience. 

Principles: You have a solid command over UX and UI best practices. You bring strength in layout, details, and visual hierarchy to support usability and brand presence. 

Leadership: You subtly and effectively use those skills to critique and mentor other designers so we can all grow our skills and design a better product and journey for our users.

 #LI-ME1
description:
One in two people experience debilitating back, neck, shoulder, or joint pain — but traditional treatments have failed to meet their needs. Physical therapy can be expensive and hard to access; appointments often involve long commutes and missed work. Making matters worse, unresolved pain can trigger the overuse of opioids and surgeries.

Join us in reimagining healthcare from the ground up. We’re making high-quality care accessible by pairing wearable sensors and computer vision with a world-class clinical team. Hinge Health puts a digital clinic in every member's pocket. Now millions of people can access personalized digital care from a physical therapist, guidance on behavior change from a health coach, and expert consultations with an orthopedic surgeon. With a single app and wearable technology like our Enso device, we’re helping to reduce pain, surgeries, and opioid use.

Here at Hinge Health, we welcome all applicants and know a diverse team makes us better and stronger. We look for individuals who embody our leadership principles and we value varied experiences and skill sets. Beyond specific work experience, we also look for unique capabilities and skill sets that are key indicators an applicant will thrive in our fast-paced, frequently evolving environment. If this sounds like the kind of place you’d like to be part of, please apply - we would love to hear from you!

Work From Anywhere
Hinge Health employees have the flexibility to work remotely in hubs across the US, Canada, and Latin America or work from our offices in San Francisco, Portland, and Montreal.

About the Role
The Design & UX Group is highly multidisciplinary made up of designers from all backgrounds (product, industrial, visual, motion, etc), researchers, content strategists, program managers, and more.
 
Come join us. https://www.hingehealth.design/

Summary of the role:
Mission Driven: We’re looking for a mission-driven individual to join us in creating engaging and effective experiences to empower successful behavioral health change. 

Thought Leader: This person will be a thought leader and key contributor within the Design and R+D teams, and will work closely with Engineering, Product, and Clinical teams at Hinge Health.

Craft: You will be responsible for owning and building the foundations of our UI Design language and be a key contributor to our design systems efforts. 

Ownership: With ownership for Hinge Health’s look and feel, you will also work cross functionally across other products and shepherd teams through this time of innovation. 

Mentorship: You will bring practice improvement, thought leadership, creative thinking, and mentorship for less experienced designers.


Description of an ideal candidate
Craft: Ideal experiences would be in UX, UI, HCI, product design and/or service design for consumer, native mobile and/or web-served apps. 

Scale: Proven experience creating and designing UI systems at scale and build UI design language for scale

User Empathy: We’re looking for an individual who always begins with and returns to the end user; is comfortable sketching, prototyping, and iterating quickly to share and validate; can see the "big picture" with a strong desire to continuously improve every detail of our user experience. 

Principles: You have a solid command over UX and UI best practices. You bring strength in layout, details, and visual hierarchy to support usability and brand presence. 

Leadership: You subtly and effectively use those skills to critique and mentor other designers so we can all grow our skills and design a better product and journey for our users.

 #LI-ME1

lists.content:
• Create and lead service experience vision; identify and visualize opportunities to offer new services that benefit our members 
  • Work with operations to create pilots and experience prototypes to test new offerings, scaling the best solutions to make big impacts on our members health outcomes.
  • Be a steward of great service design by ensuring solutions set high human-centered quality standards
  • Collaborate with Product to identify and codify service requirements, based on user needs and business needs
  • Identify most important needs and opportunities for user research efforts 
  • Communicate design vision and interaction with experience prototypes, presentations, and channel or touchpoint blueprints
  • Partner with leadership in pioneering a healthcare experience known for its user-friendly experience and ease of use. Collaborate with Engineering, Operations, Marketing and Clinical teams on process improvements
  • You will lead as a strong systems thinker, set high service design quality standards for the Design and UX team to promote a unified experience across Hinge Health’s offerings
  • You will help bring service design practices, thought leadership, creative thinking, and mentorship for less experienced designers

• 7+ years of experience
  • Portfolio that showcases your experience creating compelling new UI design and visual product experiences
  • Bachelor's degree in Interaction Design, Product Design, Human-computer Interaction (HCI), or equivalent 
  • Proven experience creating and shipping net new user interface design at scale
  • Expert understanding of visual systems and best practices, including layout, typography and have a curiosity and eye for pushing visual design in interfaces forward
  • Experience building and working with design systems, and ability to extend them to scale products in new and bold directions
  • Proven ability to communicate deep design thinking at all levels of the organization
  • Proficiency in Sketch, Figma, Adobe Creative Suite, Invision; iOS/Android native app patterns, responsive/HTML/CSS design
  • Experience collaborating with motion designers and illustrators
  • Experience designing for mobile apps or other interactive digital platforms.

• Inclusive healthcare and benefits: On top of comprehensive medical, dental, and vision coverage, we offer employees and their family members help with gender-affirming care, tools for family and fertility planning, and travel reimbursements if healthcare isn’t available where you live.
  • Planning for the future: Start saving for the future with our traditional or roth 401k retirement plan options which include a 2% company match.
  • Modern life stipends: Manage your own learning and development budget, use the mental health to support therapy costs, and lifestyle stipends to cover your favorite wellness services, and work-from-home equipment.
  • Flexible vacation and paid time off: Employees have flexibility to choose when, how, and why they take time off to rest and recharge. Exempt employees can take advantage of our flexible pto program. Nonexempt employees can utilize up to two weeks of sick time and up to 17 days of vacation per year, including mental health days.
  • Other compensation: At Hinge Health, we want every employee to be invested and rewarded in the future success of the company. All full-time positions are eligible for equity.

• A 0 to 1 mindset — you’re comfortable navigating ambiguity, partnering closely with product and engineering teammates to make decisions quickly, learn from them, and iterate. You aren’t afraid to put something out there to get rapid feedback.
  • Design innovator — you are excited to redefine a space by bringing novel, delightful ideas to the table. You are able to pull from unexpected sources of inspiration.
  • Master of many mediums — you design seamlessly across mobile, desktop, wearables and other interfaces

lists.content:
• The People Experience L&D Manager will collaborate effectively with stakeholders at various levels of the organization. This role combines deep expertise in adult learning best practices while using a consultative approach and program management capabilities. The L&D manager will be skilled with delivering live virtual sessions in a blended learning cohort format. 
  • The L&D Manager will additionally have experience creating and developing content using Google with eLearning platforms (such as Articulate Storyline and RISE) as well as with learning curation tools (such as LinkedIN Learning, Percipio or Degreed). You should have some proficiency with the administration of courses using LMS systems.

• Collaborate with stakeholders and SMEs across the organization to assess learning needs, create and implement impactful learning content and development programs
  • Apply knowledge of adult learning theories and principles in instructional design and curriculum development to deliver timely, effective training solutions.
  • Manage administration details and lead cohorts or facilitate training for new hire onboarding and other learning programs as needed
  • Plan, design, develop, deliver, evaluate, and continually improve curricula and ongoing development programs as needed 
  • Manage learners and content creation in learning curation and LMS systems
  • Audit, monitor and evaluate the quality and effectiveness of learning events and programs, determine impact and make recommendations for improvement
  • Assist with activities that drive successful achievement of learning KPIs
  • Facilitate and/or participate in training classes, working sessions and team building activities as needed

• You apply current and innovative adult learning and instructional design theories and techniques to analyze, design, develop, implement, evaluate, and modify learning programs.  You execute sustainable and scalable learning strategies that drive business results and outcomes. 
  • Proactive Partner:  You tap into your knowledge as an adult learning SME to provide L&D thought partnership. You collaborate with leadership and stakeholders to determine causes for knowledge and/or performance gaps and translate those insights into training solutions that improve organizational effectiveness and further development goals within the organization.
  • Program Management: You are able to transition easily between planning and problem-solving to design, develop, and facilitate training. You excel at managing and coordinating many moving projects, tasks, and timelines simultaneously. You work effectively with and through others to accomplish objectives. You are able to prioritize tasks appropriately and shift priorities accordingly.
  • Effective Communicator: You are a natural facilitator and have excellent coaching and communication skills that empower others to change their behaviors when necessary. You are adept at developing and delivering clear communications that simplify complex messages for various learners. 
  • Technical Expertise: Experience developing training presentations with Google Slides or MS PowerPoint. Experience with video conferencing tools (Google Meet, Zoom or similar). Experience with screen capture tools and video recording. Experience with LMS systems, virtual classroom tools or other online platforms conducive to virtual group learning and engagement. Experience developing eLearning using authoring tools such as Articulate Storyline, Rise or Adobe Captivate or Camtasia is preferred. Experience curating learning content using Degreed, LinkedIN Learning, Percipio or similar preferred.
  • Agile and Action Oriented:  You have a growth mindset and take a positive and proactive approach to your work. You take on new opportunities and tough challenges with a sense of urgency, high energy, and enthusiasm. You display a can-do attitude and step up to handle tough issues. You are a quick learner who demonstrates agility and adaptability.  You are able to pivot when necessary to meet business needs.
  • Manages Change and Ambiguity: You operate effectively in times of uncertainty and deal constructively with problems that do not have clear solutions or outcomes. You are comfortable managing change and remain calm and productive even when you don’t have the full picture.

• Instructional design methodologies to develop effective adult learning
  • Custom eLearning authoring tools such as Articulate Storyline, Articulate RISE, Captivate and Camtasia 
  • Leading virtual and hybrid cohort style learning programsIn person and virtual facilitation
  • New hire / onboarding content development
  • Flexible and adaptable
  • Self directed

• Learning curation tools such as Degreed, LinkedIn Learning and Percipio
  • Project Management (PMI/PMP or Agile) certificate or certification
  • Tech sector or healthcare start-up
  • Learning Evaluation and Measurement
  • Certifications (SHRM, ATD, Assessments)
  • Gallup Strengths Coach
  • Culture and team building

• Inclusive healthcare and benefits: On top of comprehensive medical, dental, and vision coverage, we offer employees and their family members help with gender-affirming care, tools for family and fertility planning, and travel reimbursements if healthcare isn’t available where you live.
  • Planning for the future: Start saving for the future with our traditional or roth 401k retirement plan options which include a 2% company match.
  • Modern life stipends: Manage your own learning and development budget, use the mental health to support therapy costs, and lifestyle stipends to cover your favorite wellness services, and work-from-home equipment.
  • Flexible vacation and paid time off: Employees have flexibility to choose when, how, and why they take time off to rest and recharge. Exempt employees can take advantage of our flexible pto program. Nonexempt employees can utilize up to two weeks of sick time and up to 17 days of vacation per year, including mental health days.
  • Other compensation: At Hinge Health, we want every employee to be invested and rewarded in the future success of the company. All full-time positions are eligible for equity.

descriptionPlain:
One in two people experience debilitating back, neck, shoulder, or joint pain — but traditional treatments have failed to meet their needs. Physical therapy can be expensive and hard to access; appointments often involve long commutes and missed work. Making matters worse, unresolved pain can trigger the overuse of opioids and surgeries.

Join us in reimagining healthcare from the ground up. We’re making high-quality care accessible by pairing wearable sensors and computer vision with a world-class clinical team. Hinge Health puts a digital clinic in every member's pocket. Now millions of people can access personalized digital care from a physical therapist, guidance on behavior change from a health coach, and expert consultations with an orthopedic surgeon. With a single app and wearable technology like our Enso device, we’re helping to reduce pain, surgeries, and opioid use.

Work From Anywhere
Hinge Health Employees have the flexibility to work anywhere, within the country they are hired. 

About the Role
Application Principal Engineers guide and accelerate the evolution of Hinge Health’s mobile app. To improve member experience and outcomes, the mobile app must evolve toward a deeply personalized, “magical” experience that takes full advantage of device capabilities–including BLE input and ML edge computing. To increase the pace of innovation, the architecture of the mobile app must evolve to support dozens of independently contributing teams running hundreds of concurrent A/B tests with minimal coordination.  
Principal engineers will glide between levels of abstraction to foster strong technical alignment, facilitate great technical decision making, and implement elegant solutions to the most complex and high-leverage technical problems. Their pragmatism, collaboration, thoughtfulness, and creative joy will shine through in every gesture, and disproportionately influence the technical culture of an engineering team that’s still doubling in size every year.

#LI-KH2

lists.content:
• Continuous evolution of Hinge Health’s client app to scale up to dozens of teams running hundreds of concurrent experiments.
  • Design and architecture of high-impact new customer experiences.
  • Scope and schedule of large projects are consistently accurate, due to rigorous de-risking and thoughtful planning.  
  • Attentive mentorship and active skills training accelerates the professional development of technical leaders  
  • Strong alignment around well-defined principles and vision for change aligns several independent teams to make progress with little active coordination. 
  • Increase Hinge Health’s voice in industry with technical articles and speaking engagements
  • Increase the pace of high-quality innovation in one of the fastest growing startups shaping a new industry.
  • Be frequently moved to tears by your work, as you improve access to healthcare and transform real individual’s lives by offering relief from debilitating pain.

• Front end application development on a large, complex, top-quality consumer application.
  • Expertise in high performance computation, with an emphasis on profiling and bottleneck discovery, O(n)-driven intuitions, benchmarking, concurrency
  • Expertise in low-latency, highly resilient client-server architecture, including graceful degradation of features in low- or no-bandwidth modes. 
  • Deep familiarity with the mobile app ecosystem, including testing, observing, deploying, and managing several concurrent versions in the field across a wide rage of consumer devices
  • Team-first, growth mindset, and ability to add leverage to every level of the org, from shipping code to shaping strategy with senior leadership.
  • Track record of effective project management, primarily devoted to early derisking, problem decomposition, and a strong vision that pulls the team toward the destination together 
  • Experience with Agile techniques and tooling for rapid prototyping and experimentation

• Experience with ML at the edge, inc computer vision, NLP, and diagnostic AI. 
  • Expertise in ReactNative, Node.js, Android or iOS SDKs and native capabilities
  • Experience in IoT, smart home, AR/VR, or wearables (esp ones using BLE)

• Inclusive healthcare and benefits: On top of comprehensive medical, dental, and vision coverage, we offer employees and their family members help with gender-affirming care, tools for family and fertility planning, and travel reimbursements if healthcare isn’t available where you live.
  • Planning for the future: Start saving for the future with our traditional or roth 401k retirement plan options which include a 2% company match.
  • Modern life stipends: Manage your own learning and development budget, use the mental health to support therapy costs, and lifestyle stipends to cover your favorite wellness services, and work-from-home equipment.
  • Flexible vacation and paid time off: Employees have flexibility to choose when, how, and why they take time off to rest and recharge. Exempt employees can take advantage of our flexible pto program. Nonexempt employees can utilize up to two weeks of sick time and up to 17 days of vacation per year, including mental health days.
  • Other compensation: At Hinge Health, we want every employee to be invested and rewarded in the future success of the company. All full-time positions are eligible for equity.

About the Role
The Privacy Counsel will be a key member of the Hinge Health legal team, focused on privacy issues. You will be the in-house expert on privacy and provide timely review and guidance for new products and features in digital and in-person MSK care from early stages of development through launch and for our consumer messaging and marketing programs, materials and tactics.

You will be expected to stay up-to-date on relevant laws and regulations in the data privacy space, and lead, architect and drive forward privacy compliance plans and programs. You will have the opportunity to pitch in on other matters as needed as part of a fast-moving, lean, efficient legal organization.

#LI-NS1

lists.content:
• Act as a key internal lead and subject matter expert on all matters relating to privacy law, including providing practical, timely, strategic, and high-quality legal advice on data privacy and security matters.
  • Actively monitor, brief, and advise on privacy laws and new legislative and regulatory developments, including taking lead on developing and updating policies and procedures and developing and updating internal workplans to comply with upcoming data privacy regulations. Collaborate with Information Security team and Compliance team to mitigate data privacy and security risks.
  • Lead on reviewing products and product features to ensure compliance with data protection laws.
  • Lead in reviewing marketing initiatives to ensure compliance with data protection laws.
  • Lead on reviewing, drafting, and negotiating of privacy and data security terms in contracts with clients, business partners and vendors, including Data Sharing Agreements and Business Associate Agreements.

• You are an attorney with a JD, admission to a state bar, at least [7] years of relevant experience in-house in healthcare or at a law firm focused on healthcare data privacy matters.
  • You have a comprehensive understanding of and experience with providing advice on data privacy and related statutes, regulations and guidance is required, particularly HIPAA as well as CCPA, CPRA, and state data privacy laws. Experience with TCPA and/or GDPR, PIPEDA and other international privacy structures] is a plus.
  • You have experience providing advice on digital health products, service designs, and marketing initiatives , from a data privacy perspective.
  • You have experience driving compliance work plans and projects forward, including rolling up your sleeves to get things done when needed, and experience leading and taking ownership over privacy compliance programs, including working cross-functionally to get stakeholder buy-in and drive projects forward.
  • You have experience clearly communicating, triaging and summarizing compliance requirements across different regulatory frameworks, including working with cross-functional teams to understand requirements.
  • You have experience drafting and negotiating Data Sharing Agreements and Business Associate Agreements and advising on contractual terms related to privacy and security.
  • You are comfortable working in a fast-paced and high-growth environment in a rapidly changing and sometimes ambiguous compliance environment, triaging compliance needs and handling tasks and answering questions that are unfamiliar to you. 
  • You have a strong willingness to take on and drive projects from start to finish.

• Experience working in digital health.
  • CIPP certification
  • Experience with venture backed, pre-IPO enterprises

• Inclusive healthcare and benefits: On top of comprehensive medical, dental, and vision coverage, we offer employees and their family members help with gender-affirming care, tools for family and fertility planning, and travel reimbursements if healthcare isn’t available where you live.
  • Planning for the future: Start saving for the future with our traditional or roth 401k retirement plan options which include a 2% company match.
  • Modern life stipends: Manage your own learning and development budget, use the mental health to support therapy costs, and lifestyle stipends to cover your favorite wellness services, and work-from-home equipment.
  • Flexible vacation and paid time off: Employees have flexibility to choose when, how, and why they take time off to rest and recharge. Exempt employees can take advantage of our flexible pto program. Nonexempt employees can utilize up to two weeks of sick time and up to 17 days of vacation per year, including mental health days.
  • Other compensation: At Hinge Health, we want every employee to be invested and rewarded in the future success of the company. All full-time positions are eligible for equity.

descriptionPlain:
One in two people experience debilitating back, neck, shoulder, or joint pain — but traditional treatments have failed to meet their needs. Physical therapy can be expensive and hard to access; appointments often involve long commutes and missed work. Making matters worse, unresolved pain can trigger the overuse of opioids and surgeries.

Join us in reimagining healthcare from the ground up. We’re making high-quality care accessible by pairing wearable sensors and computer vision with a world-class clinical team. Hinge Health puts a digital clinic in every member's pocket. Now millions of people can access personalized digital care from a physical therapist, guidance on behavior change from a health coach, and expert consultations with an orthopedic surgeon. With a single app and wearable technology like our Enso device, we’re helping to reduce pain, surgeries, and opioid use.

About the Role
We’re looking for an ambitious individual to support our revenue cycle function. This person will be instrumental in: ensuring that we are billing accurately and reimbursed in a timely fashion from clients, payers and health plans. This person will report on the financial health of our business by investigating data trends and manipulating data as needed. They will work cross-functionally to implement policies and procedures that not only improve reimbursement but also improve the user experience, and assist our revenue cycle team scale.
We are looking for someone with at least 1 year of professional experience, preferably in the consulting, startup, or healthcare fields, who is interested in understanding the mechanics of healthcare reimbursement and financial reporting. We are looking for an individual who is willing to roll up their sleeves and own the day-to-day revenue cycle management responsibilities, enjoys working cross-functionally, and who is also comfortable reporting on the financial stability of our business to our leadership team. We are looking for someone who can wear multiple hats, is a self-starter, and is passionate about improving the financial health of the HH revenue cycle and business as a whole.

lists.content:
• Support the growth of general claim and invoice billing practices from pre-submission to post-submission, including ensuring all claims and invoice clients are charged accurately 
  • Ensure new clients are set-up for claim submission and HH is able to receive remittances electronically
  • Communicate cross-functionally with the Customer Success and Sales teams to ensure we are able to bill our new clients and obtain remittances
  • Support the entire life-cycle of billing for a new client from: from taking part in external calls with carriers, to monitoring initial claim processing, to eventually turning a new client onto daily automated claims, and reporting on the reimbursement of that specific new account
  • Follow-up with payers on claims outstanding over 30 days and ensure they are paid accurately and timely
  • Submit invoices to our clients 1x per month
  • Assist in collecting patient payments and follow-up as needed
  • Assist and support the entire Revenue Cycle function in regards to setting up new payment structures as we expand our program offerings
  • Lead and prepare for both internal and external meetings, specifically in regards to representing the HH revenue cycle team
  • Update and refresh reporting for revenue cycle KPIs, including but not limited to: claim denials, claim write-offs, time to cash, etc. 
  • Internally report on key revenue cycle metrics such as claim denials or underpayments, but also identify ways to improve and avoid these moving forward
  • Willingness to investigate financial and billing data to extrapolate insights upon request 
  • Ability to clearly and concisely document respective projects 
  • Troubleshoot and correct any ad-hoc claim rejections, verify user eligibility, and re-submit claims accordingly

• At least 1 year of professional experience, preferably in the startup, consulting, and/or healthcare fields
  • Intermediate to advanced Excel skills
  • Experience working cross-functionally with different teams
  • Comfortable working with the ambiguity of a fast-paced startup
  • Efficient written and verbal communication skills
  • Attention to detail and exceptional organizational skills

• Inclusive healthcare and benefits: On top of comprehensive medical, dental, and vision coverage, we offer help with gender-affirming care, tools for family and fertility planning, and travel reimbursements if healthcare isn’t available where you live
  • Modern life stipends: Manage your own learning and development budget and use the mental health and lifestyle stipends to cover your favorite wellness services, workout classes, gym subscriptions, and work-from-home equipment
  • Flexible vacation and paid time off: Full-time employees have full flexibility to choose when, how, and why they take time off to rest and recharge

• Experience working in a healthcare startup
  • Experience in revenue cycle management 
  • Experience project managing of internal projects
  • Finance and accounting experience is a plus, but not required.

descriptionPlain:
One in two people experience debilitating back, neck, shoulder, or joint pain — but traditional treatments have failed to meet their needs. Physical therapy can be expensive and hard to access; appointments often involve long commutes and missed work. Making matters worse, unresolved pain can trigger the overuse of opioids and surgeries.

Join us in reimagining healthcare from the ground up. We’re making high-quality care accessible by pairing wearable sensors and computer vision with a world-class clinical team. Hinge Health puts a digital clinic in every member's pocket. Now millions of people can access personalized digital care from a physical therapist, guidance on behavior change from a health coach, and expert consultations with an orthopedic surgeon. With a single app and wearable technology like our Enso device, we’re helping to reduce pain, surgeries, and opioid use.

Work From Anywhere
Hinge Health Employees have the flexibility to work anywhere, within the country they are hired. 

About the Role
Hinge Health is looking for someone with a background in revenue cycle management (RCM) - with an understanding of the mechanics and complexity of healthcare reimbursement. We are seeking an individual who is willing to roll up their sleeves and dig into data trends, enjoys working cross-functionally to streamline our revenue cycle, and is comfortable manipulating data to report on the financial stability of our business directly to leadership. 

The ideal candidate will have robust experience in Revenue Cycle and/or Healthcare Consulting. We are looking for an individual who is a self-starter, passionate about Revenue Cycle, someone who can see the “big picture” but is also willing to roll up their sleeves and get their hands dirty to continuously optimize processes. We are looking for someone with at least 1 year of people’s management experience. Finance and Accounting experience is a plus, but not required. Startup experience is a plus but not a must. 

#LI-ST1

We are looking for someone with at least 1 year of people’s management experience. Finance and Accounting experience is a plus, but not required. Startup experience is a plus but not a must. 

#LI-ST1

lists.content:
• Independently own Revenue Cycle initiatives from inception through execution, building comprehensive project plans from scratch and coordinating with stakeholders as needed. 
  • Project manage parts of the entire Revenue Cycle function in regards to setting up new payment structures as Hinge Health expands program offerings. 
  • Experience in people’s management. Comfortable providing guidance to direct reports and invests in learning about direct reports and learning style. 
  • Exhibit a growth mindset by being responsive to feedback.
  • Open-minded and can zoom out from the details to focus on long-term key financial company goals and RCM’s role within the organization. 
  • Continuously work to identify and implement areas of improvement in the Company’s revenue cycle, developing processes and documentation for how to achieve these. 
  • Robust knowledge of RCM and Finance. 
  • Note: If the candidate has no Finance experience, ensure the candidate has experience reporting on KPIs. 
  • Report to leadership on key revenue cycle metrics such as large bulk issues or underpayments, and identify ways to improve and avoid these moving forward. 
  • Examine and collaborate on reporting for revenue cycle KPIs, including denial rate, write-off rate, charge lag, time to cash, etc. 
  • Willing to dig into the data (will ask why) and comfortable manipulating large sets of data using Excel, Sheets, SQL, etc.
  • Experience and comfort in influence of upper management or large client management (ability to tailor communication to different audiences). 
  • Flexible and adaptable person who can handle shifting requirements and 1 off projects. 
  • Knowledgeable on the entire life-cycle of billing for a new client which includes participating in external calls with clients, partners, payers/health plans and representing Hinge Health as the Revenue Cycle SME as necessary. 
  • Skilled at executive-level business writing (memos, documentation, meeting agendas etc.). 
  • Develop Revenue Cycle-specific policies as needed. 
  • Communicate cross-functionally with the Commercial teams to ensure we are able to bill our new clients, and escalate any claim issues when needed
  • Work cross-functionally with the Product/Engineering team to help automate billing processes
  • Ability to work not just with your own team but cross-functionally across all departments and levels including Commercial,Product/Engineering, and SLT. 
  • Lead trainings and educate team members on RCM best practices and industry benchmarks.

• At least 2-3 years of experience in healthcare provider revenue cycle, preferably in a consulting or analytics role. At least 1 year of people management experience is also required. 
  • Working knowledge of industry best practices in Revenue Cycle processes: billing, charge capture, contractual adjustments, third-party reimbursements, and cash collections. 
  • Experience working cross-functionally with different teams and project managing internal projects with multiple competing stakeholders. 
  • Attention to detail, exceptional organizational skills, and strong affinity for solving complex problems. 
  • Efficient written and verbal communication skills. 
  • Advanced Excel skills. 
  • Fundamental knowledge of revenue integrity (i.e. CPT and ICD-10 coding). 
  • Comfortable working with the ambiguity of a fast-paced startup. 
  • You are action oriented: Taking on new opportunities and tough challenges with a sense of urgency, high energy, and enthusiasm. 
  • You can manage ambiguity: Operating effectively, even when things are not certain or the way forward is not clear. 
  • You can manage complexity: Making sense of complex, high quantity, and sometimes contradictory information to effectively solve problems
  • You have built effective teams: Building strong-identity teams that apply their diverse skills and perspectives to achieve common goals
  • You collaborate: Planning and prioritizing work to meet commitments aligned with organizational goals. 
  • You always drive results: Consistently achieving results, even under tough circumstances
  • You have a knack for optimizing work processes: Knowing the most effective and efficient processes to get things done, with a focus on continuous improvement

• Experience in Accounting. 
  • Degree in healthcare management, accounting, finance or business preferred, but not required.

• Inclusive healthcare and benefits: On top of comprehensive medical, dental, and vision coverage, we offer help with gender-affirming care, tools for family and fertility planning, and travel reimbursements if healthcare isn’t available where you live
  • Modern life stipends: Manage your own learning and development budget and use the mental health and lifestyle stipends to cover your favorite wellness services, workout classes, gym subscriptions, and work-from-home equipment
  • Flexible vacation and paid time off: Full-time employees have full flexibility to choose when, how, and why they take time off to rest and recharge

About the Role
We’re looking for an experienced sales or client management professional to join our Commercial Team as an individual contributor selling into the Labor & Trust space in the Central Region. lists.content:
• Work individually, and with Partnerships & Marketing to develop and maintain a healthy pipeline of Labor & Trust clients in the Central Region.
  • Independently take deals from initial conversation to close.
  • Collaborate with legal on contract negotiation & signature
  • Collaborate with Customer Success to ensure successful implementation of our program, as well as renewals / upsells.
  • Contribute to product roadmap by feeding back the customer's voice

• Bachelor’s degree and 6-10 years work experience.
  • Background in Labor & Trust sales/client management, with a history of closing large, complex deals with a long sales-cycle.
  • History of consistently attaining / exceeding quota.
  • Excellent project management, organization, and communication skills.
  • Comfortable working with the ambiguity of a fast-paced startup - ability to innovate, and solve problems creatively
  • Desire to learn, grow, develop, and eventually mentor future team members
  • Have a sense of humor and like to have fun. We work hard, but we laugh a lot too
  • Subject matter expertise in healthcare, employee health benefits, chronic disease management, digital health
  • Startup experience
  • Must reside in the Central Region

• Inclusive healthcare and benefits: On top of comprehensive medical, dental, and vision coverage, we offer employees and their family members help with gender-affirming care, tools for family and fertility planning, and travel reimbursements if healthcare isn’t available where you live.
  • Planning for the future: Start saving for the future with our traditional or roth 401k retirement plan options which include a 2% company match.
  • Modern life stipends: Manage your own learning and development budget, use the mental health to support therapy costs, and lifestyle stipends to cover your favorite wellness services, and work-from-home equipment.
  • Flexible vacation and paid time off: Employees have flexibility to choose when, how, and why they take time off to rest and recharge. Exempt employees can take advantage of our flexible pto program. Nonexempt employees can utilize up to two weeks of sick time and up to 17 days of vacation per year, including mental health days.
  • Other compensation: At Hinge Health, we want every employee to be invested and rewarded in the future success of the company. All full-time positions are eligible for equity.

Physical therapy can be expensive and hard to access; appointments often involve long commutes and missed work. Making matters worse, unresolved pain can trigger the overuse of opioids and surgeries.

Join us in reimagining healthcare from the ground up. We’re making high-quality care accessible by pairing wearable sensors and computer vision with a world-class clinical team. Hinge Health puts a digital clinic in every member's pocket. Now millions of people can access personalized digital care from a physical therapist, guidance on behavior change from a health coach, and expert consultations with an orthopedic surgeon. With a single app and wearable technology like our Enso device, we’re helping to reduce pain, surgeries, and opioid use.

Here at Hinge Health, we welcome all applicants and know a diverse team makes us better and stronger. We look for individuals who embody our leadership principles and we value varied experiences and skill sets. Beyond specific work experience, we also look for unique capabilities and skill sets that are key indicators an applicant will thrive in our fast-paced, frequently evolving environment. If this sounds like the kind of place you’d like to be part of, please apply - we would love to hear from you!

Work From Anywhere
Hinge Health employees have the flexibility to work remotely in hubs across the United States.

About the Role
We are searching for a Security Engineer- Identity and Access Management (IAM) to help implement, operationalize and strengthen the IAM program at Hinge Health using agile methodologies. This person will be a critical thinker with proven hands-on experience working with enterprise Identity Management systems including automation of User Lifecycle Management, Federated Identity Management and Single Sign on, Adaptive MFA, Contextual Access management and Identity governance policies.

The IAM Engineer will enable the business to reach the desired outcomes by providing the tools they need, reducing cost and security friction and creating business opportunities while ensuring the utmost security standards to protect Hinge Health data and digital identities. This position is hands-on with the ability to contribute to the overall IAM program. 

The ideal candidate is a highly motivated individual with proven experience working in IAM systems. He/She/They has been a key partner in maintaining awareness of new security and authentication trends and has served as security champion to a broad audience regarding the development, authentication and access security concerns. We are looking for an individual with experience in the technical background of IAM technologies, who can also shape the future of the IAM program at Hinge Health.

  • Disrupt, Improve and Evolve IAM by enabling opportunities to scale efficiencies, including the automation of all common repeatable tasks
  • Work with the Cyber Security Operations team to implement monitoring processes and correlation of events regarding digital identities
  • Ensure seamless coverage of Hinge Health’s critical assets, data, application, informational property, networks, servers, and endpoints

• Puts members first - Able to implement and deliver processes and tools of value related to Identity management to the rest of the organization, reducing current manual work and operational costs.
  • Make results happen-Subject Matter Expert in the IAM domain to the Organization. With some guidance, helps provide direction to other teams regarding IAM. 
  • Creates Trust - Clearly communicates the value of IAM to different audiences, addresses problems cooperatively and listens to others feedback. Integrates with other teams to meet a common goal. 
  • Takes risk and is innovative - With minimal direction takes action on opportunities and security events related to IAM, adhering to security best practices and company processes.
  • Leads at all levels - Empowers others with tools and knowledge related to IAM. Influence others to take the right actions related to authentication and authorization practices.
