descriptionPlain:
One in two people experience debilitating back, neck, shoulder, or joint pain — but traditional treatments have failed to meet their needs. Physical therapy can be expensive and hard to access; appointments often involve long commutes and missed work. Making matters worse, unresolved pain can trigger the overuse of opioids and surgeries.

Join us in reimagining healthcare from the ground up. We’re making high-quality care accessible by pairing wearable sensors and computer vision with a world-class clinical team. Hinge Health puts a digital clinic in every member's pocket. Now millions of people can access personalized digital care from a physical therapist, guidance on behavior change from a health coach, and expert consultations with an orthopedic surgeon. With a single app and wearable technology like our Enso device, we’re helping to reduce pain, surgeries, and opioid use.

Work From Anywhere
Hinge Health employees have the flexibility to work remotely in hubs across the United States.

About the Role
Hinge Health is looking for a Senior Associate to manage enablement tools and processes that help fuel the success of our enterprise marketing and sales teams. This includes keeping messaging for our rapidly evolving solutions up to date and consistent across materials, customizing assets for key prospects throughout the sales process, and operationalizing processes and tools for greater efficiency and clarity. You will report to our Sr. Director of Enterprise Marketing and will support a growing team of marketing and sales professionals to do the best work of their careers.  

The ideal candidate will bring an enthusiasm for solving problems as our company grows and scales, and a passion for creatively and effectively delivering our company’s value proposition to target audiences. You should be highly organized, detail-oriented, and resourceful, and have an affinity for B2B marketing tactics. You are a great candidate for this role if you enjoy making an impact across the organization as much as delivering bespoke sales and marketing assets for individual prospects.  

#LI-JS1

#LI-JS1

lists.content:
• 100% on-time and error-free delivery of assigned sales enablement requests.
  • Lead scale projects that result in 2x more partners leveraging co-branded marketing toolkits.
  • Increase sales team usage of key sales enablement assets leveraging reporting and insights from the sales enablement tech stack and keeping content current and discoverable.

• Marketing Experience: Education or training in marketing with experience developing/editing collateral, presentations, and other sales and marketing materials.
  • Industry Acumen: Passionate about our company’s mission, with some understanding of healthcare and/or benefits.
  • Project and Portfolio Management: Ability to define project goals and milestones and experience with how to prioritize tasks across multiple projects.
  • Technology: Savvy user of multiple tech platforms and tools to get the job done (e.g. GoogleDocs, Asana, Salesforce)
  • Communicate effectively: Strong written & verbal communication that is well-structured and persuasive.
  • Strong attention to detail: Keen ability to pay close attention to detail and manage high quality deliverables.
  • Make results happen: Strong bias towards action and innate sense of urgency, without fear of having to pivot when necessary.
  • Learn-it-all: Curious and keeps up to date on new developments in the industry and marketing discipline. Thrives in  a culture of experimentation and repetitive excellence.
  • Collaborative: High emotional intelligence and ability to both deliver and manage expectations of cross-functional partners

• Experience with Salesforce, project management tools, marketing tech stack tools
  • Understanding of digital health market, in MSK or other specialty

• Inclusive healthcare and benefits: On top of comprehensive medical, dental, and vision coverage, we offer employees and their family members help with gender-affirming care, tools for family and fertility planning, and travel reimbursements if healthcare isn’t available where you live.
  • Planning for the future: Start saving for the future with our traditional or roth 401k retirement plan options which include a 2% company match.
  • Modern life stipends: Manage your own learning and development budget, use the mental health to support therapy costs, and lifestyle stipends to cover your favorite wellness services, and work-from-home equipment.
  • Flexible vacation and paid time off: Employees have flexibility to choose when, how, and why they take time off to rest and recharge. Exempt employees can take advantage of our flexible pto program. Nonexempt employees can utilize up to two weeks of sick time and up to 17 days of vacation per year, including mental health days.
  • Other compensation: At Hinge Health, we want every employee to be invested and rewarded in the future success of the company. All full-time positions are eligible for equity.

descriptionPlain:
One in two people experience debilitating back, neck, shoulder, or joint pain — but traditional treatments have failed to meet their needs. Physical therapy can be expensive and hard to access; appointments often involve long commutes and missed work. Making matters worse, unresolved pain can trigger the overuse of opioids and surgeries.

Join us in reimagining healthcare from the ground up. We’re making high-quality care accessible by pairing wearable sensors and computer vision with a world-class clinical team. Hinge Health puts a digital clinic in every member's pocket. Now millions of people can access personalized digital care from a physical therapist, guidance on behavior change from a health coach, and expert consultations with an orthopedic surgeon. With a single app and wearable technology like our Enso device, we’re helping to reduce pain, surgeries, and opioid use.

Work From Anywhere
Hinge Health employees have the flexibility to work remotely in hubs across the United States.

About the Role
In this fast paced client-facing role, you will own day-to-day relationships with our employer clients and ensure they are maximizing the benefits from the Hinge Health programs. This role demands a little bit of everything, from being a trusted adviser, project manager, product expert, coach to other team members, and more. You will be responsible for driving adoption with our clients, reporting on program value, managing escalations, expanding product offerings, and securing renewals. This is a cross-functional role that partners with Growth, Sales, Data, Marketing, Operations, Product, and Clinical to provide excellent service for our clients. The ideal candidate will also help contribute to best practices and be open to evolving responsibilities as our team grows.  

This candidate will be required to have prior experience in account management and healthcare benefits to be considered. Startup experience is a plus, but not a must. They are excellent at building relationships at all levels, managing the demands of a full book-of-business consisting of large employer clients, and an expert of communicating effectively with internal and external stakeholders, (e.g. clients, consultants, health plans, cross-functional partners, etc). We are looking for an individual who can effectively balance their client needs with internal resources to drive high customer retention and satisfaction year after year.

lists.content:

  • Customer advocacy: Turn clients into advocates to fulfill sales references and Marketing/PR requests
  • Product expansion: Ensure your clients are offering Hinge Health’s full suite of products to maximize member impact

• Relationship-building: Able to build relationships at all levels as a trusted & respected thought-partner
  • Data storytelling: Able to craft a compelling story using data-driven insights to make recommendations to influence customer decisions. 
  • Product Knowledge: Subject matter expert on our product, knowing the specifics and functionalities, and understanding common use cases and best practices. Able to confidently answer questions and present solutions to clients.
  • Strategic influence: Able to effectively navigate the complexities of a book of business with clients in multiple stages of their lifecycle. Gain insight into client culture, priorities, and goals. Effectively convey client needs internally, driving the resources needed for successful client relationships.

• Inclusive healthcare and benefits: On top of comprehensive medical, dental, and vision coverage, we offer employees and their family members help with gender-affirming care, tools for family and fertility planning, and travel reimbursements if healthcare isn’t available where you live.

Exempt employees can take advantage of our flexible pto program. Nonexempt employees can utilize up to two weeks of sick time and up to 17 days of vacation per year, including mental health days.
  • Other compensation: At Hinge Health, we want every employee to be invested and rewarded in the future success of the company. All full-time positions are eligible for equity.

• Experience at a high-growth company and understand the associated challenges 
  • Have an understanding of employee benefits, digital health, and the startup work environment
  • Data integration proficiency, advanced Excel knowledge and skills

description:
One in two people experience debilitating back, neck, shoulder, or joint pain — but traditional treatments have failed to meet their needs. About the Role
We’re looking for an experienced developer to join our team. The primary role of this position is to develop computer vision data pipelines and 3D annotation tools.

#LI-IR1

lists.content:
• Develop a centralized machine learning data pipeline to facilitate labeling across multiple teams and applications
  • Develop 3D tools in Unity and Unreal Engine 5 for annotation of computer vision data that plays a critical role in our machine learning pipeline
  • Develop advanced features for automatic generation of realistic 3D characters, scenes and animations
  • Define and improve user interfaces in tools and workflows between scientists and data annotators
  • Working with scientists, engineers and data annotators to improve workflows 
  • Participating in team scrums and agile sprint planning and review sessions

• Bachelors degree in Computer Science, Computer Engineering, or a related technical field
  • At least five years of relevant experience working in fast-paced, small teams 
  • Two or more years of experience developing data pipelines or databases and their client applications
  • Demonstrated excellence in Python and proficiency C#, C++ or one other language

• Proficiency with SQL, JSON, DVC, GraphQL and other data storage technologies
  • Demonstrated work experience in Unity or Unreal Engine 
  • Experience with REST APIs
  • Proficiency with Blender, Maya, or other 3D character animation tools  
  • Experience with character rigging, animation, materials, rendering, etc.
  • Machine learning experience, or exposure to machine learning concepts

• Competitive compensation with meaningful equity
  • Medical, Dental, Vision, Disability and Life Insurance
  • Flexible PTO
  • Group RRSP w/ employer contribution
  • Professional Development budget 
  • Quarterly lifestyle benefit to use towards WFH equipment & fitness
  • Generous mental health stipend
  • Work from home policy
  • Opportunity to join a fantastically talented, diverse, and passionate team at a pivotal time in the company’s lifecycle

descriptionPlain:
One in two people experience debilitating back, neck, shoulder, or joint pain — but traditional treatments have failed to meet their needs. Physical therapy can be expensive and hard to access; appointments often involve long commutes and missed work. Making matters worse, unresolved pain can trigger the overuse of opioids and surgeries.

Join us in reimagining healthcare from the ground up. We’re making high-quality care accessible by pairing wearable sensors and computer vision with a world-class clinical team. Hinge Health puts a digital clinic in every member's pocket. Now millions of people can access personalized digital care from a physical therapist, guidance on behavior change from a health coach, and expert consultations with an orthopedic surgeon. With a single app and wearable technology like our Enso device, we’re helping to reduce pain, surgeries, and opioid use.

Here at Hinge Health, we welcome all applicants and know a diverse team makes us better and stronger. We look for individuals who embody our leadership principles and we value varied experiences and skill sets. Beyond specific work experience, we also look for unique capabilities and skill sets that are key indicators an applicant will thrive in our fast-paced, frequently evolving environment. If this sounds like the kind of place you’d like to be part of, please apply - we would love to hear from you!

Work From Anywhere
Hinge Health employees have the flexibility to work remotely in hubs across the US, Canada, and Latin America or work from our offices in San Francisco, Portland, and Montreal.

About the Role
The Senior Security Consultant  position will be responsible for leading internal and external security risk assessments. This role will help further define and maintain a comprehensive risk management program to identify, evaluate and monitor various information and third party security risks. This position will work closely with cross functional teams to ensure that information security risk associated with critical Hinge Health assets, data, operations, and third-party relationships are properly identified and effectively managed.

About the Role
The Senior Security Consultant  position will be responsible for leading internal and external security risk assessments. This role will help further define and maintain a comprehensive risk management program to identify, evaluate and monitor various information and third party security risks. This position will work closely with cross functional teams to ensure that information security risk associated with critical Hinge Health assets, data, operations, and third-party relationships are properly identified and effectively managed.

lists.content:
• Build and mature Hinge Health’s security policy and control framework supporting various standards (e.g., NIST Cybersecurity Framework, ISO 27001, HITRUST) and regulatory/compliance requirements (e.g., HIPAA, Sarbanes Oxley, GDPR).
  • Strong emphasis will be on planning and executing IT audits, as well as, performing controls assessments for industry accepted frameworks such as SOX, NIST, HITRUST 
  • Plan & lead complex assessments for IT general and application controls in the areas of system development, Identity and Access Management (IAM), logging and monitoring, vulnerability management, change management, logical access, data networks, computer operations, business continuity and disaster recovery.
  • Deliver technical guidance related to enhancing the security posture of information systems solutions.
  • Work closely with IT, Information Security, and Engineering teams to develop a strategy and program to effectively manage information security risk and further improve security posture and maturity.
  • Automate common repetitive audit tasks to reduce time and effort spent in preparing for internal and external audits.
  • Build continuous security management, monitoring and testing capabilities within a cloud native environment.
  • Evaluate the design and effectiveness of controls, as well as, track, monitor and assist process owners with remediation plans.
  • Remain up-to-date on legal and regulatory changes, emerging threats and evolving technologies and implement appropriate control mechanisms based on risks within Hinge Health’s environment.
  • Gather and maintain a library of objective evidence to show ongoing compliance with the documented controls.
  • Ability to put into practice security & privacy frameworks & standards such as ISO 27001, SOC2, GDPR, HITRUST and HIPAA.
  • Provide information to external business partners and customers on Hinge Health’s internal security capabilities and practices in support of business objectives.

• Bachelor's degree in computer science, information assurance, MIS or related field, or equivalent work experience.
  • Experience in public accounting and/or internal audit functions involving public companies with exposure to advanced information system audit techniques, including but not limited to SOX 404, NIST SP 800-53, NIST CSF, HITRUST, PCI DSS, SOC 1, SOC 2, ISO 27001, etc.
  • 5+ years of experience in Information Security and experience driving security risk management activities
  • At least three (3) years of experience performing IT General Controls (ITGCs) and/or IT Application Controls assessments; evaluating risks-based principles and executing audit programs.
  • Experience building an information security and third-party security risk management program while collaborating with cross functional teams to effectively manage risk.
  • Has experience in conducting data driven security risk assessments 
  • Deep working knowledge of relevant compliance, privacy, regulatory frameworks (e.g., HIPAA, HITRUST SOX, GDPR)
  • Subject matter expertise of common information security management frameworks (e.g., HITRUST, NIST) and healthcare regulations.
  • Experience with cloud environments and cloud computing service deployment architecture (IaaS, PaaS, SaaS) 
  • Experience with designing GRC processes including requirements gathering, process reviews and development, and implementation.
  • Excellent written, verbal and nonverbal communication skills, including the ability to communicate security and risk-related concepts to technical and nontechnical audiences at all levels of the organization as well as third-party executive and government agencies.
  • Motivate, inspire, and create a positive work/team culture: You successfully maintain a high level of motivation, positive can-do attitude, and inclusive culture in your teams.
  • CISSP, CCSP, CEH, CISA CRISA or similar, related certification

• Inclusive healthcare and benefits: On top of comprehensive medical, dental, and vision coverage, we offer employees and their family members help with gender-affirming care, tools for family and fertility planning, and travel reimbursements if healthcare isn’t available where you live.
  • Planning for the future: Start saving for the future with our traditional or roth 401k retirement plan options which include a 2% company match.
  • Modern life stipends: Manage your own learning and development budget, use the mental health to support therapy costs, and lifestyle stipends to cover your favorite wellness services, and work-from-home equipment.
  • Flexible vacation and paid time off: Employees have flexibility to choose when, how, and why they take time off to rest and recharge. Exempt employees can take advantage of our flexible pto program. Nonexempt employees can utilize up to two weeks of sick time and up to 17 days of vacation per year, including mental health days.
  • Other compensation: At Hinge Health, we want every employee to be invested and rewarded in the future success of the company. All full-time positions are eligible for equity.

additionalPlain:
The range of base salary for the position is between $102,600 - $112,800, plus equity, and benefits.  Please note that the base salary range is a guideline, and individual total compensation will vary based on factors such as qualifications, skill level, competencies and work location.



About Hinge Health:
LinkedIn recently named Hinge Health one of the Top 50 Startups. Forbes, Fast Company, and Inc. have also recognized our technology, innovation, and culture.

Since our founding in 2014, we've raised more than $800 million from leading investors, including Coatue and Tiger Global. We work with 1000 customers across every industry and the public sector — including Salesforce, Verizon, and the State of New Jersey — to give more than 23 million people access to the care they need. We’re positioned to continue leading the market with unmatched investments in clinical research, care innovation, machine learning, AI, and computer vision.

Work From Anywhere

About the Role
The Design & UX Team is highly multidisciplinary made up of designers from all backgrounds (product, industrial, visual, motion, etc), researchers, content strategists, and program managers.

Come join us. https://www.hingehealth.design/

We're looking for a talented writer to craft compelling, empathetic copy that drives people to enroll and engage with Hinge Health. Your work will help people dealing with pain to find the care they need to be able to do the things they love. 

The Senior Copywriter for Growth Marketing will help develop and reinforce Hinge Health's voice and tone across an expanding list of B2C growth channels including email campaigns, direct mail, web, paid media, SMS, OOH and more. As part of our growing Growth Marketing Team, we’re looking for someone who can toggle between writer, creative problem solver, and user advocate.

lists.content:
• Write consumer marketing copy that delivers results. Whether it’s a headline, a subject line, or even a button on a landing page, you’ll use data to craft copy that boosts performance.
  • Strengthen Hinge Health’s consumer voice and tone. You’ll take Hinge Health’s brand strategy, voice and tone and elevate it across all member touch points. 
  • Work with designers to craft high-performing, user-centered assets. From direct mail to websites, you’ll work with design to create best-in-class, cohesive content across all of our channels.
  • Brainstorm and pitch creative concepts and ideas. You’ll look for innovative, creative ways to reach our members on new (or existing) channels.

• 6+ years of writing experience; preferably in a startup, in-house or agency environment.
  • 2+ years of experience in performance marketing writing.
  • A portfolio with examples of previous work specifically showing how you increased marketing performance using copy.
  • Demonstrated ability to drive results/outcomes, not just process
  • Comfortable working with cross-functional teams and project managing your own workload to set deadlines and deliver high-quality work on time.
  • Experience navigating high growth, fast-paced environments
  • Excellent communication skills to listen and influence
  • Demonstrated ability to solve complex problems

• Experience analyzing data and leveraging insights to develop solutions
  • Spanish or French language fluency

• Inclusive healthcare and benefits: On top of comprehensive medical, dental, and vision coverage, we offer help with gender-affirming care, tools for family and fertility planning, and travel reimbursements if healthcare isn’t available where you live
  • Modern life stipends: Manage your own learning and development budget and use the mental health and lifestyle stipends to cover your favorite wellness services, workout classes, gym subscriptions, and work-from-home equipment
  • Flexible vacation and paid time off: Full-time employees have full flexibility to choose when, how, and why they take time off to rest and recharge

descriptionPlain:

Physical therapy can be expensive and hard to access; appointments often involve long commutes and missed work. Making matters worse, unresolved pain can trigger the overuse of opioids and surgeries.

Join us in reimagining healthcare from the ground up. We’re making high-quality care accessible by pairing wearable sensors and computer vision with a world-class clinical team. Hinge Health puts a digital clinic in every member's pocket. Now millions of people can access personalized digital care from a physical therapist, guidance on behavior change from a health coach, and expert consultations with an orthopedic surgeon. With a single app and wearable technology like our Enso device, we’re helping to reduce pain, surgeries, and opioid use.

Here at Hinge Health, we welcome all applicants and know a diverse team makes us better and stronger. We look for individuals who embody our leadership principles and we value varied experiences and skill sets. Beyond specific work experience, we also look for unique capabilities and skill sets that are key indicators an applicant will thrive in our fast-paced, frequently evolving environment. If this sounds like the kind of place you’d like to be part of, please apply - we would love to hear from you!

Work From Anywhere
Hinge Health employees have the flexibility to work remotely in hubs across the United States.

About the Role
Data Engineers at Hinge Health are software engineers with expertise in data pipelines, OLTP & data warehouse schema design, data governance, ETL, RDBMS and NoSQL systems. Data Engineers are hands-on, building self-service tools and automation that enable application engineers and data analysts to manage, maintain, and secure their data systems with autonomy while adhering to best practices in a HIPAA environment. The ideal candidate thrives in a highly collaborative, cross functional environment. Our stack:  Python, SQL, Airflow, PostgreSQL, MySQL, REST, Aptible, Docker, Tonic.ai, Terraform, Spark, Kafka, Fivetran, Databricks, AWS (S3, Lambda, Kinesis, RDS, Glue). Our workflow is trunk-based CI/CD, and our security/compliance posture is at the highest standards of healthcare, including HIPAA, HITRUST, SOC 2, CCPA.

  • Participate in hiring and mentoring of team members
  • Assist and coach teams to optimize poorly performing data pipelines
  • Work with the SRE team to establish best practices around database monitoring, alerting, and availability

• Mastery of SQL and Python

  • Good understanding of a broad spectrum of data stores like PostgreSQL, MySQL, MongoDB, Redis, Snowflake and Redshift
  • Experience building data pipelines using Spark, Kafka, Airflow
  • Knowledge of software engineering best-practice development (e.g., linting, testing)
  • Ability to collaborate and problem-solve across teams
  • Excellent communication skills, both written and verbal
  • Six years of software engineering experience, 4+ in data engineering
  • Bachelor’s degree in C.S. or equivalent experience

descriptionPlain:
One in two people experience debilitating back, neck, shoulder, or joint pain — but traditional treatments have failed to meet their needs. Physical therapy can be expensive and hard to access; appointments often involve long commutes and missed work. Making matters worse, unresolved pain can trigger the overuse of opioids and surgeries.

Join us in reimagining healthcare from the ground up. We’re making high-quality care accessible by pairing wearable sensors and computer vision with a world-class clinical team. Hinge Health puts a digital clinic in every member's pocket. Now millions of people can access personalized digital care from a physical therapist, guidance on behavior change from a health coach, and expert consultations with an orthopedic surgeon. With a single app and wearable technology like our Enso device, we’re helping to reduce pain, surgeries, and opioid use.

Here at Hinge Health, we welcome all applicants and know a diverse team makes us better and stronger. We look for individuals who embody our leadership principles and we value varied experiences and skill sets. Beyond specific work experience, we also look for unique capabilities and skill sets that are key indicators an applicant will thrive in our fast-paced, frequently evolving environment. If this sounds like the kind of place you’d like to be part of, please apply - we would love to hear from you!

Work From Anywhere
Hinge Health employees have the flexibility to work remotely in hubs across the United States.

About the Role
Data Engineers at Hinge Health are software engineers with expertise in data pipelines, OLTP & data warehouse schema design, data governance, ETL, RDBMS and NoSQL systems. Data Engineers are hands-on, building self-service tools and automation that enable application engineers and data analysts to manage, maintain, and secure their data systems with autonomy while adhering to best practices in a HIPAA environment. The ideal candidate thrives in a highly collaborative, cross functional environment.Our stack:  Python, SQL, Airflow, PostgreSQL, MySQL, REST, Aptible, Docker, Tonic.ai, Terraform, Spark, Kafka, Fivetran, Databricks, AWS (S3, Lambda, Kinesis, RDS, Glue). Our workflow is trunk-based CI/CD, and our security/compliance posture is at the highest standards of healthcare, including HIPAA, HITRUST, SOC 2, CCPA.

#LI-KH1

lists.content:
• Create compliance strategies (HIPAA, GDPR, CCPA), tooling, processes, and coaching that enables service and application teams to take full ownership of their data in a growing organization
  • Architect and build data pipelines and data aggregation systems to deliver quality real-time and batch analytical reports
  • Participate in hiring and mentoring of team members
  • Assist and coach teams to optimize poorly performing data pipelines
  • Work with the SRE team to establish best practices around database monitoring, alerting, and availability

• Mastery of SQL and Python
  • Solid background in processing and storing large scale data using distributed systems as well as a mastery of database designs and data warehousing
  • Good understanding of a broad spectrum of data stores like PostgreSQL, MySQL, MongoDB, Redis, Snowflake and Redshift
  • Experience building data pipelines using Spark, Kafka, Airflow
  • Knowledge of software engineering best-practice development (e.g., linting, testing)
  • Ability to collaborate and problem-solve across teams
  • Excellent communication skills, both written and verbal
  • Six years of software engineering experience, 4+ in data engineering
  • Bachelor’s degree in C.S. or equivalent experience

• Inclusive healthcare and benefits: On top of comprehensive medical, dental, and vision coverage, we offer employees and their family members help with gender-affirming care, tools for family and fertility planning, and travel reimbursements if healthcare isn’t available where you live.
  • Planning for the future: Start saving for the future with our traditional or roth 401k retirement plan options which include a 2% company match.
  • Modern life stipends: Manage your own learning and development budget, use the mental health to support therapy costs, and lifestyle stipends to cover your favorite wellness services, and work-from-home equipment.
  • Flexible vacation and paid time off: Employees have flexibility to choose when, how, and why they take time off to rest and recharge. Exempt employees can take advantage of our flexible pto program. Nonexempt employees can utilize up to two weeks of sick time and up to 17 days of vacation per year, including mental health days.
  • Other compensation: At Hinge Health, we want every employee to be invested and rewarded in the future success of the company. All full-time positions are eligible for equity.

descriptionPlain:
Hinge Health is building the world’s most patient-centered Digital Musculoskeletal (MSK) Clinic™. It is now the leading Digital MSK Clinic, used by four in five employers and 90% of health plans with a digital MSK solution. Hinge Health reduces MSK pain, surgeries, and opioid use by pairing advanced wearable sensors and computer vision technology with a comprehensive clinical care team of physical therapists, physicians, and board-certified health coaches. 

Hinge Health’s HingeConnect integrates with 750,000+ in-person providers and enables real-time interventions for elective MSK surgeries, driving proven medical claims reduction. Available to millions of members, Hinge Health is widely trusted by leading organizations, including Land O’Lakes, L.L. Bean, Salesforce, Self-Insured Schools of California, Southern Company, State of New Jersey, US Foods, and Verizon. Learn more at: http://www.hingehealth.com.

Our Quality Engineering organization’s vision is to accelerate feature delivery to customers with confidence. Our mission is to reduce software quality risk at every stage of the SDLC by measuring & analyzing risk, implementing quality best practices and strategic test coverage. We do this by engaging early to develop robust test plans that ensure customer use cases are tested AND automated, identify quality metrics to guide successful feature rollouts. We also automate the release process to save human effort, reduce mistakes, and speed overall delivery.

As a Sr. Engineering Manager for the Quality Engineering team, you will manage a talented group of Quality Engineers and engage with program managers and developers on test strategies and approaches for a variety of projects and features. You will actively be involved in driving the team towards the best balance of automated and manual tests, and in ensuring tools and processes are in place to continually improve quality across the board.

As a leader of this team you will be responsible for being a steward of operational excellence and engineering rigor. Fostering a culture of ownership, putting customers first and high quality engineering is key. You will have the opportunity to delve into the code, but your priorities will be to your reports and to the engineering organization. 

Our tech stack: Aptible, AWS, GraphQL, Postgres, Rails, React, ReactNative, Redis, Redux, Node and Typescript.  Our workflow is trunk-based CI/CD.  We deploy iOS and Android updates to users every two weeks. Our security/compliance posture is at the highest standards of healthcare, including HIPAA, HITRUST, SOC 2, CCPA.

Given our company wide holiday break please expect to hear back from us no earlier than mid January*

lists.content:
• Own and improve the quality of a major product line that spans multiple engineering teams and encompassing front and backend technologies stacks
  • Coach and mentor engineers through day-to-day challenges and guide them towards long term professional and technical growth 
  • Create an effective 6-12 month roadmap of high-impact quality initiatives for your team(s) that includes identifying solutions to alleviate top product quality issues and/or developer frictions
  • Lead your team in consistently delivering on a roadmap they collaboratively define
  • Measurably sustain high engagement and job satisfaction for all your reports
  • Lead hiring and recruiting strategy to scale the team with a strong focus on experience, technical proficiency, and diversity
  • Develop robust, effective quality plans addressing various technical and resource challenges within the organization

• Delivery: Successfully identify and roll out tools and process changes that improve development efficiency and product quality.
  • Planning: Strong project management skills to ensure the whole team is on track throughout the sprint and can sustainably deliver high quality work. 
  • Domain expertise: Solid technical understanding of test automation infrastructure & tools, CI/CD pipelines, test methodologies. Technical chops that allow you to command the respect of, and effectively coach your reports. 
  • Problem solving: Ability to identify risks to product quality or test inefficiencies and propose solutions (i.e. lack of automation, missing test plans, etc).
  • Communication: Clear, inclusive communication with both teammates and non-technical partners. Able to influence stakeholders to adopt new processes and techniques that will improve product quality.
  • Leadership: Track record of ownership for team-scale execution and technical excellence. Experience managing 5+ direct reports at a given time. Potential to lead more than 1 team because you manage effectively and lead high functioning teams.

With a single app and wearable technology like our Enso device, we’re helping to reduce pain, surgeries, and opioid use.

Work From Anywhere
Hinge Health employees have the flexibility to work remotely in hubs across the United States.

About the Role
Hinge Health is looking for a Senior Associate to manage benefit consultant virtual and in-person events and regional employer events that help fuel the success of our marketing and sales teams. This includes organizing and executive webinars, virtual events, and high-profile in-person tradeshows and conferences. You will also support the Event Manager and team with Hinge Health hosted events like our annual Movement conference and our annual sales kick-off meetings.

Keeping messaging for our rapidly evolving solutions up to date and consistent across materials, customizing assets for key prospects throughout the sales process, and operationalizing processes and tools for greater efficiency and clarity. You will report to our Event Marketing Manager and will support a growing team of marketing and sales professionals to do the best work of their careers. 

We are looking for an enthusiastic and creative Senior Events Marketing Associate to spearhead and elevate virtual and in-person events for our benefit consultant audience! You will work closely with the events manager and business development teams to create unique and memorable experiences for prospects and partners across the nation resulting in new leads and nurturing current relationships.

lists.content:
• Execute all webinar programs as well as virtual and in-person events (both industry and owned conferences, events, & webinars) for our benefits consultants channels, working closely with our partnerships team and event marketing team lead.
  • Plan and execute speaking engagements at high-profile virtual and in-person conferences, working closely with key executives and our event marketing team lead.
  • Attend, support, and continuously up-level onsite event experience at major conferences and trade shows, both regionally and nationally.
  • Support Hinge Health’s annual Movement Conference and annual Commercial Kick Off event.

• Event Marketing Experience:Experience managing event logistics. 2+ years of experience planning industry and owned events from inception to completion. Well-versed in logistic management for in-person and virtual events, venue and swag procurement, speaker procurement and training, event promotion, trade booth management, and more.
  • Project and Portfolio Management: Ability to define project goals and milestones and experience with how to prioritize tasks across multiple projects with tools such as Asana, Salesforce, GoogleDocs.
  • Communicate effectively: Strong written & verbal communication that is well-structured and persuasive, experience with negotiating contracts and invoicing a plus. High emotional intelligence and ability to both deliver and manage expectations of cross-functional partners.
  • Make results happen: Strong bias towards action and innate sense of urgency, without fear of having to pivot when necessary. Keen ability to pay close attention to detail and manage high quality deliverables.
  • Learn-it-all: Curious and keeps up to date on new developments in the industry and marketing discipline. Thrives in  a culture of experimentation and repetitive excellence.

• Experience with Salesforce, project management tools, marketing tech stack tools
  • Understanding of digital health market, in MSK or other specialty
  • Experience with healthcare consultant events or high-profile conferences is a plus, but not required.

descriptionPlain:
Hinge Health is building the world’s most patient-centered Digital Musculoskeletal (MSK) Clinic™. It is now the leading Digital MSK Clinic, used by four in five employers and 90% of health plans with a digital MSK solution. Hinge Health reduces MSK pain, surgeries, and opioid use by pairing advanced wearable sensors and computer vision technology with a comprehensive clinical care team of physical therapists, physicians, and board-certified health coaches. 

Hinge Health’s HingeConnect integrates with 750,000+ in-person providers and enables real-time interventions for elective MSK surgeries, driving proven medical claims reduction. Available to millions of members, Hinge Health is widely trusted by leading organizations, including Land O’Lakes, L.L. Bean, Salesforce, Self-Insured Schools of California, Southern Company, State of New Jersey, US Foods, and Verizon. Learn more at: http://www.hingehealth.com.

ABOUT THE ROLE
We are looking for an ML Engineer who can help to accelerate the hinge health AI/ML mission by working closely with the ML/ Data Science and Engineering teams.

ABOUT THE ROLE
We are looking for an ML Engineer who can help to accelerate the hinge health AI/ML mission by working closely with the ML/ Data Science and Engineering teams.

lists.content:
• Set up infrastructure and services required to perform ML inference at scale on the AWS cloud. 
  • Streamline the process to package, deploy and optimize ML models and expose them through API’s for Hinge Health applications or services to consume.
  • Enable Monitoring for ML models in production.
  • Help to streamline the ML development tools and process.

• 8+ years of software engineering experience, 2+ proven experience as an ML Engineer.
  • Ability to write robust code in Python.
  • Excellent technical communication skills, both written and verbal. 
  • Ability to work independently and as part of a team 
  • Understanding of data structures, data modeling and software architecture
  • Deep knowledge of math, probability, statistics and algorithms
  • Familiarity with machine learning frameworks (like Keras or PyTorch) and libraries (like scikit-learn)
  • Outstanding analytical and problem-solving skills
  • Comfort controlling the big data feed that will be used to train the AI
  • Experience in working with AWS ML services is a plus. 
  • Bachelor’s degree in a related field, such as computer science, software engineering or data science, is recommended. Master’s degree in Artificial Intelligence is a plus.

descriptionPlain:
One in two people experience debilitating back, neck, shoulder, or joint pain — but traditional treatments have failed to meet their needs. Physical therapy can be expensive and hard to access; appointments often involve long commutes and missed work. Making matters worse, unresolved pain can trigger the overuse of opioids and surgeries.

Join us in reimagining healthcare from the ground up. We’re making high-quality care accessible by pairing wearable sensors and computer vision with a world-class clinical team. Hinge Health puts a digital clinic in every member's pocket. Now millions of people can access personalized digital care from a physical therapist, guidance on behavior change from a health coach, and expert consultations with an orthopedic surgeon. With a single app and wearable technology like our Enso device, we’re helping to reduce pain, surgeries, and opioid use.

Here at Hinge Health, we welcome all applicants and know a diverse team makes us better and stronger. We look for individuals who embody our leadership principles and we value varied experiences and skill sets. Beyond specific work experience, we also look for unique capabilities and skill sets that are key indicators an applicant will thrive in our fast-paced, frequently evolving environment. If this sounds like the kind of place you’d like to be part of, please apply - we would love to hear from you!

Work From Anywhere
Hinge Health employees have the flexibility to work remotely in hubs across the US, Canada, and Latin America or work from our offices in San Francisco, Portland, and Montreal.

About the Role
We're looking for an experienced, mission-driven Product Manager to join us in creating behavioral health change. This person will be a leader within the product development team, and will work closely with engineering, design, product, clinical, and commercial teams at Hinge Health. The ideal candidate is someone who thrives in an entrepreneurial environment, with real autonomy and accountability for delivering business results. They will have a strong product background, a well-rounded understanding of current web and mobile technologies, and a passion for tackling meaningful problems in healthcare.

#LI-TB1

lists.content:
• Take a major role in defining product vision, strategy, and objectives.
  • Help develop and implement product-development practices, particularly related to rapid iteration. Mentor team members in adoption of these best practices.
  • Ship products within a cross-functional team, working closely with design, engineering, sales/marketing, and the clinical team throughout the whole process.
  • Work directly with executives and founders as the voice of your product team.
  • Track usage analytics, and patient impact of launches.
  • Ultimate responsibility for shipping products with meaningful business results, on time.

• 4+ years of experience in product management of mobile and web products.
  • Experience working in high-performing product teams, with a focus on cross-functional collaboration, early & rapid testing, and outcomes over output.
  • Demonstrated success in leading development of products and customer-facing features from inception to delivery.
  • Excellent problem-solving, project-management, and communication skills.
  • Technical fluency; comfort understanding and discussing technology concepts, experience evaluating tradeoffs and new opportunities with technical team members.
  • Strong analytical and experimental design skills.

• Experience in a related functional area (e.g. software engineering, product design, data science)
  • Experience in digital product development in the healthcare space
  • Experience building consumer technology products

• Inclusive healthcare and benefits: On top of comprehensive medical, dental, and vision coverage, we offer help with gender-affirming care, tools for family and fertility planning, and travel reimbursements if healthcare isn’t available where you live
  • Modern life stipends: Manage your own learning and development budget and use the mental health and lifestyle stipends to cover your favorite wellness services, workout classes, gym subscriptions, and work-from-home equipment
  • Flexible vacation and paid time off: Full-time employees have full flexibility to choose when, how, and why they take time off to rest and recharge

Work From Anywhere

About the Role
As a Senior Software Engineer - Mobile, you will design and implement end-to-end solutions for large-scale features, profile app performance to prevent feature bloat or battery drain, and help maintain a high bar with thoughtful and constructive code reviews.  

Our tech stack: ReactNative, React, Redux, Typescript, Rails, Redis, Postgres, Aptible, AWS and GraphQL. Our workflow is trunk-based CI/CD.  We deploy iOS and Android updates to users every two weeks. Our security/compliance posture is at the highest standards of healthcare, including HIPAA, HITRUST, SOC 2, CCPA.

lists.content:
• Every day, you’ll review 2x more PRs than you open.
  • Every sprint, you’ll ship meaningful, beautiful features that help reinforce healthy habit formation. 
  • Every month, you’ll address a couple performance or architecture concerns, balancing feature development with long-term tech investments to keep the platform healthy and nimble.
  • Every quarter, you’ll help define the objectives and key results that will shape your team’s roadmap.

• Delivery: Ability to break big projects into small, testable pieces to consistently hit business-meaningful milestones  
  • Domain Expertise: Fluency in React Native or similar cross-platform mobile development tools and a passion for user experience
  • Problem Solving: Business intuition that informs right-sized solutions, thoughtful trade offs, and game-changing innovation   
  • Communication: Clear, inclusive communication with both teammates and non-technical partners
  • Leadership: A track record of strong ownership, initiative, tenacity, integrity, and humility.
  • BS degree in Computer Science, Engineering or relevant field

• Inclusive healthcare and benefits: On top of comprehensive medical, dental, and vision coverage, we offer employees and their family members help with gender-affirming care, tools for family and fertility planning, and travel reimbursements if healthcare isn’t available where you live.
  • Planning for the future: Start saving for the future with our traditional or roth 401k retirement plan options which include a 2% company match.
  • Modern life stipends: Manage your own learning and development budget, use the mental health to support therapy costs, and lifestyle stipends to cover your favorite wellness services, and work-from-home equipment.
  • Flexible vacation and paid time off: Employees have flexibility to choose when, how, and why they take time off to rest and recharge. Exempt employees can take advantage of our flexible pto program. Nonexempt employees can utilize up to two weeks of sick time and up to 17 days of vacation per year, including mental health days.
  • Other compensation: At Hinge Health, we want every employee to be invested and rewarded in the future success of the company. All full-time positions are eligible for equity.

Hinge Health software engineers work on small interdisciplinary teams focused on different parts of the user journey. Mobile engineers contribute to their team’s success by adding beautiful, useful features to Hinge Health applications. Senior mobile engineers design and implement end-to-end solutions for large-scale features, profile app performance to prevent feature bloat or battery drain, and help maintain a high bar with thoughtful and constructive code reviews.  

Our tech stack: ReactNative, React, Redux, Typescript, Rails, Redis, Postgres, Aptible, AWS and GraphQL. Our workflow is trunk-based CI/CD.  We deploy iOS and Android updates to users every two weeks. Our security/compliance posture is at the highest standards of healthcare, including HIPAA, HITRUST, SOC 2, CCPA.

*This position is remote and open to all locations within Mexico.
*All applicants must have a professional level of mastery in English
*Please submit resumes & Applications in English.


#LI-KH1

lists.content:
• Every day, you’ll review 2x more PRs than you open.
  • Every sprint, you’ll ship meaningful, beautiful features that help reinforce healthy habit formation. 
  • Every month, you’ll address a couple performance or architecture concerns, balancing feature development with long-term tech investments to keep the platform healthy and nimble.
  • Every quarter, you’ll help define the objectives and key results that will shape your team’s roadmap.

• Delivery: Ability to break big projects into small, testable pieces to consistently hit business-meaningful milestones  
  • Domain Expertise: Fluency in React Native or similar cross-platform mobile development tools and a passion for user experience
  • Problem Solving: Business intuition that informs right-sized solutions, thoughtful trade offs, and game-changing innovation   
  • Communication: Clear, inclusive communication with both teammates and non-technical partners
  • Leadership: A track record of strong ownership, initiative, tenacity, integrity, and humility.
  • BS degree in Computer Science, Engineering or relevant field

additionalPlain:
About Hinge Health:
LinkedIn recently named Hinge Health one of the Top 50 Startups. Forbes, Fast Company, and Inc. have also recognized our technology, innovation, and culture.

Since our founding in 2014, we've raised more than $800 million from leading investors, including Coatue and Tiger Global. We work with 1000 customers across every industry and the public sector — including Salesforce, Verizon, and the State of New Jersey — to give more than 23 million people access to the care they need. We’re positioned to continue leading the market with unmatched investments in clinical research, care innovation, machine learning, AI, and computer vision.

Diversity and inclusion:
We’re committed to building diverse teams that reflect the communities we serve. Visit hingehealth.com/diversity-equity-and-inclusion to learn more about what moves us. 



Hinge Health is an equal opportunity employer and prohibits discrimination and harassment of any kind. We make employment decisions without regards to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, age, veteran status, disability status, pregnancy, or any other basis protected by federal, state or local law. We also consider qualified applicants regardless of criminal histories, consistent with legal requirements.

We provide reasonable accommodations for candidates with disabilities. If you feel you need assistance or an accommodation due to a disability, let us know by reaching out to your recruiter.


Disclaimer:
There continues to be a significant increase in phishing attempts across all industries where fraudsters are impersonating real employees and sending fictitious job offers to applicants in a scheme to obtain sensitive information. Please note that we will never ask for your financial information at any part of the interview process including the post-offer stage, and will only correspond through @hingehealth.com domain email addresses.

If you encounter any suspicious activity, we recommend you cease all communication with the individual and consider reporting them to the US FBI Internet Crime Complaint Center. If you would like to verify the legitimacy of an email you received from our recruiting team, please forward it to security@hingehealth.com. 

*Please do not send resumes via email*

If you're interested - we'd love to hear from you.

descriptionPlain:
One in two people experience debilitating back, neck, shoulder, or joint pain — but traditional treatments have failed to meet their needs. Physical therapy can be expensive and hard to access; appointments often involve long commutes and missed work. Making matters worse, unresolved pain can trigger the overuse of opioids and surgeries.

Join us in reimagining healthcare from the ground up. We’re making high-quality care accessible by pairing wearable sensors and computer vision with a world-class clinical team. Hinge Health puts a digital clinic in every member's pocket. Now millions of people can access personalized digital care from a physical therapist, guidance on behavior change from a health coach, and expert consultations with an orthopedic surgeon. With a single app and wearable technology like our Enso device, we’re helping to reduce pain, surgeries, and opioid use.

Here at Hinge Health, we welcome all applicants and know a diverse team makes us better and stronger. We look for individuals who embody our leadership principles and we value varied experiences and skill sets. Beyond specific work experience, we also look for unique capabilities and skill sets that are key indicators an applicant will thrive in our fast-paced, frequently evolving environment. If this sounds like the kind of place you’d like to be part of, please apply - we would love to hear from you!

Work From Anywhere
Hinge Health employees have the flexibility to work remotely in hubs across the US, Canada, and Latin America or work from our offices in San Francisco, Portland, and Montreal.

About the Role
Hinge Health software engineers work on small interdisciplinary teams focused on different parts of the user journey. Mobile engineers contribute to their team’s success by adding beautiful, useful features to Hinge Health applications. Senior mobile engineers design and implement end-to-end solutions for large-scale features, profile app performance to prevent feature bloat or battery drain, and help maintain a high bar with thoughtful and constructive code reviews.  

Our tech stack: ReactNative, React, Redux, Typescript, Rails, Redis, Postgres, Aptible, AWS and GraphQL. Our workflow is trunk-based CI/CD.  We deploy iOS and Android updates to users every two weeks. Our security/compliance posture is at the highest standards of healthcare, including HIPAA, HITRUST, SOC 2, CCPA.


*This position is remote and open to all locations within Brazil.
*All applicants must have a professional level of mastery in English
*Please submit resumes & Applications in English.

descriptionPlain:
One in two people experience debilitating back, neck, shoulder, or joint pain — but traditional treatments have failed to meet their needs. Physical therapy can be expensive and hard to access; appointments often involve long commutes and missed work. Making matters worse, unresolved pain can trigger the overuse of opioids and surgeries.

Join us in reimagining healthcare from the ground up. We’re making high-quality care accessible by pairing wearable sensors and computer vision with a world-class clinical team. Hinge Health puts a digital clinic in every member's pocket. Now millions of people can access personalized digital care from a physical therapist, guidance on behavior change from a health coach, and expert consultations with an orthopedic surgeon. With a single app and wearable technology like our Enso device, we’re helping to reduce pain, surgeries, and opioid use.

Here at Hinge Health, we welcome all applicants and know a diverse team makes us better and stronger. We look for individuals who embody our leadership principles and we value varied experiences and skill sets. Beyond specific work experience, we also look for unique capabilities and skill sets that are key indicators an applicant will thrive in our fast-paced, frequently evolving environment. If this sounds like the kind of place you’d like to be part of, please apply - we would love to hear from you!

Work From Anywhere
Hinge Health employees have the flexibility to work remotely in hubs across the US, Canada, and Latin America or work from our offices in San Francisco, Portland, and Montreal.

About the Role
Hinge Health software engineers work on small interdisciplinary teams focused on different parts of the user journey. Mobile engineers contribute to their team’s success by adding beautiful, useful features to Hinge Health applications. Senior mobile engineers design and implement end-to-end solutions for large-scale features, profile app performance to prevent feature bloat or battery drain, and help maintain a high bar with thoughtful and constructive code reviews.  

Our tech stack: ReactNative, React, Redux, Typescript, Rails, Redis, Postgres, Aptible, AWS and GraphQL. Our workflow is trunk-based CI/CD.  We deploy iOS and Android updates to users every two weeks. Our security/compliance posture is at the highest standards of healthcare, including HIPAA, HITRUST, SOC 2, CCPA.

*All applicants must have a professional level of mastery in English
*Please submit resumes & Applications in English.

#LI-KH1

lists.content:
• Every day, you’ll review 2x more PRs than you open.
  • Every sprint, you’ll ship meaningful, beautiful features that help reinforce healthy habit formation. 
  • Every month, you’ll address a couple performance or architecture concerns, balancing feature development with long-term tech investments to keep the platform healthy and nimble.
  • Every quarter, you’ll help define the objectives and key results that will shape your team’s roadmap.

• Delivery: Ability to break big projects into small, testable pieces to consistently hit business-meaningful milestones  
  • Domain Expertise: Fluency in React Native or similar cross-platform mobile development tools and a passion for user experience
  • Problem Solving: Business intuition that informs right-sized solutions, thoughtful trade offs, and game-changing innovation   
  • Communication: Clear, inclusive communication with both teammates and non-technical partners
  • Leadership: A track record of strong ownership, initiative, tenacity, integrity, and humility.
  • BS degree in Computer Science, Engineering or relevant field

• Inclusive healthcare and benefits: On top of comprehensive medical, dental, and vision coverage, we offer help with gender-affirming care, tools for family and fertility planning, and travel reimbursements if healthcare isn’t available where you live
  • Modern life stipends: Manage your own learning and development budget and use the mental health and lifestyle stipends to cover your favorite wellness services, workout classes, gym subscriptions, and work-from-home equipment
  • Flexible vacation and paid time off: Full-time employees have full flexibility to choose when, how, and why they take time off to rest and recharge

descriptionPlain:
One in two people experience debilitating back, neck, shoulder, or joint pain — but traditional treatments have failed to meet their needs. Physical therapy can be expensive and hard to access; appointments often involve long commutes and missed work. Making matters worse, unresolved pain can trigger the overuse of opioids and surgeries.

Join us in reimagining healthcare from the ground up. We’re making high-quality care accessible by pairing wearable sensors and computer vision with a world-class clinical team. Hinge Health puts a digital clinic in every member's pocket. Now millions of people can access personalized digital care from a physical therapist, guidance on behavior change from a health coach, and expert consultations with an orthopedic surgeon. With a single app and wearable technology like our Enso device, we’re helping to reduce pain, surgeries, and opioid use.


About the Role
Hinge Health is looking for someone with a background in revenue cycle management (RCM) - with an understanding of the mechanics and complexity of healthcare reimbursement. We are seeking an individual who is willing to roll up his or her sleeves and dig into data trends, enjoys working cross-functionally to streamline our revenue cycle, and is comfortable manipulating data to report on the financial stability of our business directly to leadership. 

The ideal candidate will have experience in Revenue Cycle and/or Healthcare Consulting. We are looking for an individual who is a self-starter, passionate about Revenue Cycle, someone who can see the “big picture” but is also willing to roll up their sleeves and get their hands “dirty’ to continuously optimize the process in which we get reimbursed for our digital health programs. Finance and accounting experience is a plus, but not required. Startup experience is a plus but not a must.

lists.content:
• Independently own Revenue Cycle initiatives from inception through execution, building comprehensive project plans from scratch and coordinating with stakeholders as needed
  • Build scalable billing practices from pre-submission to post-submission with the ultimate goal of accelerating cash collections
  • Project manage parts of the entire Revenue Cycle function in regards to setting up new payment structures as Hinge Health expands program offerings
  • Continuously work to identify and implement areas of improvement in the Company’s revenue cycle, developing processes and documentation for how to achieve these
  • RCM process improvements include (but are not limited to):
  • Claims submission and management 
  • Denials and A/R management 
  • Cash collections
  • Report to leadership on key revenue cycle metrics such as claim denials or underpayments, and identify ways to improve and avoid these moving forward
  • Build out reporting for revenue cycle KPIs, including denial rate, write-off rate, charge lag, time to cash, etc. 
  • Own the entire life-cycle of billing for a new client which includes participating in external calls with clients, partners, payers/health plans and representing Hinge Health as the Revenue Cycle SME
  • Confidently explain Hinge Health’s reimbursement model and work with external partners to obtain any necessary information for successful billing and collections
  • Build solid documentation (memos, incident reports, meeting agendas etc.) for any items that involve Revenue Cycle Management; as needed
  • Develop Revenue Cycle-specific policies as needed
  • Communicate cross-functionally with the Commercial teams to ensure we are able to bill our new clients, and escalate any claim issues when needed
  • Work cross-functionally with the Product/Engineering team to help automate billing processes
  • Act as the intermediary between the Commercial team and Product team for any billing and reimbursement-specific requirements
  • Train and educate team members on RCM best practices and industry benchmarks
  • Present and educate internal teams on Hinge Health’s billing practices, pricing differences and client-specific billing structures

• At least 2-3 years of experience in healthcare provider revenue cycle, preferably in a consulting or analytics role
  • Working knowledge of industry best practices in Revenue Cycle processes: billing, charge capture, contractual adjustments, third-party reimbursements, and cash collections 
  • Experience working cross-functionally with different teams and project managing internal projects with multiple competing stakeholders
  • Attention to detail, exceptional organizational skills, and strong affinity for solving complex problems
  • Efficient written and verbal communication skills
  • Advanced Excel skills
  • Persistence when working and communicating with insurance payers
  • Fundamental knowledge of revenue integrity (i.e. CPT and ICD-10 coding) 
  • Comfortable working with the ambiguity of a fast-paced startup
  • Degree in healthcare management, accounting, finance or business preferred, but not required

• Inclusive healthcare and benefits: On top of comprehensive medical, dental, and vision coverage, we offer help with gender-affirming care, tools for family and fertility planning, and travel reimbursements if healthcare isn’t available where you live
  • Modern life stipends: Manage your own learning and development budget and use the mental health and lifestyle stipends to cover your favorite wellness services, workout classes, gym subscriptions, and work-from-home equipment
  • Flexible vacation and paid time off: Full-time employees have full flexibility to choose when, how, and why they take time off to rest and recharge

descriptionPlain:
One in two people experience debilitating back, neck, shoulder, or joint pain — but traditional treatments have failed to meet their needs. Physical therapy can be expensive and hard to access; appointments often involve long commutes and missed work. Making matters worse, unresolved pain can trigger the overuse of opioids and surgeries.

Join us in reimagining healthcare from the ground up. We’re making high-quality care accessible by pairing wearable sensors and computer vision with a world-class clinical team. Hinge Health puts a digital clinic in every member's pocket. Now millions of people can access personalized digital care from a physical therapist, guidance on behavior change from a health coach, and expert consultations with an orthopedic surgeon. With a single app and wearable technology like our Enso device, we’re helping to reduce pain, surgeries, and opioid use.

Here at Hinge Health, we welcome all applicants and know a diverse team makes us better and stronger. We look for individuals who embody our leadership principles and we value varied experiences and skill sets. Beyond specific work experience, we also look for unique capabilities and skill sets that are key indicators an applicant will thrive in our fast-paced, frequently evolving environment. If this sounds like the kind of place you’d like to be part of, please apply - we would love to hear from you!

Work From Anywhere
Hinge Health employees have the flexibility to work remotely in hubs across the US, Canada, and Latin America or work from our offices in San Francisco, Portland, and Montreal.

About the Role
Backend Engineers at Hinge Health contribute to their team’s success by architecting and implementing end-to-end solutions, well-tested performant APIs and data models. In addition, candidates will profile their systems to stay out ahead of scaling bottlenecks, and help maintain a high bar with thoughtful and constructive code reviews. The ideal candidate thrives in a highly collaborative, cross functional environment.

Our tech stack: Rails, Nodejs, TypeScript, Nestjs, GraphQL, Docker, React, React Native, Aptible, AWS, Postgres, Redis, Apollo, and Redux. Our workflow is trunk-based CI/CD, and our security/compliance posture is at the highest standards of healthcare, including HIPAA, HITRUST, SOC 2, CCPA.

#LI-KH2

lists.content:
• Every day, you’ll review 2x more PRs than you open.
  • Every sprint, you’ll design and incrementally deliver meaningful, complex features. 
  • Every month, you’ll resolve a couple performance and scaling bottlenecks, balancing feature development with long-term tech investments to keep the platform healthy and nimble.
  • Every quarter, you’ll help define the objectives and key results that will shape your team’s roadmap.

• Delivery: Ability to break big projects into small, testable pieces to consistently hit business-meaningful milestones  
  • Domain Expertise: Experience with distributed microservices architecture built in Docker containers utilizing Ruby on Rails and/or Nodejs/TypeScript
  • Experience with RESTful and GraphQL API
  • Experience with relational databases and caching systems
  • Experience working with CI/CD tools
  • Experience building fault-tolerant, distributed systems
  • Experience with message queues is a plus
  • Problem Solving: Business intuition that informs right-sized solutions, thoughtful trade offs, and game-changing innovation   
  • Communication: Clear, inclusive communication with both teammates and non-technical partners
  • Leadership: A track record of strong ownership, initiative, tenacity, integrity, and humility
  • BS degree in Computer Science, Engineering or relevant field

• Inclusive healthcare and benefits: On top of comprehensive medical, dental, and vision coverage, we offer employees and their family members help with gender-affirming care, tools for family and fertility planning, and travel reimbursements if healthcare isn’t available where you live.
  • Planning for the future: Start saving for the future with our traditional or roth 401k retirement plan options which include a 2% company match.
  • Modern life stipends: Manage your own learning and development budget, use the mental health to support therapy costs, and lifestyle stipends to cover your favorite wellness services, and work-from-home equipment.
  • Flexible vacation and paid time off: Employees have flexibility to choose when, how, and why they take time off to rest and recharge. Exempt employees can take advantage of our flexible pto program. Nonexempt employees can utilize up to two weeks of sick time and up to 17 days of vacation per year, including mental health days.
  • Other compensation: At Hinge Health, we want every employee to be invested and rewarded in the future success of the company. All full-time positions are eligible for equity.

additionalPlain:
The range of base salary for the position is between $106,400 - $159,600, plus equity, and benefits.  Please note that the base salary range is a guideline, and individual total compensation will vary based on factors such as qualifications, skill level, competencies and work location.

One in two people experience debilitating back, neck, shoulder, or joint pain — but traditional treatments have failed to meet their needs. Physical therapy can be expensive and hard to access; appointments often involve long commutes and missed work. Making matters worse, unresolved pain can trigger the overuse of opioids and surgeries.

Join us in reimagining healthcare from the ground up. We’re making high-quality care accessible by pairing wearable sensors and computer vision with a world-class clinical team. Hinge Health puts a digital clinic in every member's pocket. Now millions of people can access personalized digital care from a physical therapist, guidance on behavior change from a health coach, and expert consultations with an orthopedic surgeon. With a single app and wearable technology like our Enso device, we’re helping to reduce pain, surgeries, and opioid use.

Here at Hinge Health, we welcome all applicants and know a diverse team makes us better and stronger. We look for individuals who embody our leadership principles and we value varied experiences and skill sets. Beyond specific work experience, we also look for unique capabilities and skill sets that are key indicators an applicant will thrive in our fast-paced, frequently evolving environment. If this sounds like the kind of place you’d like to be part of, please apply - we would love to hear from you!

Work From Anywhere
Hinge Health employees have the flexibility to work remotely in hubs across the US, Canada, and Latin America or work from our offices in San Francisco, Portland, and Montreal.

About the Role
Software Engineers at Hinge Health work on small interdisciplinary teams focused on different parts of the user journey. Fullstack Engineers contribute to their team’s success by building and extending secure, scalable services and exposing clear, well-tested APIs that power beautiful client applications. You will also design and implement end-to-end solutions, profile their systems to stay out ahead of scaling bottlenecks, and help maintain a high bar with thoughtful and constructive code reviews.   

Our tech stack: Nodejs, TypeScript, Nestjs, GraphQL, Docker, React, React Native, Rails, Aptible, AWS, Postgres, Redis, Apollo, and Redux.  Our workflow is trunk-based CI/CD, and our security/compliance posture is at the highest standards of healthcare, including HIPAA, HITRUST, SOC 2, CCPA.

*This position is remote and open to all locations within Mexico.
*All applicants must have a professional level of mastery in English
*Please submit resumes & applications in English.

#LI-LR1

lists.content:
• Every day, you’ll review 2x more PRs than you open.
  • Every sprint, you’ll design and incrementally deliver meaningful, complex features. 
  • Every month, you’ll resolve a couple performance and scaling bottlenecks, balancing feature development with long-term tech investments to keep the platform healthy and nimble.
  • Every quarter, you’ll help define the objectives and key results that will shape your team’s roadmap.

• Delivery: Ability to break big projects into small, testable pieces to consistently hit business-meaningful milestones  
  • Domain Expertise: Experience with distributed microservices architecture built in Docker containers utilizing Nodejs/TypeScript and/or Ruby on Rails.  Experience with React and/or React Native with Apollo client and Redux.
  • Problem Solving: Business intuition that informs right-sized solutions, thoughtful trade offs, and game-changing innovation   
  • Communication: Clear, inclusive communication with both teammates and non-technical partners
  • Leadership: A track record of strong ownership, initiative, tenacity, integrity, and humility
  • BS degree in Computer Science, Engineering or relevant field

additionalPlain:
About Hinge Health:
LinkedIn recently named Hinge Health one of the Top 50 Startups. Forbes, Fast Company, and Inc. have also recognized our technology, innovation, and culture.

Since our founding in 2014, we've raised more than $800 million from leading investors, including Coatue and Tiger Global. We work with 1000 customers across every industry and the public sector — including Salesforce, Verizon, and the State of New Jersey — to give more than 23 million people access to the care they need. We’re positioned to continue leading the market with unmatched investments in clinical research, care innovation, machine learning, AI, and computer vision.

Diversity and inclusion:
We’re committed to building diverse teams that reflect the communities we serve. Visit hingehealth.com/diversity-equity-and-inclusion to learn more about what moves us. 



Hinge Health is an equal opportunity employer and prohibits discrimination and harassment of any kind. We make employment decisions without regards to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, age, veteran status, disability status, pregnancy, or any other basis protected by federal, state or local law. We also consider qualified applicants regardless of criminal histories, consistent with legal requirements.

We provide reasonable accommodations for candidates with disabilities. If you feel you need assistance or an accommodation due to a disability, let us know by reaching out to your recruiter.


Disclaimer:
There continues to be a significant increase in phishing attempts across all industries where fraudsters are impersonating real employees and sending fictitious job offers to applicants in a scheme to obtain sensitive information. Please note that we will never ask for your financial information at any part of the interview process including the post-offer stage, and will only correspond through @hingehealth.com domain email addresses.

If you encounter any suspicious activity, we recommend you cease all communication with the individual and consider reporting them to the US FBI Internet Crime Complaint Center. If you would like to verify the legitimacy of an email you received from our recruiting team, please forward it to security@hingehealth.com. 

*Please do not send resumes via email*

If you're interested - we'd love to hear from you.
