Hinge Health employees have the flexibility to work remotely in hubs across the US, Canada, and Latin America or work from our offices in San Francisco, Portland, and Montreal.

About the Role
Hinge Health software engineers work on small interdisciplinary teams focused on different parts of the user journey. Full-Stack engineers contribute to their team’s success by building and extending secure, scalable services and exposing clear, well-tested APIs that power beautiful client applications. Senior full-stack engineers design and implement end-to-end solutions, profile their systems to stay out ahead of scaling bottlenecks, and help maintain a high bar with thoughtful and constructive code reviews.   

Our tech stack: Nodejs, TypeScript, Nestjs, GraphQL, Docker, React, React Native, Rails, Aptible, AWS, Postgres, Redis, Apollo, and Redux.  Our workflow is trunk-based CI/CD, and our security/compliance posture is at the highest standards of healthcare, including HIPAA, HITRUST, SOC 2, CCPA.

*This role is remote and open to all locations within Brazil.
*All applicants must have a professional level of mastery in English
*Please submit resumes & Applications in English.

#LI-KH1

lists.content:
• Every day, you’ll review 2x more PRs than you open.
  • Every sprint, you’ll design and incrementally deliver meaningful, complex features. 
  • Every month, you’ll resolve a couple performance and scaling bottlenecks, balancing feature development with long-term tech investments to keep the platform healthy and nimble.
  • Every quarter, you’ll help define the objectives and key results that will shape your team’s roadmap.

• Delivery: Ability to break big projects into small, testable pieces to consistently hit business-meaningful milestones  
  • Domain Expertise: Experience with distributed microservices architecture built in Docker containers utilizing Nodejs/TypeScript and/or Ruby on Rails.  Experience with React and/or React Native with Apollo client and Redux.
  • Problem Solving: Business intuition that informs right-sized solutions, thoughtful trade offs, and game-changing innovation   
  • Communication: Clear, inclusive communication with both teammates and non-technical partners
  • Leadership: A track record of strong ownership, initiative, tenacity, integrity, and humility
  • BS degree in Computer Science, Engineering or relevant field

descriptionPlain:
One in two people experience debilitating back, neck, shoulder, or joint pain — but traditional treatments have failed to meet their needs. Physical therapy can be expensive and hard to access; appointments often involve long commutes and missed work. Making matters worse, unresolved pain can trigger the overuse of opioids and surgeries.

Join us in reimagining healthcare from the ground up. We’re making high-quality care accessible by pairing wearable sensors and computer vision with a world-class clinical team. Hinge Health puts a digital clinic in every member's pocket. Now millions of people can access personalized digital care from a physical therapist, guidance on behavior change from a health coach, and expert consultations with an orthopedic surgeon. With a single app and wearable technology like our Enso device, we’re helping to reduce pain, surgeries, and opioid use.

Here at Hinge Health, we welcome all applicants and know a diverse team makes us better and stronger. We look for individuals who embody our leadership principles and we value varied experiences and skill sets. Beyond specific work experience, we also look for unique capabilities and skill sets that are key indicators an applicant will thrive in our fast-paced, frequently evolving environment. If this sounds like the kind of place you’d like to be part of, please apply - we would love to hear from you!

Work From Anywhere
Hinge Health employees have the flexibility to work remotely in hubs across the United States.

About the Role
This role’s mission is to facilitate the timely delivery of complex product launches to the market. This will start with the launch and scale-up of the constituent programs of Hinge Health’s Digital MSK Clinic. 

You will help drive launch strategy, align teams, identify and resolve cross-team dependencies and collaborate with cross-functional stakeholders.

We’re looking for an experienced Senior Technical Program Manager to support the timely delivery of complex product launches to the market. This will start with the launch and scale-up of the constituent programs of Hinge Health’s Digital MSK Clinic. 

The Technical Program Manager will help drive launch strategy, align teams, identify and resolve cross-team dependencies, and collaborate with cross-functional stakeholders and company leadership.

The ideal candidate will have significant Technical Program Management experience delivering programs that include both software and operations components. We are looking for a highly collaborative individual who is able to sweat the details with the engineering team, make effective tradeoffs, and create a tight feedback loop between the delivery teams and executive leadership.

lists.content:
• Programs are brought to market on time, with appropriate tradeoffs made.
  • Management and development teams have clear visibility into program progress and are made aware of timeline risks and tradeoff decisions.
  • Cross team dependencies are identified early and incorporated into the program planning.
  • Teams are trained up on program delivery and management best practices. Velocity and reliability are increased due to adoption of these practices.

• Product delivery: Expertise in Agile development practices at scale. Understanding of modern dev ops practices.
  • Technical & business knowledge: Able to discuss implementation details with engineers to identify cross-team dependencies. Understands of the broader business strategy and uses this to inform the program design.
  • Collaboration: Able to build productive relationships with members of delivery teams and executives. Facilitates cross-team collaboration. Influences others across the company without direct authority. 
  • Project management: Organize and track jobs, clarify project scope, proactively manage risks, manage project escalations, ruthlessly prioritize tasks, and problem-solve.

• Inclusive healthcare and benefits: On top of comprehensive medical, dental, and vision coverage, we offer help with gender-affirming care, tools for family and fertility planning, and travel reimbursements if healthcare isn’t available where you live
  • Modern life stipends: Manage your own learning and development budget and use the mental health and lifestyle stipends to cover your favorite wellness services, workout classes, gym subscriptions, and work-from-home equipment
  • Flexible vacation and paid time off: Full-time employees have full flexibility to choose when, how, and why they take time off to rest and recharge

descriptionPlain:
One in two people experience debilitating back, neck, shoulder, or joint pain — but traditional treatments have failed to meet their needs. Physical therapy can be expensive and hard to access; appointments often involve long commutes and missed work. Making matters worse, unresolved pain can trigger the overuse of opioids and surgeries.

Join us in reimagining healthcare from the ground up. We’re making high-quality care accessible by pairing wearable sensors and computer vision with a world-class clinical team. Hinge Health puts a digital clinic in every member's pocket. Now millions of people can access personalized digital care from a physical therapist, guidance on behavior change from a health coach, and expert consultations with an orthopedic surgeon. With a single app and wearable technology like our Enso device, we’re helping to reduce pain, surgeries, and opioid use.

Here at Hinge Health, we welcome all applicants and know a diverse team makes us better and stronger. We look for individuals who embody our leadership principles and we value varied experiences and skill sets. Beyond specific work experience, we also look for unique capabilities and skill sets that are key indicators an applicant will thrive in our fast-paced, frequently evolving environment. If this sounds like the kind of place you’d like to be part of, please apply - we would love to hear from you!

Work From Anywhere
Hinge Health employees have the flexibility to work remotely in hubs across the US, Canada, and Latin America or work from our offices in San Francisco, Portland, and Montreal.

About the Role
The Design & UX Group is highly multidisciplinary made up of designers from all backgrounds (product, industrial, visual, motion, etc), researchers, content strategists, program managers, and more.
 
Come join us. https://www.hingehealth.design/
 
The mission for this role is to design a distinctive series of new products to improve the members’ balance and strength. You will be responsible for defining the product vision, designing the end user experience and delivering the experience for market launch. This highly strategic and innovative design role is the key to scaling the Hinge Health product offerings, while fundamentally changing the standard of care. You will have a direct impact in improving the lives of people struggling with muscular skeletal health conditions.

#LI-ME1

lists.content:
• Grow and lead a talented team of designers, responsible for end to end product experiences and features across desktop, mobile and more.
  • Manage the user experience design of multiple mid-to-large-sized programs through leading a design team.
  • Set vision for the organization and influence product strategic roadmap. Lead the discovery, strategize concept design and launch phases of a project.
  • Champion user-centered design culture. Drive creative process and collaboration with cross-functional partners to propose new ideas and strategies.
  • Provide coaching and feedback, with an emphasis on growing lead ICs and leadership capability.
  • Create and drive adoption of design guidelines, mechanisms, best practices, process and tools.

• 8+ years of UX/product/service design experience
  • 3+ years of experience managing at least 5 product designers
  • Experience in hiring and leading design teams that deliver end-to-end experiences with large scope and complexity
  • Experience managing designers with demonstrated impact.
  • Experience in driving viable UX frameworks and product architectures in highly ambiguous environments.
  • Demonstrated ability to deliver mid-to-large-scale strategic design initiatives with a bias toward scalable systems and patterns.
  • Excellent communication, presentation, and interpersonal skills.
  • Track record of successfully building, growing and retaining senior design talent, promoting strong creative team culture.
  • Demonstrates an awareness and sensitivity to the needs and concerns of individuals and stakeholders from diverse cultures, backgrounds and orientations.
  • Portfolio that showcases your strong skills in user experience, service, interaction and product design
  • Bachelor's or Master’s degree in Interaction Design, Product Design, Industrial Design, Human-computer Interaction (HCI), or equivalent

• A 0 to 1 mindset — you’re comfortable navigating ambiguity, partnering closely with product and engineering teammates to make decisions quickly, learn from them, and iterate. You aren’t afraid to put something out there to get rapid feedback.
  • Design innovator — you are excited to redefine a space by bringing novel, delightful ideas to the table. You are able to pull from unexpected sources of inspiration.
  • Master of many mediums — you design seamlessly across mobile, desktop, wearables and other interfaces

• Inclusive healthcare and benefits: On top of comprehensive medical, dental, and vision coverage, we offer employees and their family members help with gender-affirming care, tools for family and fertility planning, and travel reimbursements if healthcare isn’t available where you live.
  • Planning for the future: Start saving for the future with our traditional or roth 401k retirement plan options which include a 2% company match.
  • Modern life stipends: Manage your own learning and development budget, use the mental health to support therapy costs, and lifestyle stipends to cover your favorite wellness services, and work-from-home equipment.
  • Flexible vacation and paid time off: Employees have flexibility to choose when, how, and why they take time off to rest and recharge. Exempt employees can take advantage of our flexible pto program. Nonexempt employees can utilize up to two weeks of sick time and up to 17 days of vacation per year, including mental health days.
  • Other compensation: At Hinge Health, we want every employee to be invested and rewarded in the future success of the company. All full-time positions are eligible for equity.

descriptionPlain:
One in two people experience debilitating back, neck, shoulder, or joint pain — but traditional treatments have failed to meet their needs. Physical therapy can be expensive and hard to access; appointments often involve long commutes and missed work. Making matters worse, unresolved pain can trigger the overuse of opioids and surgeries.

Join us in reimagining healthcare from the ground up. We’re making high-quality care accessible by pairing wearable sensors and computer vision with a world-class clinical team. Hinge Health puts a digital clinic in every member's pocket. Now millions of people can access personalized digital care from a physical therapist, guidance on behavior change from a health coach, and expert consultations with an orthopedic surgeon. With a single app and wearable technology like our Enso device, we’re helping to reduce pain, surgeries, and opioid use.

Work From Anywhere
Hinge Health Employees have the flexibility to work anywhere, within the country they are hired. 

About the Role
Hinge Health is pioneering the world’s most patient-centered Digital Musculoskeletal (MSK) Clinic™. Four in five employers and 90% of health plans with a digital MSK solution have chosen Hinge Health. Hinge Health reduces MSK pain, surgeries and opiate use by pairing advanced wearable sensors and computer vision technology with a comprehensive Clinical Care Team of physical therapists, physicians, board-certified health coaches, and more. Hinge Health’s HingeConnect integrates with 750,000+ in-person providers and enables real-time interventions for elective MSK surgeries, driving proven medical claims reduction. 

Available to over 12 million members, Hinge Health is the #1 Digital MSK Clinic with 500+ employer and health plan customers, including Boeing, Salesforce, and US Foods. Hinge Health has raised $426M to date with offices across San Francisco, Austin, Chicago, Denver, Minneapolis, Portland, Seattle and more. We’re hiring! Join us at hingehealth.com/careers

To support our expansion to India, we are hiring a tenacious, entrepreneurial and driven Sr. HR Business Partner to join us on this amazing journey.  People are the most important asset in any company and at Hinge Health we pride ourselves on the amazing team we’ve built thus far. You will partner with the local site lead, People team, and local agencies to build the R&D team in Bangalore, ensuring a delightful candidate experience and smooth onboarding to the corporate culture.  You will work closely with our People Team and Leaders to localize and deploy key strategic HR programs to support employee engagement and retention efforts. 

The ideal candidate will have a combination of full-cycle recruiting and HR experience in start-up environments.

lists.content:
• Lead people development initiatives, including role specific and HH culture training
  • Partner with the People Team and the People Business Partners in implementing HR programs locally. 
  • Identify and drive initiatives to build an engaged, connected and inclusive culture
  • Lead onboarding efforts for local hires to ensure a seamless first 90 day experience
  • Build a high performance culture by leading talent management efforts and coaching managers
  • Respond to HR questions and escalate to senior leadership and/or broader People Team if necessary
  • Manage employment agreements, local compliance, and vendor relationships for people initiatives.
  • Build and execute Hinge Health branding efforts locally, establishing the company as a best in class employer
  • Develop, implement, and execute hiring strategies to attract diverse local talent with strong technical depth. You are able to work collaboratively with your hiring manager and Talent Associate to achieve at least 90% of the hiring goals set for you.
  • Provide a seamless recruiting process for various hiring managers and technical teams. You score at least a 4 out of 5 in the Talent Partner satisfaction survey.
  • Provide a delightful candidate experience to support the company’s brand.  Candidates give us at least a 4 out  of 5 rating in the "candidate experience survey” for the roles that fall under your umbrella.

• Problem-solving: Able to identify and implement solutions for complex problems, including problem-solving across all stages of the hiring cycle. 
  • Attention to Detail: Can manage complex processes and maintains close attention to detail
  • Systems Thinker: Able to break down a problem and identify root causes. 
  • Discreet: Able to maintain confidential information and be discreet with employee data and situations
  • Resilient: Able to take complete control over how you respond to situations and respond from a position of strength. 
  • Change management/Influential: Able to influence stakeholders (including candidates) throughout the hiring process. Eg: You are not always being a yes-man but rather acting as a strategic partner by pushing back respectfully and influencing stakeholders in the right direction as and when necessary. 
  • Analytical (Data-driven): You are able to analyze reports and dashboards to provide meaningful insights and recommendations to key stakeholders.
  • Ambiguity: You are comfortable navigating through ambiguous problems with independence.
  • Minimum of 10 years of experience in talent acquisition and human resources is required.  5+ years of Business Partner experience. 
  • Working knowledge of multiple human resource disciplines, including compensation practices, organizational design, employee relations, diversity, performance management, and local employment laws.
  • Bachelor's degree in Business Administration, Human Resources, or similar required. Masters in Organizational Design preferred

• Minimum of 10 years of experience in talent acquisition and human resources is required.  5+ years of Business Partner experience. 
  • Working knowledge of multiple human resource disciplines, including compensation practices, organizational design, employee relations, diversity, performance management, and local employment laws.
  • Bachelor's degree in Business Administration, Human Resources, or similar required. Masters in Organizational Design preferred

  • Master of many mediums — you design seamlessly across mobile, desktop, wearables and other interfaces

• Inclusive healthcare and benefits: On top of comprehensive medical, dental, and vision coverage, we offer help with gender-affirming care, tools for family and fertility planning, and travel reimbursements if healthcare isn’t available where you live
  • Modern life stipends: Manage your own learning and development budget and use the mental health and lifestyle stipends to cover your favorite wellness services, workout classes, gym subscriptions, and work-from-home equipment
  • Flexible vacation and paid time off: Full-time employees have full flexibility to choose when, how, and why they take time off to rest and recharge

descriptionPlain:
One in two people experience debilitating back, neck, shoulder, or joint pain — but traditional treatments have failed to meet their needs. Physical therapy can be expensive and hard to access; appointments often involve long commutes and missed work. Making matters worse, unresolved pain can trigger the overuse of opioids and surgeries.

Join us in reimagining healthcare from the ground up. We’re making high-quality care accessible by pairing wearable sensors and computer vision with a world-class clinical team. Hinge Health puts a digital clinic in every member's pocket. Now millions of people can access personalized digital care from a physical therapist, guidance on behavior change from a health coach, and expert consultations with an orthopedic surgeon. With a single app and wearable technology like our Enso device, we’re helping to reduce pain, surgeries, and opioid use.

Here at Hinge Health, we welcome all applicants and know a diverse team makes us better and stronger. We look for individuals who embody our leadership principles and we value varied experiences and skill sets. Beyond specific work experience, we also look for unique capabilities and skill sets that are key indicators an applicant will thrive in our fast-paced, frequently evolving environment. If this sounds like the kind of place you’d like to be part of, please apply - we would love to hear from you!

Work From Anywhere
Hinge Health Employees have the flexibility to work anywhere, within the country they are hired. 

About the Role
The Design & UX Group is highly multidisciplinary made up of designers from all backgrounds (product, industrial, visual, motion, etc), researchers, content strategists, program managers, and more.
 
Come join us. https://www.hingehealth.design/
 
As a senior product designer you will be responsible for owning a large surface area at Hinge Health from road mapping, to strategy, to launching features that will engage, empower, and delight our users. You will create innovative and creative design solutions that make our MSK interventions elegant and persuasive user experiences that change member’s behaviors and lives and help our care team provide great care to our members. You will lead as a strong systems thinker, crafting our user experience, interaction patterns and guidelines to promote a unified design language across all touch points. As well as, bringing practice improvement, thought leadership, creative thinking, and mentorship for less experienced designers. You will have a direct impact in improving the lives of people struggling with muscular skeletal health conditions. 

This role is responsible for delivering feature-level work in the education pod independently. They will be defining the feature strategy on how education content is delivered to members, how they consume the content, and how they retrieve for future reference. They will also work to evolve existing content and work closely with the creators to bridge content creation and product.

lists.content:
• Lead product experience creative vision; identify and visualize opportunities to up-level our products, experiences to benefit our users and our brand
  • Design layouts, UI, interaction patterns, visual design, and system components
  • Communicate design vision and interaction with prototypes, presentations, and mocks
  • Identify needs and key opportunities for user input; help plan and conduct user research with our user research team with contextual interviews, think-alouds, A/B tests, surveys and analysis
  • Lead the development and delivery of solutions that meet intended goals and creating outcomes that positively impact key metrics
  • Collaborate with engineers, product managers, careteams and other designers to ensure designs drive desired UX, business, and technical outcomes
  • Evangelizing design practices and finds opportunities to elevate confidence in our work across the larger company

• 7+ years of product/service design experience
  • A portfolio demonstrating: shipment of multiple products/large feature sets successfully; strong expertise in interaction design; ability to design with strong information hierarchy, layout, composition, and typography.
  • Strong at building visual systems and practices, including layout, iconography, typography and have a curiosity and eye for pushing visual design in interfaces forward
  • Self-directed and able to manage multiple complex priorities in a timely manner
  • An ability to receive critique gracefully and provide thoughtful critique to others
  • Experience in leading product design from opportunity development, to concept, to shipment
  • Comfortable presenting work and using design to build alignment, having direct influence and impact on product direction
  • Strong prototyping experience at multiple levels of fidelity 
  • The ability to design and document user flows and design components at a system level
  • Familiarity user research practices and ability translate insights into actions
  • Bachelor's or master's degree in interaction design, industrial design,  product design, service design, human-computer interaction, or equivalent experience

Work From Anywhere

About the Role
We are looking for an experienced Senior Product Manager to lead our Marketing Technology team. Ideally you have a passion for building marketing technologies to reach millions of users, and helping a company deliver the right message to the right user at the right time. You will help us drive market research, audit our product and services, and craft a product strategy for how marketing technology can be leveraged to help Hinge Health inspire more people to reduce their pain. You will work closely with engineering to set priorities and drive the implementation of your product strategy. Additionally, you’ll partner with Growth Marketing to help us execute on our marketing initiatives and experiments. 

If you have a proven track record of building and implementing a best-in-class marketing technology stack, care about understanding and delivering value to consumers, and are passionate about helping people move beyond chronic pain, we’d love to meet you.

lists.content:
• Build and develop a product strategy for our Marketing Technology Pod that will enable Hinge Health to  send 100,000,000+ messages a year! 
  • Help innovate and drive new ways of marketing our products as well as work to keep users engaged over time. 
  • Work collaboratively with partners throughout the organization to maximize the impact Hinge Health can have in reducing people’s pain
  • Work across multiple channels like email, direct mail, SMS, and push notifications
  • Be the product expert for all things communication and marketing technology

• 4+ years of product management experience, preferably building internal tools and platforms
  • Experience in building marketing technology and growth platforms to support one or more: Landing pages, Email, Push, SMS, and automated campaigns
  • Experience working with Marketing to understand their current workflows and help improve marketing quality and velocity
  • Ability to prioritize and scope marketing requests balancing long-term vision against short-term pain points and optimizations 
  • Ability to help manage and run sprints using tools like Jira, Asana, and other project management tools
  • Deep expertise with marketing automation tools like Braze, Iterable, Marketo
  • Able to analyze and measure the impact of projects using analytics tools like mixpanel, tableau, etc

• Inclusive healthcare and benefits: On top of comprehensive medical, dental, and vision coverage, we offer employees and their family members help with gender-affirming care, tools for family and fertility planning, and travel reimbursements if healthcare isn’t available where you live.
  • Planning for the future: Start saving for the future with our traditional or roth 401k retirement plan options which include a 2% company match.
  • Modern life stipends: Manage your own learning and development budget, use the mental health to support therapy costs, and lifestyle stipends to cover your favorite wellness services, and work-from-home equipment.
  • Flexible vacation and paid time off: Employees have flexibility to choose when, how, and why they take time off to rest and recharge. Exempt employees can take advantage of our flexible pto program. Nonexempt employees can utilize up to two weeks of sick time and up to 17 days of vacation per year, including mental health days.
  • Other compensation: At Hinge Health, we want every employee to be invested and rewarded in the future success of the company. All full-time positions are eligible for equity.

#LI-ME1

lists.content:
• As the Sr. Video Editor you will work closely with the Sr. Manager of Video Production to achieve the best final film outcome, with the goal of telling the story in the most effective and compelling way. 
  • Maintain video assets to include but not limited to interview footage, b-roll footage, stock footage, audio files and music files.
  • Cutting and rearranging scenes, QCing footage, collecting stakeholder feedback, implementing motion graphics, audio and/or captioning for accessibility, ensuring all delivery deadlines are met. 
  • Responsible for handoff of final video assets, published via our CMS and/or off-platform using Gdrive or hard-drives.
  • Work with the Creative Ops team to properly archive footage.
  • Make adjustments to video projects and various tier level projects.
  • Work with external vendors when necessary to receive and deliver HH video footage and creative assets. 
  • Work on internal and external video projects.
  • Assembling raw footage and transferring or uploading to a computer.
  • Mastery at following a script, screenplay or outline.
  • Inputting sound to enhance footage, which may include selecting music and writing voice-overs.
  • Inputting graphics to enhance footage.
  • Digitally splicing film and video and synchronizing them into one rough cut file.
  • Improving and correcting lighting, coloring and faulty footage.
  • Collaboration with Creative Directors to present a final product that matches his or her vision.

• 7+ years of video editing experience with a portfolio that showcases your strong skills video editing.
  • Creative experience in filmmaking, videography media, art, communication, photography, and technology. 
  • An understanding of all elements of producing a finished quality film or video.
  • Experience in working with film and video and training in video production and editing software, such as Adobe Premiere pro.
  • Keen attention to detail to ensure that final edit aligns with key themes or objectives.
  • Ability to multitask and work toward several milestones and on various projects simultaneously.
  • Ability to understand the desired outcome of a project and bring them to life.
  • Experience editing various video projects and inserting sound effects, music and transitions.
  • Proficient in creating concept boards and other visual representations of planned edits for video projects.
  • Excellent communication skills are required to have a solid understanding of project scope and implementation as well as communication with internal and external partners.
  • Ability to collaborate well with other creative professionals to produce and provide  high-quality finished and finalized products.

• A 0 to 1 mindset — you’re comfortable navigating ambiguity, partnering closely with product and engineering teammates to make decisions quickly, learn from them, and iterate. You aren’t afraid to put something out there to get rapid feedback.
  • Design innovator — you are excited to redefine a space by bringing novel, delightful ideas to the table. You are able to pull from unexpected sources of inspiration.
  • Master of many mediums — you design seamlessly across mobile, desktop, wearables and other interfaces

• Inclusive healthcare and benefits: On top of comprehensive medical, dental, and vision coverage, we offer help with gender-affirming care, tools for family and fertility planning, and travel reimbursements if healthcare isn’t available where you live
  • Modern life stipends: Manage your own learning and development budget and use the mental health and lifestyle stipends to cover your favorite wellness services, workout classes, gym subscriptions, and work-from-home equipment
  • Flexible vacation and paid time off: Full-time employees have full flexibility to choose when, how, and why they take time off to rest and recharge

descriptionPlain:
One in two people experience debilitating back, neck, shoulder, or joint pain — but traditional treatments have failed to meet their needs. Physical therapy can be expensive and hard to access; appointments often involve long commutes and missed work. Making matters worse, unresolved pain can trigger the overuse of opioids and surgeries.

Join us in reimagining healthcare from the ground up. We’re making high-quality care accessible by pairing wearable sensors and computer vision with a world-class clinical team. Hinge Health puts a digital clinic in every member's pocket. Now millions of people can access personalized digital care from a physical therapist, guidance on behavior change from a health coach, and expert consultations with an orthopedic surgeon. With a single app and wearable technology like our Enso device, we’re helping to reduce pain, surgeries, and opioid use.

About the Role
As a  Sr.Engineering Manager you'll manage a team of 10+ engineers to build, maintain and support a full stack system. Your team(s) will be tasked to solve several platform enablement/enhancement themed problems which will both directly and indirectly enable our core product engineering teams to deliver value faster to our users.


As a leader of your team(s) you will be responsible for being a steward of operational excellence and engineering rigor. Fostering a culture of extreme ownership and high quality engineering is key. You will have the opportunity to delve into the code, but your priorities will be to your reports and to the engineering organization.

Our Tech Stack
Nodejs, TypeScript, Nestjs, GraphQL, Docker, React, React Native, Rails, Aptible, AWS, Postgres, Redis, Apollo, and Redux.  Our workflow is trunk-based CI/CD.

lists.content:
• Coach and mentor engineers through day-to-day challenges and guide them towards long term professional and technical growth 
  • Lead your team in consistently delivering on a roadmap they collaboratively define
  • Motivate engineers and ensure high performance through constant feedback and identifying areas of improvementDevelop robust, effective plans addressing various technical and resource challenges within the organization
  • Lead organizational initiatives on improving workflow processes and resolving them with practical, lightweight, measurable process 
  • Scale the team with a strong focus on experience, technical proficiency, and diversity
  • Bring in automation focus from the start so that reliability is baked into the system

• 5+ years of Engineering Management experience in leading at least 8 plus engineers.
  • Leadership: Track record of ownership for team-scale execution and technical excellence. Experience managing 5+ direct reports at a given time. 
  • Delivery: Strong project management skills to ensure the whole team is on track throughout the sprint and can sustainably deliver high quality work. 
  • Domain Expertise: In depth experience building software applications and the ability to propose several routes to accomplish business goals. Experience in handling SaaS environments. 
  • Problem Solving: Ability to resolve interpersonal conflicts, and find creative resourcing solutions where others would see zero-sum tradeoffs
  • Communication: Clear, inclusive communication with both teammates and non-technical partners
  • BS degree in Computer Science, Engineering or relevant field

• Experience with Rails.
  • Experience with AWS.
  • Experience with Docker/Kubernetes
  • Experience with Healthcare domain

lists.content:
• Every day, you’ll review 2x more PRs than you open.
  • Every sprint, you’ll design and incrementally deliver meaningful, complex features. 
  • Every month, you’ll resolve a couple performance and scaling bottlenecks, balancing feature development with long-term tech investments to keep the platform healthy and nimble.
  • Every quarter, you’ll help define the objectives and key results that will shape your team’s roadmap.

• 5+ years of software engineering experience with backend/platform preference.
  • Experience with breaking up a monolithic application/services into microservices
  • Delivery: Ability to break big projects into small, testable pieces to consistently hit business-meaningful milestones  
  • Domain Expertise: Experience with distributed microservices architecture built in Docker containers utilizing Ruby on Rails and/or Nodejs/TypeScript
  • Experience with RESTful and GraphQL API
  • Experience with relational databases and caching systems
  • Experience working with CI/CD tools
  • Experience building fault-tolerant, distributed systems
  • Experience with message queues is a plus
  • Problem Solving: Business intuition that informs right-sized solutions, thoughtful trade offs, and game-changing innovation   
  • Communication: Clear, inclusive communication with both teammates and non-technical partners
  • Leadership: A track record of strong ownership, initiative, tenacity, integrity, and humility
  • BS degree in Computer Science, Engineering or relevant field

• Experience with Rails.
  • Experience with AWS.
  • Experience with Docker/Kubernetes.

descriptionPlain:
Hinge Health is building the world’s most patient-centered Digital Musculoskeletal (MSK) Clinic™. It is now the leading Digital MSK Clinic, used by four in five employers and 90% of health plans with a digital MSK solution. Hinge Health reduces MSK pain, surgeries, and opioid use by pairing advanced wearable sensors and computer vision technology with a comprehensive clinical care team of physical therapists, physicians, and board-certified health coaches. 

Hinge Health’s HingeConnect integrates with 750,000+ in-person providers and enables real-time interventions for elective MSK surgeries, driving proven medical claims reduction. Available to millions of members, Hinge Health is widely trusted by leading organizations, including Land O’Lakes, L.L. Bean, Salesforce, Self-Insured Schools of California, Southern Company, State of New Jersey, US Foods, and Verizon. Learn more at: http://www.hingehealth.com.


DATA ENGINEERING AT HINGE HEALTH 
 Data Engineers at Hinge Health are software engineers with expertise in data pipelines, OLTP & data warehouse schema design, data governance, ETL, RDBMS and NoSQL systems. Data Engineers are hands-on, building self-service tools and automation that enable application engineers and data analysts to manage, maintain, and secure their data systems with autonomy while adhering to best practices in a HIPAA environment. The ideal candidate thrives in a highly collaborative, cross functional environment.

Our stack:  Python, SQL, Airflow, PostgreSQL, MySQL, REST, Aptible, Docker, Tonic.ai, Terraform, Spark, Kafka, Fivetran, Databricks, AWS (S3, Lambda, Kinesis, RDS, Glue). Our workflow is trunk-based CI/CD, and our security/compliance posture is at the highest standards of healthcare, including HIPAA, HITRUST, SOC 2, CCPA.

description:
Hinge Health is building the world’s most patient-centered Digital Musculoskeletal (MSK) Clinic™. It is now the leading Digital MSK Clinic, used by four in five employers and 90% of health plans with a digital MSK solution. Hinge Health reduces MSK pain, surgeries, and opioid use by pairing advanced wearable sensors and computer vision technology with a comprehensive clinical care team of physical therapists, physicians, and board-certified health coaches. 

Hinge Health’s HingeConnect integrates with 750,000+ in-person providers and enables real-time interventions for elective MSK surgeries, driving proven medical claims reduction. Available to millions of members, Hinge Health is widely trusted by leading organizations, including Land O’Lakes, L.L. Bean, Salesforce, Self-Insured Schools of California, Southern Company, State of New Jersey, US Foods, and Verizon. Learn more at: http://www.hingehealth.com.


DATA ENGINEERING AT HINGE HEALTH 
 Data Engineers at Hinge Health are software engineers with expertise in data pipelines, OLTP & data warehouse schema design, data governance, ETL, RDBMS and NoSQL systems. Data Engineers are hands-on, building self-service tools and automation that enable application engineers and data analysts to manage, maintain, and secure their data systems with autonomy while adhering to best practices in a HIPAA environment. The ideal candidate thrives in a highly collaborative, cross functional environment.

Our stack:  Python, SQL, Airflow, PostgreSQL, MySQL, REST, Aptible, Docker, Tonic.ai, Terraform, Spark, Kafka, Fivetran, Databricks, AWS (S3, Lambda, Kinesis, RDS, Glue). Our workflow is trunk-based CI/CD, and our security/compliance posture is at the highest standards of healthcare, including HIPAA, HITRUST, SOC 2, CCPA.

*Given our company wide holiday break please expect to hear back from us no earlier than mid January*

lists.content:
• Create compliance strategies (HIPAA, GDPR, CCPA), tooling, processes, and coaching that enables service and application teams to take full ownership of their data in a growing organization
  • Architect and build data pipelines and data aggregation systems to deliver quality real-time and batch analytical reports
  • Participate in hiring and mentoring of team members
  • Assist and coach teams to optimize poorly performing data pipelines
  • Work with the SRE team to establish best practices around database monitoring, alerting, and availability

• 10+ years of software engineering experience, 6+ in data engineering
  • Mastery of SQL and Python
  • Solid background in processing and storing large scale data using distributed systems as well as a mastery of database designs and data warehousing
  • Good understanding of a broad spectrum of data stores like PostgreSQL, MySQL, MongoDB, Redis, Snowflake and Redshift
  • Experience building data pipelines using Spark, Kafka, Airflow
  • Knowledge of software engineering best-practice development (e.g., linting, testing)
  • Ability to collaborate and problem-solve across teams
  • Excellent communication skills, both written and verbal
  • Bachelor’s degree in C.S. or equivalent experience

• Experience building data infrastructure on AWS 
  • Prior DBA experience
  • Prior experience with healthcare data (PHI/PII/HIPAA)
  • Prior experience working with Kubernetes
  • Extensive NoSQL knowledge

descriptionPlain:
One in two people experience debilitating back, neck, shoulder, or joint pain — but traditional treatments have failed to meet their needs. Physical therapy can be expensive and hard to access; appointments often involve long commutes and missed work. Making matters worse, unresolved pain can trigger the overuse of opioids and surgeries.

Join us in reimagining healthcare from the ground up. We’re making high-quality care accessible by pairing wearable sensors and computer vision with a world-class clinical team. Hinge Health puts a digital clinic in every member's pocket. Now millions of people can access personalized digital care from a physical therapist, guidance on behavior change from a health coach, and expert consultations with an orthopedic surgeon. With a single app and wearable technology like our Enso device, we’re helping to reduce pain, surgeries, and opioid use.

Here at Hinge Health, we welcome all applicants and know a diverse team makes us better and stronger. We look for individuals who embody our leadership principles and we value varied experiences and skill sets. Beyond specific work experience, we also look for unique capabilities and skill sets that are key indicators an applicant will thrive in our fast-paced, frequently evolving environment. If this sounds like the kind of place you’d like to be part of, please apply - we would love to hear from you!

Work From Anywhere
Hinge Health employees have the flexibility to work remotely in hubs across the US, Canada, and Latin America or work from our offices in San Francisco, Portland, and Montreal.

About the Role
The Data Platform team is responsible for defining Data Management, Data Governance and ETLs to produce analyst-quality silver and gold datasets at organizational scale. This is an opportunity for a Data Warehouse Engineer to be a leader in a high performing team and work cross functionally to provide hands-on oversight of the data lake & data governance process and tools from ground up. The ideal candidate thrives in a highly collaborative, cross functional environment.

Our stack:  Python, SQL, Databricks, Airflow, PostgreSQL, MySQL, REST, Aptible, Docker, Tonic.ai, Terraform, Spark, Kafka, Fivetran, AWS (S3, Lambda, Kinesis, Aurora, Glue). Our workflow is trunk-based CI/CD, and our security/compliance posture is at the highest standards of healthcare including HIPAA, HITRUST, SOC 2, and CCPA.

#LI-KH1

lists.content:
• Collaborate closely with data owners, data scientists, product managers, and clinical researchers to define & implement ETL processes to generate silver and gold data sets.
  • Drive data catalog rollout by engaging with subject matter experts (SMEs) to document business, product and engineering data definitions.
  • Establish best practices in terms of tools and processes for data governance to improve data quality and transparency.
  • Create strategies, tooling, processes, and documentation that enable service and application teams to take full ownership of their data in a growing organization.

• 8+ years of data architect/engineer experience with focus on data modeling, data integration, master and metadata management, and analysis
  • Extensive hands-on experience in designing & implementing data warehouse models[ STAR, Snowflake etc], ELT, and ETL processes in the data lake ecosystem.
  • Experience with standardization best practices for integrating data, and security related to HIPAA and PHI data
  • Expert in SQL and Python
  • Good understanding of data stores like PostgreSQL, MySQL, MongoDB, Redis, Snowflake and Databricks
  • Knowledge of software engineering best-practice development (e.g., linting, testing)
  • Ability to collaborate and problem-solve across teams
  • Excellent communication skills, both written and verbal
  • Bachelor’s degree in C.S. or equivalent experience

• Experience building data infrastructure on AWS 
  • Prior DBA experience
  • Prior experience with healthcare data (PHI/PII/HIPAA)
  • Prior experience working with Apache Spark & Databricks 
  • Extensive NoSQL knowledge

• Inclusive healthcare and benefits: On top of comprehensive medical, dental, and vision coverage, we offer help with gender-affirming care, tools for family and fertility planning, and travel reimbursements if healthcare isn’t available where you live
  • Modern life stipends: Manage your own learning and development budget and use the mental health and lifestyle stipends to cover your favorite wellness services, workout classes, gym subscriptions, and work-from-home equipment
  • Flexible vacation and paid time off: Full-time employees have full flexibility to choose when, how, and why they take time off to rest and recharge

Hinge Health reduces MSK pain, surgeries, and opioid use by pairing advanced wearable sensors and computer vision technology with a comprehensive clinical care team of physical therapists, physicians, and board-certified health coaches.

Bean, Salesforce, Self-Insured Schools of California, Southern Company, State of New Jersey, US Foods, and Verizon. Learn more at: http://www.hingehealth.com.

Hinge Health engineers work on small interdisciplinary teams focused on different parts of the user journey. Quality engineers collaborate with pod mates to measure and raise the quality, reliability and maintainability of new and existing features. Senior quality engineers write automated tests, perform testing of frontend and backend tickets, create well-written bug tickets, ensure there are test plans defined for features, and mentor engineers on quality practices and skills. 

Our tech stack: Aptible, AWS, GraphQL, Postgres, Rails, React, ReactNative, Redis, Redux, Node and Typescript.  Our workflow is trunk-based CI/CD.  We deploy iOS and Android updates to users every two weeks. Our security/compliance posture is at the highest standards of healthcare, including HIPAA, HITRUST, SOC 2, CCPA.

Our automated testing frameworks: Appium (mobile), jest, mockserver, and Cypress. Tools: Github, SonarQube, Jira.

*Given our company wide holiday break please expect to hear back from us no earlier than mid January*

lists.content:
• Create thoughtful test strategies for a major cross platform or cross functional set of features that include multiple engineering teams and front-end and back-end technologies.
  • Ensure that each feature includes key user flows, release criteria, covers non-functional testing, automation, etc. which give each contributing pod a backlog of quality work.
  • Write and maintain automated API integration and UI end-to-end tests that are effective and reliable
  • Influence product and engineering leaders to adopt quality best practices and processes that have a measurable impact on end-user quality
  • Coordinate user experience end-to-end testing among other Quality Engineers and developers to ensure all scenarios have been tested
  • Work with your pod to define exhaustive acceptance criteria and test user stories and get to the last “Done” state
  • When necessary, perform manual release testing
  • Find defects before they reach customers and file clear bug reports
  • Mentor peers on the quality and engineering teams. Share your expertise with engineers in your pod(s) and in Engineering to ensure they’re equipped to write high quality automated tests for the betterment of our products. 
  • Participate in the hiring process as a key contributor to the final decision of senior positions

• Delivery: Ability to work alongside a cross-functional team to ensure the quality of each feature and sprint deliverables. Creates thorough test plans for complex features which could span multiple pods. In addition to performing hands on testing and test automation, you use your domain expertise and collaboration skills to support the pod in continuing to focus on quality throughout the sprint.
  • Domain Expertise: Experience with test automation, performance and load testing, and manual testing. Strong engineering skills with the ability to troubleshoot (and fix) small bugs. Constantly seeking to improve your technical abilities.
  • Problem Solving: Create resourceful solutions to optimize quality and reduce hands-on time by team within business constraints. Identify ways to automate and test which find bugs that will be fixed before code reaches the customer.
  • Communication: Succinct, respectful, active listening, strong comprehension, and the ability to write detailed test plans, bugs and Jira tickets. 
  • Data-driven: uses customer impact and data to positively influence process, testing and priority decisions such as which bugs to fix and which tests to automate
  • Leadership: Takes ownership of the quality of the features the pod is shipping. Advocates and educates the engineers to level up their own expertise and focus on quality. Uses dashboards and data to identify quality gaps and works with the pod to address them. 
  • A bachelor's degree in computer science or a related field

Since our founding in 2014, we've raised more than $800 million from leading investors, including Coatue and Tiger Global. We work with 1000 customers across every industry and the public sector — including Salesforce, Verizon, and the State of New Jersey — to give more than 23 million people access to the care they need. We’re positioned to continue leading the market with unmatched investments in clinical research, care innovation, machine learning, AI, and computer vision.

Diversity and inclusion:
We’re committed to building diverse teams that reflect the communities we serve. Visit hingehealth.com/diversity-equity-and-inclusion to learn more about what moves us. 



Hinge Health is an equal opportunity employer and prohibits discrimination and harassment of any kind. We make employment decisions without regards to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, age, veteran status, disability status, pregnancy, or any other basis protected by federal, state or local law. We also consider qualified applicants regardless of criminal histories, consistent with legal requirements.

We provide reasonable accommodations for candidates with disabilities. If you feel you need assistance or an accommodation due to a disability, let us know by reaching out to your recruiter.


Disclaimer:
There continues to be a significant increase in phishing attempts across all industries where fraudsters are impersonating real employees and sending fictitious job offers to applicants in a scheme to obtain sensitive information. Please note that we will never ask for your financial information at any part of the interview process including the post-offer stage, and will only correspond through @hingehealth.com domain email addresses.

If you encounter any suspicious activity, we recommend you cease all communication with the individual and consider reporting them to the US FBI Internet Crime Complaint Center. If you would like to verify the legitimacy of an email you received from our recruiting team, please forward it to security@hingehealth.com. 

*Please do not send resumes via email*

If you're interested - we'd love to hear from you.
additional:

descriptionPlain:
One in two people experience debilitating back, neck, shoulder, or joint pain — but traditional treatments have failed to meet their needs. Physical therapy can be expensive and hard to access; appointments often involve long commutes and missed work. Making matters worse, unresolved pain can trigger the overuse of opioids and surgeries.

Join us in reimagining healthcare from the ground up. We’re making high-quality care accessible by pairing wearable sensors and computer vision with a world-class clinical team. Hinge Health puts a digital clinic in every member's pocket. Now millions of people can access personalized digital care from a physical therapist, guidance on behavior change from a health coach, and expert consultations with an orthopedic surgeon. With a single app and wearable technology like our Enso device, we’re helping to reduce pain, surgeries, and opioid use.

Here at Hinge Health, we welcome all applicants and know a diverse team makes us better and stronger. We look for individuals who embody our leadership principles and we value varied experiences and skill sets. Beyond specific work experience, we also look for unique capabilities and skill sets that are key indicators an applicant will thrive in our fast-paced, frequently evolving environment. If this sounds like the kind of place you’d like to be part of, please apply - we would love to hear from you!

About the Role
As a Staff-level mobile application engineer with a good understanding of end-to-end systems that include a robust set of backend services, you will be responsible for architecting solutions for our Device Software team. You will propose and help implement elegant solutions for handling Bluetooth SMART (BLE) peripheral communications within our react-native mobile application, with your acute awareness of the inherent fragility of BLE communications in the contexts of updating peripheral firmware and ensuring accurate and timely communications with health care devices.  As a Staff engineer, you will be a technical software lead for our hardware/software integration team, working on the software experience that users will interact with to engage with our hardware motion sensors and our patented Enso pain relief device, as well as future hardware initiatives.

Staff engineers at Hinge Health collaborate with teammates to tackle the hardest features in a sprint and deliver foundational architecture improvements in small, safe patches. The ideal candidate thrives in a highly collaborative, cross functional environment where the end-to-end solution to a problem often involves effective cross-team communication.

Our software tech stack: Nodejs, TypeScript, Nestjs, GraphQL, Docker, React, React Native, Rails, Aptible, AWS, Postgres, Redis, Apollo, and Redux.  Our workflow is trunk-based CI/CD, and our security/compliance posture is at the highest standards of healthcare, including HIPAA, HITRUST, SOC 2, CCPA.

#LI-IR1

#LI-IR1

lists.content:
• Every day, you'll work collaboratively with your teammates and cross-pod neighbors to support our mission, and solve the organization's toughest problems while raising the bar for quality and innovation
  • Every sprint, you'll mentor and share your domain expertise with teammates and others developers in the organization
  • Every quarter, you'll work on groundbreaking technology; identify, propose, and execute a significant platform-wide upgrade or innovative change to workflows or tooling
  • Every year, you'll improve the lives of millions users across the world

• Education: Computer Science or equivalent Engineering university degree is required for this position 
  • Environment: At least 8 years’ experience developing software in an agile team environment, with a plus for experience working with remote or distributed teams.
  • Delivery: Consistent, on time, high quality delivery of architecture upgrades and elegant solutions to knotty features.  
  • Domain expertise: Deep expertise in Bluetooth SMART (BLE) communications in a react-native setting. With 4+ years of practical experience in this domain, must have a deep understanding of the react-native framework and how passing BLE data to/from native APIs can be optimized for the framework. 8+ years of experience developing mobile applications (both Android and iOS) that communicate with Bluetooth SMART/Low Energy peripherals. Knowledge of end-to-end solution design that includes robust back-end services is a strong plus.
  • Problem Solving: Breaks down large scale projects into loosely coupled subsystems or strategically sequenced milestones. Designs cost-effective solutions, innovates with rapid spikes, avoids “penny wise, pound foolish” trade offs.
  • Communication: Clear, inclusive communication with both teammates and non-technical partners. Mentors other team members effectively, helping them expand their reach over time.
  • Leadership: Able to propose major code or best practice upgrades, lead healthy discussions that improve the proposal, and lead adoption from the front. Works within compliance guidelines, makes long-term architecture decisions.

• Inclusive healthcare and benefits: On top of comprehensive medical, dental, and vision coverage, we offer help with gender-affirming care, tools for family and fertility planning, and travel reimbursements if healthcare isn’t available where you live
  • Modern life stipends: Manage your own learning and development budget and use the mental health and lifestyle stipends to cover your favorite wellness services, workout classes, gym subscriptions, and work-from-home equipment
  • Flexible vacation and paid time off: Full-time employees have full flexibility to choose when, how, and why they take time off to rest and recharge

Physical therapy can be expensive and hard to access; appointments often involve long commutes and missed work. Making matters worse, unresolved pain can trigger the overuse of opioids and surgeries.

Now millions of people can access personalized digital care from a physical therapist, guidance on behavior change from a health coach, and expert consultations with an orthopedic surgeon. With a single app and wearable technology like our Enso device, we’re helping to reduce pain, surgeries, and opioid use.

Work From Anywhere
Hinge Health employees have the flexibility to work remotely in hubs across the US, Canada, and Latin America or work from our offices in San Francisco, Portland, and Montreal.

About the Role
As a Staff Software Engineer, you will be a hands-on expert that takes on the most challenging technical implementations, mentors the team, and ensures that features are delivered on time and to specification. 
 
You will be part of a team responsible for shipping highly effective, engaging, and easy-to-use features for our mobile application. You’ll work closely with design and product teammates to help author the team’s strategic roadmap, create and prioritize a backlog of ready work, and seek and destroy blockers to daily progress to help your team maintain laser focus on its goals. 
 
The ideal candidate possesses extensive expertise in React Native application development and demonstrates strong project management skills to keep the team on track to deliver high-quality results on ambitious projects. Experience with native development for iOS and/or Android is highly desirable.

#LI-KH2

lists.content:
• Architect and implement new functionality and user experiences in the Hinge Health mobile application.
  • Engage with stakeholders to help author your team’s strategic roadmap and influence company strategy.
  • Work with your manager, product and design, to plan, execute, and deliver on sprint, quarterly and project goals.
  • To support your team’s continuous improvement, you’ll measure what matters most and lead blameless retros that convert insights into action.
  • Serve as a Subject Matter Expert to provide technical leadership and mentorship to your teammates, other teams and engineers.

• Environment: At least eight (8) years’ experience developing software in an agile team environment, with experience working with remote or distributed teams.
  • Full Stack Mobile: Expertise with React Native and significant experience working across the tech stack, specifically JS, React, and React Native. Native iOS and Android is highly desirable.
  • Delivery: Strong project management skills and a proven track record of taking these types of projects through all stages from inception to deployment.
  • Testing/Quality: Ability to understand and debug native code as well as performance tune mobile applications.
  • Communication: Strong technical and non-technical communication skills with the ability to articulate a vision to audiences of varying technical expertise and collaborate with stakeholders at all levels of the organization.
  • Leadership: Track record of ownership for team-scale execution and technical excellence.

• Inclusive healthcare and benefits: On top of comprehensive medical, dental, and vision coverage, we offer employees and their family members help with gender-affirming care, tools for family and fertility planning, and travel reimbursements if healthcare isn’t available where you live.
  • Planning for the future: Start saving for the future with our traditional or roth 401k retirement plan options which include a 2% company match.
  • Modern life stipends: Manage your own learning and development budget, use the mental health to support therapy costs, and lifestyle stipends to cover your favorite wellness services, and work-from-home equipment.
  • Flexible vacation and paid time off: Employees have flexibility to choose when, how, and why they take time off to rest and recharge. Exempt employees can take advantage of our flexible pto program. Nonexempt employees can utilize up to two weeks of sick time and up to 17 days of vacation per year, including mental health days.
  • Other compensation: At Hinge Health, we want every employee to be invested and rewarded in the future success of the company. All full-time positions are eligible for equity.

descriptionPlain:
One in two people experience debilitating back, neck, shoulder, or joint pain — but traditional treatments have failed to meet their needs. Physical therapy can be expensive and hard to access; appointments often involve long commutes and missed work. Making matters worse, unresolved pain can trigger the overuse of opioids and surgeries.

Join us in reimagining healthcare from the ground up. We’re making high-quality care accessible by pairing wearable sensors and computer vision with a world-class clinical team. Hinge Health puts a digital clinic in every member's pocket. Now millions of people can access personalized digital care from a physical therapist, guidance on behavior change from a health coach, and expert consultations with an orthopedic surgeon. With a single app and wearable technology like our Enso device, we’re helping to reduce pain, surgeries, and opioid use.

About the Role
Fullstack engineers at Hinge Health contribute to their team’s success by architecting and implementing end-to-end solutions, well-tested performant APIs and data models. In addition, team members will profile their systems to stay out ahead of scaling bottlenecks, and help maintain a high bar with thoughtful and constructive code reviews. Staff software engineers collaborate with teammates to tackle the hardest features in a sprint and deliver foundational architecture improvements in small, safe patches. The ideal candidate thrives in a highly collaborative, cross functional environment.

Our Tech Stack
Nodejs, TypeScript, Nestjs, GraphQL, Docker, React, React Native, Rails, Aptible, AWS, Postgres, Redis, Apollo, and Redux.  Our workflow is trunk-based CI/CD.

lists.content:
• Every day, you’ll work collaboratively with your teammates and cross-pod neighbors to support our mission. 
  • Every sprint, you’ll share your domain expertise with your teammates and others in the organization. 
  • Every month, you’ll tackle your team’s hardest problems.
  • Every quarter, you’ll identify, propose and execute a significant platform-wide upgrade or innovative change to our workflow or tooling.
  • Collaboratively roadmaps large tracks of work with reliable estimates that impact your teams.

• 7+ years of software engineering experience with backend/platform preference.
  • Experience with breaking up a monolithic application/services into microservices.
  • Delivery: Consistent, on time, high quality delivery of architecture upgrades and elegant solutions to knotty features.  
  • Domain expertise: Fluent with technologies and techniques to elegantly solve hard problems. 
  • Problem Solving: Breaks down large scale projects into loosely coupled subsystems or strategically sequenced milestones. Designs cost-effective solutions, innovates with rapid spikes, avoids “penny wise, pound foolish” trade offs.
  • Communication: Clear, inclusive communication with both teammates and non-technical partners
  • Leadership: Able to propose major code or best practice upgrades, lead healthy discussions that improve the proposal, and lead adoption from the front. Works within compliance guidelines, represents HH engineering in conferences & meetups, makes long-term architecture decision
  • BS degree in Computer Science, Engineering or relevant field

• Experience with Rails and willingness.
  • Experience with AWS
  • Experience with Docker/Kubernetes

Work From Anywhere
Hinge Health employees have the flexibility to work remotely in hubs across the US, Canada, and Latin America or work from our offices in San Francisco, Portland, and Montreal.

• Every day, you’ll work collaboratively with your teammates and cross-pod neighbors to support our mission. 
  • Every sprint, you’ll share your domain expertise with your teammates and others in the organization. 
  • Every month, you’ll tackle your team’s hardest problems.
  • Every quarter, you’ll identify, propose and execute a significant platform-wide upgrade or innovative change to our workflow or tooling.

• Environment: At least 8 years’ experience developing software in an agile team environment, with experience working with remote or distributed teams.
  • Delivery: Consistent, on time, high quality delivery of architecture upgrades and elegant solutions to knotty features.  
  • Domain expertise: Fluent with technologies and techniques to elegantly solve hard problems. 
  • Problem Solving: Breaks down large scale projects into loosely coupled subsystems or strategically sequenced milestones. Designs cost-effective solutions, innovates with rapid spikes, avoids “penny wise, pound foolish” trade offs.
  • Communication: Clear, inclusive communication with both teammates and non-technical partners
  • Leadership: Able to propose major code or best practice upgrades, lead healthy discussions that improve the proposal, and lead adoption from the front. Works within compliance guidelines, represents HH engineering in conferences & meetups, makes long-term architecture decision
  • BS degree in Computer Science, Engineering or relevant field

• Trust: We trust our teammates to always act in the team and company’s best interest. 
  • Hustle: We’re creative, we’re unrelenting, we find a way.
  • Effective communication: We’re prompt and concise. 
  • Learn-it-all (vs know-it-all): We’re always willing to learn. 
  • Frugal: We don’t waste money and especially not time.

• Inclusive healthcare and benefits: On top of comprehensive medical, dental, and vision coverage, we offer employees and their family members help with gender-affirming care, tools for family and fertility planning, and travel reimbursements if healthcare isn’t available where you live.
  • Planning for the future: Start saving for the future with our traditional or roth 401k retirement plan options which include a 2% company match.
  • Modern life stipends: Manage your own learning and development budget, use the mental health to support therapy costs, and lifestyle stipends to cover your favorite wellness services, and work-from-home equipment.
  • Flexible vacation and paid time off: Employees have flexibility to choose when, how, and why they take time off to rest and recharge. Exempt employees can take advantage of our flexible pto program. Nonexempt employees can utilize up to two weeks of sick time and up to 17 days of vacation per year, including mental health days.
  • Other compensation: At Hinge Health, we want every employee to be invested and rewarded in the future success of the company. All full-time positions are eligible for equity.

descriptionPlain:
Hinge Health is building the world’s most patient-centered Digital Musculoskeletal (MSK) Clinic™. It is now the leading Digital MSK Clinic, used by four in five employers and 90% of health plans with a digital MSK solution. Hinge Health reduces MSK pain, surgeries, and opioid use by pairing advanced wearable sensors and computer vision technology with a comprehensive clinical care team of physical therapists, physicians, and board-certified health coaches. 

Our Quality Engineering organization’s vision is to accelerate feature delivery to customers with confidence. Our mission is to reduce software quality risk at every stage of the SDLC by measuring & analyzing risk, implementing quality best practices and strategic test coverage. We do this by engaging early to develop robust test plans that ensure customer use cases are tested AND automated, identify quality metrics to guide successful feature rollouts. We also automate the release process to save human effort, reduce mistakes, and speed overall delivery.

As a Staff/Lead Automation Architect, you will work closely with other technical groups (developers, product owners, designers) to improve the software quality through automated and continuous testing. You will help define the appropriate test strategies, tools and best practices for automation processes. You will identify bottlenecks to the testing process and find solutions that remove developer frictions to quality and continuous integration. You will serve as a mentor to developers and other SDETs to improve test automation coverage, and help create, implement, maintain and improve automation test environments for multiple application platforms (web, mobile, backend services).

Fostering a culture of ownership, putting customers first and high quality engineering is key. 

Our tech stack: Aptible, AWS, GraphQL, Postgres, Rails, React, ReactNative, Redis, Redux, Node and Typescript.  Our workflow is trunk-based CI/CD.  We deploy iOS and Android updates to users every two weeks. For automation, we use Cypress, Appium and other tools such as SonarQube. Our security/compliance posture is at the highest standards of healthcare, including HIPAA, HITRUST, SOC 2, CCPA.

*Given our company wide holiday break please expect to hear back from us no earlier than mid January*

lists.content:
• Identify and implement high-impact solutions that alleviate top product quality issues and/or developer frictions that transform multiple feature teams
  • Partner with Product Managers, Engineering Managers, Developers and Quality Engineers to cultivate a “quality first” approach to software development
  • Develop robust, effective quality plans addressing various technical and quality challenges within the organization
  • Define quality processes in an SDLC, implement test frameworks, and present on quality best practices to the tech community
  • Balances quality with delivery to enable pods to ship early and often
  • Relentlessly seek and destroy time wasted on inefficient QA and maximize how RnD works
  • Mentor others to improve their quality mindset and testing capabilities

• Delivery: Successfully identify and roll out tools and process changes that improve development efficiency and product quality.
  • Domain expertise: Solid technical understanding of test automation infrastructure & tools, CI/CD pipelines, test methodologies. Technical chops that allow you to command the respect of your peers across the Engineering organization.
  • Problem solving: Ability to identify developer friction points and propose and execute high ROI solutions. Ability to identify risks to product quality (e.g. lack of performance testing, monitoring gaps) and propose solutions.
  • Communication: Clear, inclusive communication with both teammates and non-technical partners. Able to influence stakeholders to adopt new processes and techniques that will improve product quality.
  • Planning: Strong project management skills to ensure large-scale projects start and stay on track and can sustainably deliver high quality work. 
  • Leadership: Track record of ownership for org-scale execution and technical excellence.
  • Years of experience 10-15

You’ll have a unique opportunity to shape Hinge Health’s growth by leading a high performing team focused on developing and fostering partnerships with benefits consultants and channel partners. These strategic relationships are essential to drive our growth within the employer sponsored health care market.

#LI-TB2
description:
One in two people experience debilitating back, neck, shoulder, or joint pain — but traditional treatments have failed to meet their needs. Physical therapy can be expensive and hard to access; appointments often involve long commutes and missed work. Making matters worse, unresolved pain can trigger the overuse of opioids and surgeries.

Join us in reimagining healthcare from the ground up. We’re making high-quality care accessible by pairing wearable sensors and computer vision with a world-class clinical team. Hinge Health puts a digital clinic in every member's pocket. Now millions of people can access personalized digital care from a physical therapist, guidance on behavior change from a health coach, and expert consultations with an orthopedic surgeon. With a single app and wearable technology like our Enso device, we’re helping to reduce pain, surgeries, and opioid use.

Work From Anywhere
Hinge Health employees have the flexibility to work remotely in hubs across the United States.

lists.content:
• Lead and manage a team of direct reports, including hiring, onboarding, training, and talent development
  • Evaluate potential consultant, broker and ecosystem partners to collaborate with
  • Work with our legal and finance teams to negotiate agreements with partners
  • Work with Commercial Sales & Marketing to educate our partners on Hinge Health, develop sales pipeline, and improve win rate
  • Work with your team to develop national strategies with partners and build relationships with key stakeholders and executives
  • Collaborate with Customer Success to ensure successful implementation of our program, as well as renewals / upsells. 
  • Contribute to the product roadmap by providing feedback from our consultant and channel partnerships.

• Bachelor’s degree and 10-15 years work experience.
  • Background in managing strategic partnerships and working with benefit consultants
  • Strategic thinker that is continuously looking to drive toward strong and higher performing partnerships
  • Experience leading teams; managing strategic growth through a channel strategy 
  • History of consistently attaining / exceeding growth metrics
  • Excellent project management, organization, and communication skills
  • Comfortable working with the ambiguity of a fast-paced startup - ability to innovate, and solve problems creatively
  • Desire to learn, grow, develop, and mentor team members
  • Have a sense of humor and like to have fun. We work hard, but we laugh a lot too

• Inclusive healthcare and benefits: On top of comprehensive medical, dental, and vision coverage, we offer employees and their family members help with gender-affirming care, tools for family and fertility planning, and travel reimbursements if healthcare isn’t available where you live.
  • Planning for the future: Start saving for the future with our traditional or roth 401k retirement plan options which include a 2% company match.
  • Modern life stipends: Manage your own learning and development budget, use the mental health to support therapy costs, and lifestyle stipends to cover your favorite wellness services, and work-from-home equipment.
  • Flexible vacation and paid time off: Employees have flexibility to choose when, how, and why they take time off to rest and recharge. Exempt employees can take advantage of our flexible pto program. Nonexempt employees can utilize up to two weeks of sick time and up to 17 days of vacation per year, including mental health days.
  • Other compensation: At Hinge Health, we want every employee to be invested and rewarded in the future success of the company. All full-time positions are eligible for equity.
